Text

It was perhaps a fortunate thing for [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth that [[her]113-elizabeth ancestors]382-her ancestors went back to [the Conquest]1-the conquest , and that [she]113-elizabeth numbered at least [two Countesses]383-two countesses and [a Duchess]384-a duchess among [[her]113-elizabeth relatives]385-her relatives . [[Her]113-elizabeth father]386-her father had died some years ago , and , [[her]113-elizabeth mother]387-her mother being [an invalid]388-an invalid , [she]113-elizabeth had lived a good deal abroad . But , at about seventeen , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth began to pay visits among [[her]113-elizabeth kinsfolk]389-her kinsfolk . It was after arriving at [Nazeby Hall]2-nazeby hall , for a Cricket Week , that [she]113-elizabeth first wrote [home]390-home . [Nazeby Hall]2-nazeby hall , 26th July . Afternoon Tea [Dearest Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i got [here]391-here all right , without even a smut on [my]0-i face , for [Agnès]115-agnès tidied [me]0-i up in the brougham before [we]392-we arrived at the gate . The dust in [the train]393-the train was horrid . [It]2-nazeby hall is [a nice house]394-a nice house . [They]395-they were at tea when [I]0-i was ushered in ; it was in [the hall]396-the hall — [I]0-i suppose it was because it was so windy outside . There seemed to be [a lot of people]397-a lot of people [there]398-there ; and [they]397-a lot of people all stopped talking suddenly , and stared at [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were a new thing in [the Zoo]399-the zoo , and then , after a minute , went on with [their]397-a lot of people conversations at the point [they]397-a lot of people had left off . [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia pecked [my]0-i cheek , and gave [me]0-i two fingers ; and asked [me]0-i , in a voice right up at the top , how were [you]0-i . [I]0-i said [you]0-i were better , and — [you]0-i know what [you]0-i told [me]0-i to say . [She]116-lady cecilia murmured something while [she]116-lady cecilia was listening to what [a woman with a sweet frock and green eyes]400-a woman with a sweet frock and green eyes was saying at the other end of the table . There was heaps of tea . [She]116-lady cecilia waved vaguely for [me]0-i to sit down , which [I]0-i did ; but there was a footstool near , and it was half dark , so [I]0-i fell over that , but not very badly , and got safely to [my]0-i seat . [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia — continuing [her]116-lady cecilia conversation across [the room]401-the room all the time — poured out a cup of tea , with lumps and lumps of sugar in it , and lots of cream , just what [you]402-you would give to [a child]403-a child for a treat ! and [she]116-lady cecilia handed it to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i said , " Oh ! please , [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia , [I]0-i do n't take sugar ! "[0-i] [She]116-lady cecilia has such bulgy eyes , and [she]116-lady cecilia opened them wide at [me]0-i , perfectly astonished , and said , " Oh ! then please ring the bell ; [I]116-lady cecilia do n't believe there is another clean cup . "[116-lady cecilia] [Everybody]404-everybody stopped talking again , and looked at [me]0-i , and [the green - eyed lady]405-the green - eyed lady giggled — and [I]0-i rang the bell , and this time did n't fall over anything , and so presently [I]0-i got some tea . Just as [I]0-i was enjoying such a nice cake , and watching [all the people]406-all the people , [quite a decent man]407-quite a decent man came up and sat down behind [me]0-i . [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia had not introduced [me]0-i to [anybody]408-anybody , and [he]407-quite a decent man said , " Have [you]0-i come a long way ? "[407-quite a decent man] And [I]0-i said , " Yes . "[0-i] And [he]407-quite a decent man said , " It must have been dusty in [the train]393-the train , "[407-quite a decent man] and [I]0-i said it was — and [he]407-quite a decent man was beginning to say something more , when [the woman with the green eyes]409-the woman with the green eyes said , " [Harry]117-harry , do hand [me]409-the woman with the green eyes the cucumber sandwiches , "[409-the woman with the green eyes] and so [he]407-quite a decent man had to get up , and just then [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor came in , and [he]118-sir trevor was glad to see [me]0-i . [He]118-sir trevor is [a jolly soul]410-a jolly soul , and [he]118-sir trevor said [I]0-i was eight when [he]118-sir trevor last saw [me]0-i , and seemed quite surprised [I]0-i had grown any taller since ! Just as though [people]411-people could stay at eight ! Then [he]118-sir trevor patted [my]0-i cheek , and said , " [You]0-i 're [a beauty]3094-a beauty , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth , "[118-sir trevor] and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia 's eyes bulged at [him]118-sir trevor a good deal , and [she]116-lady cecilia said to [me]0-i , " Would n't [you]0-i like to see [[your]0-i room]3095-your room ? "[116-lady cecilia] and [I]0-i said [I]0-i was n't a bit in a hurry , but [she]116-lady cecilia took [me]0-i off , and here [I]0-i am ; and [I]0-i am going to wear [my]0-i pink silk for dinner , and will finish this by - and - by . 12.30.—Well , [I]0-i have had dinner , and [I]0-i found out a good many of [their]412-their names — [they]412-their mostly arrived yesterday . [The woman with the green eyes]409-the woman with the green eyes is [Mrs. de Yorburgh - Smith]119-mrs. smith . [I]0-i am sure [she]409-the woman with the green eyes is [a pig]414-a pig . [He]415-the quite decent man is playing in [[the Nazeby Eleven .]418-the nazeby eleven .]418-the nazeby eleven . There is [a woman [I]0-i like]420-a woman i like , with stick - out teeth ; [her]420-a woman i like name is [Mrs. Vavaseur]120-mrs. vavaseur . [She]420-a woman i like knows [you]421-you , and [she]420-a woman i like is awfully nice , though so plain , and [she]420-a woman i like never looks either over [your]421-you head , or all up and down , or talks to [you]421-you when [she]420-a woman i like is thinking of something else . There are [heaps more women]422-heaps more women , and [the eleven men]423-the eleven men , so [we]424-we are [a party of about twenty - five]425-a party of about twenty - five ; but [you]421-you will see [their]423-the eleven men names in the paper . [Such a bore]426-such a bore took [me]0-i in ! [He]427-he began about the dust again , but [I]0-i could not stand that , so [I]0-i said that [every one]428-every one had already asked [me]0-i about it . So [he]427-he said " Oh ! "[427-he] and went on with [his]427-he soup . [The Cricket Talk At the other side]429-the cricket talk at the other side was another of [the Eleven]430-the eleven , and [he]427-he said , Did [I]0-i like cricket ? And [I]0-i said , No , [I]0-i hated always having to field ( which was what [I]0-i did , [you]421-you know , when [I]0-i played with [the Byrne boys at [Biarritz]4-biarritz]431-the byrne boys at biarritz ) ; and [I]0-i asked [him]427-he if [he]427-he was [a good player]432-a good player , and [he]427-he said " No , "[427-he] so [I]0-i said [I]0-i supposed [he]427-he always had to field too , then ; and [he]427-he said , No , that sometimes [they]433-they allowed [him]427-he a bat , and so [I]0-i said [I]0-i was sure that was n't the same game [I]0-i played ; and [he]427-he laughed as if [I]0-i had said something funny — [his]427-he name is [Lord George Lane]121-lord george lane — and [the other one]434-the other one laughed too , and [they]434-the other one both looked idiots , and so [I]0-i did not say any more about that . But [we]435-we talked on all the time , and [every one else]436-every one else seemed to be having such fun , and [they]436-every one else all call [each other]437-each other by pet names , and shorten up all [their]436-every one else adjectives ( it is adjectives [I]0-i mean , not adverbs ) . [I]0-i am sure [you]438-you made a mistake in what [you]438-you told [me]0-i , that [all well - bred people]439-all well - bred people behave nicely at dinner , and sit up , because [they]439-all well - bred people do n't a bit ; lots of [them]439-all well - bred people put [their]439-all well - bred people elbows on the table , and nearly all sat anyhow in [their]436-every one else chairs . Only [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia and [Mrs. Vavaseur]120-mrs. vavaseur behaved like [you]438-you ; but then [they]434-the other one are both quite old — over forty . [They]436-every one else all talk about things that [no stranger]440-no stranger could understand , but [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i shall pick it up presently . And after dinner , in [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room , [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia did introduce [me]0-i to [two girls]442-two girls — [the Roose girls]443-the roose girls — [you]438-you know . Well , [Lady Jane]122-jane is the best of [the two]444-the two ; [Lady Violet]123-lady violet is [a lump]445-a lump . [They]434-the other one both poke [their]434-the other one heads , and [Jane]122-jane turns in [her]122-jane toes . [They]434-the other one have rather the look in [their]434-the other one eyes of [people with tight boots]446-people with tight boots . [Violet]123-lady violet said , " Do [you]0-i bicycle ? "[123-lady violet] and [I]0-i said , " Yes , sometimes ; "[123-lady violet] and [she]123-lady violet said , with a big gasp : " [Jane]122-jane and [I]123-lady violet adore it . [We]448-we have been ten miles since tea with [Captain Winchester]124-captain winchester and [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz . "[123-lady violet] [An African Millionaire]447-an african millionaire [I]0-i did not think that interesting , but still [we]448-we talked . [They]434-the other one asked [me]0-i stacks of questions , but did not wait for the answers much . [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz is [the African millionaire]449-the african millionaire . [He]125-mr. wertz does not play cricket , and , when [the men]450-the men came in afterwards , [he]125-mr. wertz crossed over to [us]448-we , and [Jane]122-jane introduced [him]125-mr. wertz to [me]0-i when [he]125-mr. wertz had talked a little . [He]125-mr. wertz is quite [a sort of gentleman]451-a sort of gentleman , and is very much at [home]390-home with [every one]428-every one . [He]125-mr. wertz laughed at everything [I]0-i said . [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith ( such bosh putting " de Yorburgh "[119-mrs. smith] on ! ) sat on a big sofa with [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , and [she]119-mrs. smith opened and shut [her]119-mrs. smith eyes at [him]126-lord valmond , and [Jane Roose]127-jane roose says [she]127-jane roose takes [[every one]428-every one 's friend]455-every one 's friend away ; and [Lord George Lane]121-lord george lane came up , and [we]456-we talked , and [he]121-lord george lane was n't such [an idiot]457-an idiot as at dinner , and [he]121-lord george lane has nice teeth . [All the rest]458-all the rest , except [the Rooses]128-the rooses and [me]0-i , are married — [the women]459-the women , [I]0-i mean — except [Miss La Touche]129-miss la touche , but [she]129-miss la touche is just the same , because [she]129-miss la touche sits with [the married lot]460-the married lot , and [they]460-the married lot all chat together , and [Violet Roose]130-violet roose says [she]130-violet roose is a cat , but [I]0-i think [she]129-miss la touche looks nice ; [she]129-miss la touche is so pretty , and [her]129-miss la touche hair is done at the right angle , because it is like [Agnès]115-agnès does [mine]0-i , and [she]129-miss la touche has nice scent on ; and [I]0-i hope it wo n't rain to - morrow , and good - night , [dear Mamma.—Your affectionate daughter]461-dear mamma.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [P.S.—Jane Roose]131-p.s.—jane roose says [Miss La Touche]129-miss la touche will never get married ; [she]129-miss la touche is too smart , and [[all the married women]462-all the married women 's men]463-all the married women 's men talk to [her]129-miss la touche , and that the best tone is to look rather dowdy ; but [I]0-i do n't believe it , and [I]0-i would rather be like [Miss La Touche]129-miss la touche . E. [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth received an immediate reply to [her]113-elizabeth letter , and the next one began : [Nazeby Hall]2-nazeby hall , 28th July . Dearest Mamma,—I am sorry [you]464-you find [I]0-i use bad grammar and write incoherently , and [you]464-you do n't quite approve of [my]0-i style ; but [you]464-you see it is just because [I]0-i am in a hurry . [I]0-i do n't speak it ; but if [I]0-i must stop to think of grammar and that , [I]0-i should never get on to tell [you]464-you what [I]0-i am doing [here]391-here , so do , dear [Mamma]132-mamma , try and bear it bravely . Well , [everybody]404-everybody came down to breakfast yesterday in a hat , and [every one]428-every one was late — that is , [every one who came down at all]468-every one who came down at all , [the rest]469-the rest had [theirs]469-the rest [upstairs]470-upstairs . The Cricket Match The cricket began , and it was really a bore . [We]471-we sat in [a tent]472-a tent , and [all the nice men]473-all the nice men were fielding ( it is always like that ) , and [the married lot]460-the married lot sat together , and talked about [their]460-the married lot clothes , and [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine read a book . [She]133-lady doraine is pretty too , but has big ears . [[Her]133-lady doraine husband]475-her husband is somewhere else , but [she]133-lady doraine does not seem to miss [him]475-her husband ; and [the Rooses]128-the rooses told [me]0-i [her]133-lady doraine hair used to be black , and that they have not a penny in [the world]476-the world , so [I]0-i think [she]133-lady doraine must be clever and nice to be able to manage [her]133-lady doraine clothes so well . They are perfectly lovely , and [I]0-i heard [her]133-lady doraine say [[her]133-lady doraine maid]477-her maid makes them . [Miss La Touche]129-miss la touche happened to be next [me]0-i , so [she]129-miss la touche spoke to [me]0-i , and said [my]0-i hat was " too devey for words "[129-miss la touche] ( the blue one [you]478-you got at [Caroline]134-carry 's ) ; and by - and - by [we]479-we had lunch , and at lunch [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond came and sat by [me]0-i , and so [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith did too , and [she]119-mrs. smith gushed at [me]0-i . [He]126-lord valmond seemed rather put out about something — [I]0-i suppose it was having to field all the time.—and [she]119-mrs. smith talked to [him]126-lord valmond across [me]0-i , and [she]119-mrs. smith called [him]126-lord valmond " [Harry]117-harry "[119-mrs. smith] lots of times , and [she]119-mrs. smith always says things that have another meaning . But [they]480-they all do that — repeat [each other]437-each other 's Christian names in a sentence , [I]0-i mean — just like [you]478-you said that [middle - class people]482-middle - class people did when [you]478-you were young , so [I]0-i am sure everything must have changed now . Well , after lunch , [all the people in [the county]484-the county]483-all the people in the county seemed to come ; [some of [them]483-all the people in the county]485-some of them had driven endless miles , and [we]486-we sat apart , [I]0-i suppose to let [them]483-all the people in the county see how ordinary [we]486-we thought [them]483-all the people in the county ; and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia was hardly polite , and [the others]487-the others were more or less rude ; but presently something happened — [I]0-i do n't know what — and [the nice men]488-the nice men had not to field any more . Perhaps [they]488-the nice men could not stand it any longer , and so [every one who had been yawning]489-every one who had been yawning woke up , and [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz , who had been writing letters all this time , appeared , and [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine made room for [him]125-mr. wertz beside [her]133-lady doraine , and [they]488-the nice men talked ; and when [[our]486-we Eleven]490-our eleven had drunk something [they]488-the nice men came and lay on the grass near [us]486-we , and [we]486-we had such a nice time . There is [a beautiful man]491-a beautiful man here , and [his]491-a beautiful man name is [Sir Dennis Desmond]135-sir dennis , and [[his]491-a beautiful man grandfather]492-his grandfather was [an Irish King]493-an irish king , and [he]491-a beautiful man talks to [me]0-i all the time , and [[his]491-a beautiful man mother]494-his mother looks at [him]491-a beautiful man and frowns ; and [I]0-i think it silly of [her]494-his mother , do n't [you]495-you ? And if [I]0-i were [a man]496-a man [I]0-i would n't visit with [[my]0-i mother]497-my mother if [she]494-his mother frowned at [me]0-i . Do [you]495-you know [her]494-his mother ? [She]494-his mother dresses as if [she]494-his mother were as young as [I]0-i am . [She]494-his mother had a blue muslin on this morning , and [her]494-his mother hair is red with green stripes in it , and [she]494-his mother is all white with thick pink cheeks , and across [the room]401-the room [she]494-his mother does n't look at all bad ; but close ! Goodness gracious [she]494-his mother looks a hundred ! And [I]0-i would much sooner have nice white hair and a cap than look like that , would n't [you]495-you ? [I]0-i 'll finish this when [I]0-i come to bed . [Sir Dennis Desmond]135-sir dennis 12.30.—What do [you]495-you think has happened ? [Sir Dennis]135-sir dennis sat beside [me]0-i on the sofa just as [he]135-sir dennis did last night — but [I]0-i forget , [I]0-i have not yet told [you]495-you of yesterday and last night ; but never mind now , [I]0-i must get on . Well , [he]135-sir dennis said [I]0-i was [a perfect darling]499-a perfect darling , but that [he]135-sir dennis never could get a chance to say a word to [me]0-i alone , but that if [I]0-i would only drop [my]0-i glove outside [my]0-i door it would be all right ; and [I]0-i thought that such a ridiculous thing to say , that [I]0-i could n't help laughing , and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia happened to be passing , and so [she]116-lady cecilia asked [me]0-i what [I]0-i was laughing at , and so [I]0-i told [her]116-lady cecilia what [he]135-sir dennis had said , and asked why ? There happened to be a pause just then and , as one has to speak rather loud to [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia to attract [her]116-lady cecilia attention , [every one]428-every one heard , and [they]428-every one all looked flabergasted ; and then [all]501-all shrieked with laughter , and [Sir Dennis]135-sir dennis said so crossly , " [Little fool]3096-little fool ! "[135-sir dennis] and [Lady Desmond]136-lady desmond simply glared at [me]0-i , and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia said , " Really , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth ! "[116-lady cecilia] and [Sir Dennis]135-sir dennis got purple in the face , and [Jane Roose]127-jane roose whispered , " How could [you]135-sir dennis dare with [[his]135-sir dennis wife]3097-his wife listening ! "[127-jane roose] and [every one]428-every one talked and chaffed . It was too stupid about nothing ; but the astonishing part is , that funny old thing [I]0-i thought was [the mother]503-the mother turns out to be [[his]135-sir dennis wife]3097-his wife ! Imagine ! years and years older than [him]135-sir dennis ! [Jane Roose]127-jane roose said [he]135-sir dennis had to marry [her]127-jane roose because [[her]127-jane roose husband]475-her husband died ; but [I]0-i think that the most absurd reason [I]0-i ever heard , do n't [you]506-you ? [Lots of [people]411-people 's husbands]507-lots of people 's husbands die , and [they]507-lots of people 's husbands do n't have to get married off again at once — so why should that ugly old thing , specially when there are such heaps of [nice girls]509-nice girls about ? [A Man of [Honour Jane Roose]127-jane roose]510-a man of honour jane roose said it was so honourable of [him]135-sir dennis , but [I]0-i call it crazy — unless , perhaps , [he]135-sir dennis was [a great friend of [the husband]512-the husband]511-a great friend of the husband 's , who made [him]135-sir dennis promise when [he]135-sir dennis was dying , and [he]135-sir dennis did not like to break [his]135-sir dennis word . Best love from [[your]515-your affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Nazeby Hall]2-nazeby hall , 30th July . [Dearest Mamma,—Yesterday]137-dearest mamma,—yesterday was the best day [we]517-we have had yet ; [the nice men]488-the nice men had not to field at all , and the stupid cricket was over at four o'clock , and so [we]517-we went into [the gardens]519-the gardens and lay in hammocks , and [Miss La Touche]129-miss la touche had such nice shoes on , but [her]129-miss la touche ankles are thick . [Ghosts]138-ghosts in [the Corridor]520-the corridor [The Rooses]128-the rooses told [me]0-i it was n't " quite nice "[138-ghosts] for [girls]521-girls to loll in hammocks ( and [they]521-girls sat on chairs)—that [you]522-you could only do it when [you]522-you are married ; but [I]0-i believe it is because [they]521-girls do n't have pretty enough petticoats . Anyway , [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [that horrid Smith creature]523-that horrid smith creature made a place for [me]0-i in [the empty hammock between [them]521-girls]524-the empty hammock between them , and , as [I]0-i knew [my]0-i " frillies "[133-lady doraine] were all right , [I]0-i hammocked too , and it was lovely . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz were lying near , and [they]521-girls said agreeable things , at least [I]0-i suppose so , because [both of [them]521-girls]525-both of them — [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith — looked purry - purry - puss - puss . [They]521-girls asked [me]0-i why [I]0-i was so sleepy , and [I]0-i said because [I]0-i had not slept well the last night — that [I]0-i was sure [the house]526-the house was haunted . And so [they]521-girls all screamed at [me]0-i , " Why ? "[521-girls] and so [I]0-i told [them]521-girls , what was really true , that in the night [I]0-i heard a noise of stealthy footsteps , and as [I]0-i was not frightened [I]0-i determined to see what it was , so [I]0-i got up — [Agnès]115-agnès sleeps in [the dressing - room]527-the dressing - room , but , of course , [she]115-agnès never wakes — [I]0-i opened the door and peeped out into [the corridor]520-the corridor . There are only [two rooms beyond [mine]0-i towards the end , round the corner]529-two rooms beyond mine towards the end , round the corner , and [it]529-two rooms beyond mine towards the end , round the corner is dimly lit all night . Well , [I]0-i distinctly saw [a very tall grey figure]530-a very tall grey figure disappear round the bend of [the hall]396-the hall ! When [I]0-i got thus far [every one]428-every one dropped [their]428-every one books and listened with rapt attention , and [I]0-i could see [them]428-every one exchanging looks , so [I]0-i am sure [they]428-every one know it is haunted , and were trying to keep it from [me]0-i . [I]0-i asked [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith if [she]119-mrs. smith had seen or heard anything , because [she]119-mrs. smith sleeps in [one of [the rooms]534-the rooms]533-one of the rooms . [She]119-mrs. smith looked perfectly green , but [she]119-mrs. smith said [she]119-mrs. smith had not heard a sound , and had slept like a top , and that [I]0-i must have dreamt it . Then [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [every one]428-every one talked at once , and [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond asked did [any one]536-any one know if the [London]5-london evening papers had come . But [I]0-i was not going to be put off like that , so [I]0-i just said , " [I]0-i know [you]3098-you all know it is haunted and are putting [me]0-i off because [you]3098-you think [I]0-i 'll be frightened ; but [I]0-i assure [you]3098-you [I]0-i am not , and if [I]0-i hear the noise again [I]0-i am going to rush out and see the ghost close . "[0-i] Then [every one]428-every one looked simply ahuri . So [I]0-i mean to get the ghost story out of [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor to - night after dinner — [I]0-i had not a chance yesterday — as [I]0-i am sure it is interesting . [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith looked at [me]0-i as if [she]119-mrs. smith wanted to poison [me]0-i , and [I]0-i ca n't think why specially , can [you]538-you ? Twelve p.m.—I asked [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor if [the house]526-the house is haunted , and [he]118-sir trevor said , " God bless [my]118-sir trevor soul , no ! "[118-sir trevor] and so [I]0-i told [him]118-sir trevor , and [he]118-sir trevor nearly had a fit ; so [I]0-i know it is , but [I]0-i am not [a bit frightened.—Your affectionate daughter]540-a bit frightened.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Nazeby Hall]2-nazeby hall , Sunday . [Dearest Mamma,—Agnès]139-dearest mamma,—agnès and [I]0-i go to [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary 's by [the 10:30 train]541-the 10:30 train to - morrow , and [I]0-i am not a bit sorry , although [I]0-i have enjoyed [myself]0-i , and now [I]0-i begin to feel quite at [home]390-home with [every one]428-every one — at least , some of them ; but such a tiresome thing happened last night . It was like this : After dinner it was so hot that [we]544-we all went out on [the terrace]545-the terrace , and , as soon as [we]544-we got [there]398-there , [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith and [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [the rest]469-the rest said it was too cold , and went in again ; but the moon was pretty , so [I]0-i stayed alone , and presently [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond came out , and stood beside [me]0-i . There is such a nice view , [you]548-you remember , from there , and [I]0-i did n't a bit want to talk . A Kiss and a Blow [He]126-lord valmond said something , but [I]0-i was n't listening , when suddenly [I]0-i did hear [him]126-lord valmond say this : " [You]0-i adorable enfant terrible , come out and watch for ghosts to - night ; and [I]126-lord valmond will come and play [the ghost]3099-the ghost , and console [you]0-i if [you]0-i are frightened ! "[126-lord valmond] And [he]126-lord valmond put [his]126-lord valmond horrid arm right round [my]0-i waist , and kissed [me]0-i — somewhere about [my]0-i right ear — before [I]0-i could realise what [he]126-lord valmond was at ! [I]0-i was in a rage , as [you]548-you can fancy , [Mamma]132-mamma , so [I]0-i just turned round and gave [him]126-lord valmond the hardest slap [I]0-i could , right on the cheek ! [He]126-lord valmond was furious , and called [me]0-i [a " little devil]3100-a " little devil , "[126-lord valmond] and [we]549-we both walked straight into [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i looked savage , and in the light [I]0-i could see [he]126-lord valmond had great red finger marks on [his]126-lord valmond face . Anyway , [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith , who was sitting on the big sofa near the window alone , looked up , and said in an odious voice , that made [every one]428-every one listen , " [I]119-mrs. smith am afraid , [Harry]117-harry , [you]117-harry have not enjoyed cooing in the moonlight ; it looks as if [our]549-we sweet Elizabeth had been difficult , and had boxed [your]117-harry ears ! "[119-mrs. smith] That made [me]0-i wild , the impudence ! That parvenue calling [me]0-i by [my]0-i Christian name ! So [I]0-i just lost [my]0-i temper right out , and said to [her]119-mrs. smith , " It is perfectly true what [you]119-mrs. smith say , and [I]0-i will box [yours]119-mrs. smith if [you]119-mrs. smith call [me]0-i ' [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth ' again ! "[0-i] Tableau ! [She]119-mrs. smith almost fainted with astonishment and fury , and when [she]119-mrs. smith could get [her]119-mrs. smith voice decent enough to speak , [she]119-mrs. smith laughed and said — " What [a charming savage]3101-a charming savage ! "[119-mrs. smith] [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond in [Disgrace]6-disgrace And then [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia did a really nice thing , which shows that [she]116-lady cecilia is [a brick]552-a brick , in spite of having bulgy eyes , and being absent and tiresome . [London]5-london out of Season Dearest [Mamma,—The train from [Nazeby]8-nazeby]556-mamma,—the train from nazeby was so late and [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary seemed to think it was [my]0-i fault — so unreasonable of [her]140-aunt mary , just because [they]554-they had waited lunch for [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n't believe [I]0-i like visiting very near relations as much as [ones further off]557-ones further off . [They]554-they feel [they]554-they can say anything to [you]558-you . [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i have only got to sleep [here]391-here the one night . [I]0-i had not eaten [my]0-i omelette before [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary began about [my]0-i hair . [She]140-aunt mary said of course it was very nice curling like that , but it was a pity [I]0-i did not wear a net over it all to keep it more tidy . [She]140-aunt mary was sure [you]558-you spoilt [me]0-i , even though [we]560-we are rich , letting [me]0-i have such smart clothes . [She]140-aunt mary had heard from [Nazeby]8-nazeby , that [I]0-i had had on a fresh frock every day . [I]0-i do n't know who could have written to [her]140-aunt mary . [She]140-aunt mary has got to look much older in the two years [we]560-we have been abroad and the corners of [her]140-aunt mary mouth shut with a snap . Perhaps it is having to spend part of the year with [[her]140-aunt mary mother - in - law]561-her mother - in - law . [Cousinly Curiosity Lettice]142-lettice and [Clara]143-clara are just the same as [they]562-they were , not a bit of difference since [they]562-they came out . [They]562-they are as tidy as can be , not a hair escapes from [their]562-they nets ! and [their]562-they heads look as if [they]562-they had dozens of hairpins in them , and because it is out of the season [they]562-they have gone back to [their]562-they country high linen collars , and [they]562-they look as if [they]562-they were choking . [I]0-i hate linen collars , do n't [you]563-you , [Mamma]564-mamma ? [Two Ethridge aunts]565-two ethridge aunts are staying [here]391-here besides [me]0-i , and [we]567-we all have to sit together in the morning - room , as everything is covered up in [the drawing - rooms]568-the drawing - rooms , ready for being shut up next week , when [they]565-two ethridge aunts go to [Scotland]9-scotland . After lunch [the girls]569-the girls did nothing but question [me]0-i about what [we]567-we had done at [Nazeby]8-nazeby . [They]569-the girls said [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia only asks [them]569-the girls to the dullest parties . [They]569-the girls knew [every one]428-every one 's name , [they]569-the girls had carefully read [them]569-the girls in the Morning Post . [They]569-the girls wanted especially to know about [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond because [Lettice]142-lettice had danced with [him]126-lord valmond once this season . [They]569-the girls thought [him]126-lord valmond awfully good - looking . [I]0-i said [he]126-lord valmond was [an odious young man]571-an odious young man and very rude . So [Lettice]142-lettice said [she]116-lady cecilia supposed [he]126-lord valmond had not spoken to [me]0-i , as [he]126-lord valmond never speaks to [girls]521-girls . [I]0-i told [them]569-the girls that was quite a mistake as [he]126-lord valmond had spoken to [me]0-i all the time , but [I]0-i hated [him]126-lord valmond . And do [you]573-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , [they]569-the girls looked as if [they]569-the girls did not believe a word [I]0-i was saying ; which was not very polite [I]0-i think . When [we]574-we got [upstairs]470-upstairs [they]569-the girls wanted to see all [my]0-i clothes , but fortunately [Agnès]115-agnès had only taken out one or two things , and [they]569-the girls asked [me]0-i to let [[their]569-the girls maid]576-their maid take patterns of everything . Of course [I]0-i could not refuse , but [I]0-i hate [my]0-i things being mauled over by [strange females]577-strange females , and [Agnès]115-agnès was simply furious . [I]0-i am sure [she]115-agnès will scratch [the maid]578-the maid when [she]115-agnès comes to ask for a frock . [They]569-the girls tried on [my]0-i hats all at the wrong angle , first [Clara]143-clara , then [Lettice]142-lettice , and made faces and gave little screams at [themselves]569-the girls in the glass , and no wonder , for [they]569-the girls looked perfect guys in [them]569-the girls , with [their]569-the girls tight " tongy "[569-the girls] hair . Then [they]569-the girls tossed [them]569-the girls on to the bed as [they]569-the girls finished with [them]569-the girls , and [Agnès]115-agnès kept muttering to [herself]115-agnès like distant thunder . Finally [Lettice]142-lettice danced a pas seul with the white rose toque perched on the back of [her]115-agnès head , and [she]115-agnès made such kicks and jumps that it lurched off , and landed in the water jug ! At that [Agnès]115-agnès got beside [herself]115-agnès . " Fi ! donc , [Mademoiselle]144-mademoiselle ! "[115-agnès] [she]115-agnès screamed , " ça c'est trop fort ! "[115-agnès] On the Water Shoot The hat is quite spoilt , so please write and order [me]0-i another one from [Caroline]134-carry 's , like [a nice , sweet , pretty , darling Mamma]579-a nice , sweet , pretty , darling mamma . At tea [they]569-the girls were all so interested when [I]0-i told [them]569-the girls [I]0-i was going to stay in [France]10-france with [the de Croixmares]145-the de croixmares . One of [the Ethridge aunts]580-the ethridge aunts ( [Rowena]146-rowena ) pricked up [her]146-rowena ears at once , and asked [me]0-i if [Madame de Croixmare]147-madame de croixmare was not [[my]0-i godmother]581-my godmother , and had [she]147-madame de croixmare not been [a great friend of [poor papa]583-poor papa 's]582-a great friend of poor papa 's . So [I]0-i told [her]147-madame de croixmare yes , and that [I]0-i was going [there]398-there for three weeks . [She]147-madame de croixmare and [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary exchanged looks , [I]0-i do n't know why , but it irritated [me]0-i , [Mamma]132-mamma , and [I]0-i rather snapped at [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary when [she]147-madame de croixmare began about [my]0-i hair again . And presently [I]0-i heard [her]147-madame de croixmare saying to [the other aunt]585-the other aunt that it was a pity [girls]521-girls nowadays were allowed to be impertinent to [[their]521-girls elders]587-their elders . Of course there was not a thing to do , [every one]428-every one having left [Town]11-town , so in the evening [Uncle Geoffrey]148-uncle geoffrey took [us]589-us to [the Exhibition]12-the exhibition to go down in [the Water Shoot]13-the water shoot . That is lovely , [Mamma]132-mamma , only [I]0-i had to sit beside [Lettice]142-lettice , because [Clara]143-clara was frightened and would be with [[her]143-clara father]386-her father . [A horrid man behind , who , [I]0-i suppose , was not holding on , flopped right on to [us]589-us at the bump in [the water]591-the water , and then said , " Beg pardon , [dears]3104-dears]3103-a horrid man behind , who , i suppose , was not holding on , flopped right on to us at the bump in the water , and then said , " beg pardon , dears , "[3103-a horrid man behind , who , i suppose , was not holding on , flopped right on to us at the bump in the water , and then said , " beg pardon , dears] and it made [Uncle Geoffrey]148-uncle geoffrey so cross [he]148-uncle geoffrey would not let [us]589-us go down any more , and [we]589-us had to go [home]390-home and to bed . [I]0-i am just scribbling this before breakfast . [We]589-us go on to Great - aunt [Maria]149-aunt maria 's by [the eleven train]593-the eleven train . [I]0-i am glad [Cousin Octavia]150-octavia is going to take [me]0-i out next season instead of [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary , which was first suggested . [I]0-i know [I]0-i should not have been good with [her]149-aunt maria . [She]149-aunt maria is not a bit like [you]594-you , [darling Mamma]132-mamma . It is a long time.—With love from [[your]594-you affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Heaviland Manor]14-heaviland manor , Wednesday , August 3rd . Dearest Mamma,—I ca n't think why [you]594-you made [me]0-i come here ! [Agnès]115-agnès has been so sniffy and condescending ever since this morning ; but [I]0-i have remarked that [[Uncle John]151-uncle john 's valet]596-uncle john 's valet is only about forty and has a roving eye ! so perhaps by to - morrow morning [I]0-i sha n't have [my]0-i hair screwed off [my]0-i head ! But [I]0-i feel for [Agnès]115-agnès , only in a different way . [A Quiet Evening]597-a quiet evening [It]115-agnès is [a stuffy , boring place]598-a stuffy , boring place . [You]594-you remember [the house]526-the house — enormous , tidy , hideous , uncomfortable . Well , [we]600-we had such a dinner last night after [I]0-i arrived — soup , fish , everything popped on to the table for [Great - uncle John]151-uncle john to carve at one end , and Great - aunt [Maria]149-aunt maria at the other ! A regular aquarium specimen of turbot sat on its dish opposite [him]151-uncle john , while [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria had a huge lot of soles . And there was n't any need , because there were [four men - servants in [the room]401-the room who could easily have done it at the side]601-four men - servants in the room who could easily have done it at the side ; but [I]0-i remember [you]594-you said it was always like that when [you]594-you were [a little girl]603-a little girl . Well , it got on to puddings . [I]0-i forgot to tell [you]594-you , though , there were plenty of candles on the table , without shades , and a " bouquet "[594-you] of flowers , all sorts ( [I]0-i am sure fixed in sand ) , in a gold middle thing . Well , about the puddings — at least four of them were planted on the table , awfully sweet and jammy , and [Uncle John]151-uncle john was quite irritated with [me]0-i because [I]0-i could only eat two ; and [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria , who has got as deaf as a post , kept roaring to [old Major Orwell]152-major orwell , who sat next [her]149-aunt maria , " [Children]3105-children have no healthy appetites as in [our]3105-children day . Eh ! what ? "[152-major orwell] And [I]0-i wanted to scream in reply , " But [I]0-i am grown up now , [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria ! "[0-i] [Uncle John]151-uncle john asked [me]0-i every question over and over , and [old Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington 's false teeth jumped so once or twice that [I]0-i got quite nervous . That is the party , [me]0-i , [Major Orwell]152-major orwell , [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington , and [Uncle]604-uncle and [Aunt]605-aunt . When dessert was about coming , everything thing got lifted from the table , and before [you]606-you could say " [Jack Robinson]154-jack robinson "[606-you] off whisked the cloth . [I]0-i was so unprepared for it that [I]0-i said " Oh ! "[0-i] and ducked [my]0-i head , and that made the cloth catch on [old Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington 's cap — [she]153-lady farrington had to sit on [my]0-i side of the table , to be out of the draught — and , was n't it dreadful , it almost pulled it off , and with it the grey curls fixed at the side , and the rest was all bald . So that was why it was so loose — there was nothing to pin it to ! And [she]153-lady farrington glared at [me]0-i , and fixed it as straight as [she]153-lady farrington could , but it had such a saucy look all the rest of the evening . [I]0-i did apologise as well as [I]0-i could , and there was such an awkward pause ; and after dinner [we]607-we had coffee in [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room , and then in a little time tea , and between times [they]609-they sat down to whist , all but [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria — so [they]609-they had to have [a dummy]610-a dummy . [She]153-lady farrington wanted to hear all about [you]606-you , [she]153-lady farrington said , and [my]0-i going to visit in [France]10-france ; and so [I]0-i had to bellow descriptions of [your]606-you neuralgia , and about [Mme . de Croixmare]155-mme being [[my]0-i godmother]581-my godmother , & c. , and [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria says , " Tut , tut ! [I]0-i had not remembered a bit what they were like ; but [I]0-i was only six , was n't [I]0-i , when [we]607-we came last ? After [she]153-lady farrington had asked every sort of thing about [you]606-you under the sun , [she]153-lady farrington kept giving longing glances at [the dummy]612-the dummy 's cards ; so [I]0-i said , " Oh ! [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria , [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i am keeping [you]153-lady farrington from [your]153-lady farrington whist . "[0-i] As soon as [I]0-i could make [her]153-lady farrington hear , [you]606-you should have seen how [she]153-lady farrington hopped up like a two - year - old into the vacant seat ; and [they]613-they were far more serious about it than [any one]536-any one was at [Nazeby]8-nazeby , where [they]613-they had hundreds on , and [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria and [the others]487-the others only played for counters — that long mother - o'-pearl fish kind . [I]0-i looked at a book on the table , [Lady Blessington]156-lady blessington 's " Book of Beauty , "[0-i] and [I]0-i see then [every one]428-every one got born with champagne - bottle shoulders . Had [they]613-they been paring [them]617-them for generations before , [I]0-i wonder ? Because [old John]151-uncle john , [the keeper at [Hendon]15-hendon]618-the keeper at hendon , told [me]0-i once that [the best fox - terriers]619-the best fox - terriers arrive now without any tails , [[their]619-the best fox - terriers mothers]620-their mothers ' and [grand - mothers]621-grand - mothers ' and [great - grandmothers]622-great - grandmothers ' having been cut off for so long ; but [I]0-i wonder , if the fashion changed , how could [they]619-the best fox - terriers get long tails again ? There must be some way , because all of [us]623-us now have square shoulders . But what was [I]0-i saying ? An Old English Dinner Then hot spiced port came in — it was such a close night — and [they]625-they all had some , and so did [I]0-i , and it was good ; and then candles came . Such lovely silver , and so beautifully cleaned ; and [Aunt]626-aunt and [Uncle]627-uncle kissed [me]0-i . But do [you]629-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , when [I]0-i got [upstairs]470-upstairs to [[my]0-i room]631-my room it was only half - past ten ! [I]0-i have [such [a huge room]633-a huge room , with a four - post feather bed in [it]632-such a huge room , with a four - post feather bed in it]632-such a huge room , with a four - post feather bed in it . [I]0-i had let [Agnès]115-agnès go to bed directly after [her]115-agnès supper , with a toothache , so [I]0-i had to get undressed by [myself]0-i ; and [I]0-i was afraid to climb in from the side , it was so high up . But [I]0-i found some steps with blue carpet on them , as well as a table with a Bible , and a funny old china medicine spoon , and glass and water - jug on it ; and the steps did nicely , for when [I]0-i got to the top , [I]0-i just took a header into the feathers . It seemed quite comfy at first , but in a few minutes , goodness gracious , [I]0-i was suffocated ! And it was such a business getting the whole mass on the floor ; and then [I]0-i did not know very well how to make the bed again , and [I]0-i had not a very good night , and overslept [myself]0-i in the morning . So [I]0-i got down late for prayers . [Uncle John]151-uncle john reads them , and [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria repeats responses whenever [she]149-aunt maria thinks best , as [she]149-aunt maria ca n't hear a word ; but [I]0-i suppose [she]149-aunt maria counts up , and , from long habit , just says " Amen "[149-aunt maria] when [she]149-aunt maria gets to the end of — thirty , say — fancying that will be right ; and it is generally . Only [Uncle John]151-uncle john stopped in the middle to say , " Damn that dog ! "[151-uncle john] as [Fido]157-fido was whining and scratching outside , so that put [her]149-aunt maria out and brought in the " Amen "[151-uncle john] too soon . [Family Prayers]158-family prayers After breakfast [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria jingled a large bunch of keys and said it was [her]149-aunt maria day for seeing [the linen - room]634-the linen - room , and would n't [I]0-i like to go with [her]149-aunt maria , as [all young people]635-all young people should have " house - wifely "[149-aunt maria] ideas ? So [I]0-i went . It is so beautifully kept , and such lovely linen , all with lavender between it ; and [she]149-aunt maria talked to [the housekeeper]636-the housekeeper , and looked over everything — [she]149-aunt maria seemed to know each sheet by name ! Then [we]637-we went to [the storeroom]638-the storeroom , all as neat as a new pin ; and from there to interview [all the old people from [the village]640-the village]639-all the old people from the village , who were waiting with requests , and [some of [them]639-all the old people from the village]485-some of them were as deaf as [she]149-aunt maria is . So [the housekeeper]636-the housekeeper had to scream at both sides , and [I]0-i was tired when [we]637-we got back , and did want to rush out of doors ; but [I]0-i had to wait , and then walk between [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington and [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria up and down [the path]643-the path in the sun till lunch at one o'clock ; and after that [we]637-we went for a drive in [the barouche]644-the barouche , with the fattest white horses [you]645-you ever saw , and a coachman just like [Cinderella]159-cinderella 's one that had been a rat . [He]646-he seemed to have odd bits of fur on [his]646-he face and under [his]646-he chin , and [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria said that [he]646-he suffered from a sore throat , that was why , which [he]646-he caught at [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary 's wedding ; and so [I]0-i counted up — and as [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary is [[your]645-you eldest sister]647-your eldest sister , it must have been more than twenty years ago . [I]0-i do call that a long sore throat , do n't [you]645-you ? and [I]0-i would n't keep [a coachman with a beard]648-a coachman with a beard , would [you]645-you ? [We]637-we went at a snail 's pace , and got in at four o'clock , and then there was tea at half - past , with the nicest bread - and - butter [you]645-you ever tasted . And after that [I]0-i said [I]0-i must write to [you]645-you , and so here [I]0-i am , and [I]0-i feel that if it goes on much longer [I]0-i shall do something dreadful . Now good - bye , [dearest Mamma.—Your affectionate daughter]649-dearest mamma.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Heaviland Manor]14-heaviland manor , Friday , August 5th . Dearest Mamma,—I am glad to - morrow will soon be [here]391-here , and that [I]0-i can come [home]390-home , but [I]0-i must tell [you]645-you about yesterday . First , all the morning it rained , and what with roaring at [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria and holding skeins of wool for [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington , [I]0-i got such jumps that [I]0-i felt [I]0-i should scream unless [I]0-i got out ; so after lunch , while [they]652-they were both having a nap in [their]652-they chairs , [I]0-i slipped off for a walk by [myself]0-i — it was still raining , but not much ; [I]0-i took [Fido]157-fido , who is generally a little beast , and far too fat . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond Reappears [We]653-we had had [a nice scamper]654-a nice scamper , and had turned to come back not far from [the Park]655-the park , when who do [you]645-you think came riding up?—Lord [Valmond]126-lord valmond ! [The last person one expected to see down here]656-the last person one expected to see down here ! [He]126-lord valmond never waited a second when [he]126-lord valmond saw [me]0-i , but jumped off [his]126-lord valmond horse and beamed — just as if [we]653-we had parted [the best of friends]657-the best of friends ! ! ! Did [you]645-you ever hear such impudence ? Of course [I]0-i should have walked on without recognising [him]126-lord valmond , if [I]0-i had been left to [myself]0-i , but [he]126-lord valmond took [me]0-i so by surprise that [I]0-i had shaken hands before [I]0-i knew , and then it was too late to walk on . It appears [he]126-lord valmond has a place down here which [he]126-lord valmond never comes to generally , but just happened to now — to see how the young pheasants were doing . [He]126-lord valmond began at once to talk , as if [I]0-i had never been angry or boxed [his]126-lord valmond ears at all ! It really exasperated [me]0-i , so at last [I]0-i said [he]126-lord valmond had better get on [his]126-lord valmond horse again , as [I]0-i wanted to run on with [Fido]157-fido ; so then [he]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond had just been on [his]126-lord valmond way to call on [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria , and would come with [me]0-i . [I]0-i said [I]0-i was sure that was n't true , as [he]126-lord valmond was going the other way . So [he]126-lord valmond said that [he]126-lord valmond had only been going that way to give [his]126-lord valmond horse a little exercise , and that [he]126-lord valmond intended to go in at the other gate . [I]0-i said [I]0-i was sure that was n't true either , as there was no way round that way , unless [one]658-one jumped [the park palings]659-the park palings . So [he]126-lord valmond said that was what [he]126-lord valmond had intended to do . Just then [we]660-we came to the turnstile of [the right - of - way]661-the right - of - way , so [I]0-i slipped through and called out , " Then [I]0-i wo n't keep [you]126-lord valmond from [your]126-lord valmond exercise , "[0-i] and walked on as fast as [I]0-i could . [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington 's Nap What do [you]0-i think [he]126-lord valmond did , [Mamma]132-mamma ? Simply got on [his]126-lord valmond horse , and jumped those palings there and then ! [I]0-i ca n't think how [he]126-lord valmond was n't killed . There was almost no take - off , and the fence is so high . However , there [he]126-lord valmond was , and [I]0-i could not get away again , because , if [I]0-i had run , the horse could easily have kept up with [me]0-i . But [I]0-i only said " Yes "[0-i] and " No "[0-i] all the way to [the house]526-the house , so [he]126-lord valmond could not have enjoyed it much . [We]663-we went straight to [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room , where tea was almost up , and there was [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington alone — still asleep , and [her]153-lady farrington cap had fallen right back , and all the bald was showing ; and just then [a carriage]665-a carriage drove up to the door , and [we]663-we heard [visitors]666-visitors and the footsteps in [the hall]396-the hall . "[0-i] " Eh ! what ? "[153-lady farrington] [she]153-lady farrington screamed , and [her]153-lady farrington teeth as nearly as possible jumped on to the carpet . An Afternoon Call It appears that [Harvey]161-harvey had sent [a footman]685-a footman up to [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria 's door , to tell of the first [Clarkes]164-clarkes ' arrival , and then , terrified by [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington 's voice , had rushed up [himself]161-harvey to announce [the second lot]686-the second lot , and [he]161-harvey met [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria on the stairs coming down , and of course [she]149-aunt maria never heard the difference between " [Mrs.]3111-mrs. [A Friendly Invitation]172-a friendly invitation " Ah , yes ! "[167-mrs. clarke] Then [she]167-mrs. clarke turned again to [the fat Clarks]173-the fat clarks , evidently liking [their]173-the fat clarks jolly faces best . " But [one]658-one can see [they]173-the fat clarks are [Clarkes]164-clarkes . Let [me]167-mrs. clarke guess . Yes , [they]173-the fat clarks must be [poor [Henry]117-harry 's children]3120-poor henry 's children ! "[167-mrs. clarke] At this , [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond had such a violent fit of choking by the tea - table , that [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria , who hears the oddest , most unexpected things , caught that , and saw [him]126-lord valmond , and saying , " How d ' [ye]126-lord valmond do ? "[126-lord valmond] created a diversion . Presently [I]0-i heard [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington roaring in a whisper into [her]153-lady farrington ears the difference between [the Clarkes]164-clarkes and [the Clarks]173-the fat clarks , and [the poor dear]689-the poor dear was so upset ; but [her]153-lady farrington kind heart came up trumps , and [she]153-lady farrington was awfully nice to [the two vulgar Clarks]690-the two vulgar clarks , who had the good sense to go soon , and then [the others]487-the others went . Then [she]153-lady farrington got [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond on to [her]153-lady farrington sofa , and [he]126-lord valmond screamed such heaps of nice things into [her]153-lady farrington ear , just as if [she]153-lady farrington had been [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith , and [she]153-lady farrington was so pleased . And [Uncle John]151-uncle john came in , and [they]692-they talked about the pheasants , and [he]151-uncle john asked [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond to dinner on Saturday night ( to - morrow ) , and [he]151-uncle john looked timidly at [me]0-i , to see if [I]0-i was still angry with [him]151-uncle john and wanted [him]151-uncle john not to come , so [I]0-i smiled sweetly , and [he]151-uncle john accepted joyfully . Is n't it lovely , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i shall be [home]390-home with [you]132-mamma by then , and [Lady Farrington]153-lady farrington and [Major Orwell]152-major orwell are going too ! So [he]151-uncle john will have to play dummy whist all the evening with [Uncle]694-uncle and [Aunt]695-aunt , and eat [his]151-uncle john dinner at half - past six ! Now , [good - night.—Your affectionate daughter]696-good - night.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Hazeldene Court]16-hazeldene court , Tuesday , 9th August . The Horse Show [Dearest Mamma,—There]174-dearest mamma,—there is a huge party here for the Horse Show , and [I]0-i daresay [I]0-i shall enjoy [myself]0-i . [We]697-we had no sooner got into [the station]698-the station at [Paddington]17-paddington than in the distance [I]0-i caught sight of [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond . [I]0-i pretended not to see [him]126-lord valmond , and got behind a barrow of trunks , and then slipped into [the carriage]699-the carriage and made [Agnès]115-agnès sit by the door . [We]697-we saw [him]126-lord valmond walking up and down , and , just before [the train]393-the train started , [he]126-lord valmond came and got into [[our]697-we carriage]701-our carriage . [He]126-lord valmond seemed awfully surprised to see [me]0-i , said [he]126-lord valmond had not an idea [he]126-lord valmond should meet [me]0-i , and apologised for disturbing [me]0-i , but [he]126-lord valmond said all [the other carriages]702-the other carriages were full . [He]126-lord valmond seemed so uppish and unconcerned that [I]0-i felt obliged to ask [him]126-lord valmond how [he]126-lord valmond enjoyed [his]126-lord valmond dinner with [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria on Saturday . [He]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond had enjoyed it awfully , and that [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria was [a charming hostess]703-a charming hostess . [He]126-lord valmond asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i was going far down the line , or only just on [the river]704-the river . [I]0-i said not very far . [I]0-i tried to be as stiff as possible and not speak , and [I]0-i did not tell [him]126-lord valmond where [I]0-i was going , but , do [you]705-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , there is no snubbing [him]126-lord valmond . [He]126-lord valmond said at once that [he]126-lord valmond was going to [Hazeldene Court]16-hazeldene court , to stay with [[his]126-lord valmond cousins]706-his cousins [the Westaways]175-the westaways . [I]0-i said , " Indeed ! "[126-lord valmond] and [he]126-lord valmond said , " Yes , are n't [they]706-his cousins [cousins of yours]3121-cousins of yours too ? "[126-lord valmond] and when [I]0-i said " Yes , "[0-i] [he]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond felt sure [we]707-we were related , and might n't [he]126-lord valmond call [me]0-i [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth ! ! ! [I]0-i just told [him]126-lord valmond [I]0-i thought [him]126-lord valmond [the rudest , most detestable man [I]0-i had ever met]708-the rudest , most detestable man i had ever met ; and if [he]126-lord valmond spoke to [me]0-i again at all , [I]0-i should ask [the guard]709-the guard to find [me]0-i [another carriage]675-another carriage . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond Presumes [He]126-lord valmond was awfully surprised , and said [he]126-lord valmond had not meant to be the least rude ; [he]126-lord valmond thought it was the custom for [cousins]711-cousins to call [each other]437-each other by [their]711-cousins Christian names , and [his]126-lord valmond name was [Harry]117-harry . ( Just as if [I]0-i did not know that , after hearing [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith calling [him]126-lord valmond every few minutes ! ) [I]0-i said in a freezing tone [we]713-we were not related in any way , and [I]0-i wished to read the paper , upon which [he]126-lord valmond produced every imaginable kind , lots of [ladies]714-ladies ' papers that [he]126-lord valmond could not possibly have wanted for [himself]126-lord valmond . [I]0-i do n't know who [he]126-lord valmond expected to meet . However , [I]0-i would not have any of them , but looked at a Punch [I]0-i had bought [myself]0-i . [You]715-you know that uncomfortable feeling [one]658-one has when [some one]717-some one is staring at one — it makes [one]658-one obliged to look up — so after a while [our]713-we eyes met over the Punch , and [he]126-lord valmond smiled , and [his]126-lord valmond teeth are so white . All [he]126-lord valmond said was , " [I]126-lord valmond was thinking of [the Clarkes]164-clarkes and [Clarks]173-the fat clarks . "[126-lord valmond] And in spite of [my]0-i being indignant with [him]126-lord valmond [I]0-i could not help laughing , when [I]0-i remembered about [them]719-them , and then it was hard to be very stiff again at once . The Offending Dimple Just about this time [Agnès]115-agnès went to sleep in the other corner , and the moment [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond saw [she]115-agnès was really off , [he]126-lord valmond bent forward and said in such a humble voice , that [he]126-lord valmond was sorry [he]126-lord valmond had offended [me]0-i at [Nazeby]8-nazeby ; [he]126-lord valmond had yielded to a sudden temptation , and [he]126-lord valmond could only ask [me]0-i to forgive [him]126-lord valmond . [He]126-lord valmond had quite mistaken [my]0-i character [he]126-lord valmond said , [he]126-lord valmond now saw [I]0-i was [a serious person]720-a serious person , but [he]126-lord valmond had been deceived by the dimple in [my]0-i left cheek . ( Now is n't it provoking , [Mamma]132-mamma , to have a dimple like that , that gives [people]411-people the impression [they]411-people may treat [you]722-you with want of respect ? ) [I]0-i said [I]0-i did not believe a word of it , and , as [we]723-we were only [the merest acquaintances]724-the merest acquaintances , it did not matter whether [I]0-i forgave [him]126-lord valmond or not , and [I]0-i hoped [he]126-lord valmond would not mention the subject again . [He]126-lord valmond then asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i was going to stop at [Hazeldene]18-hazeldene until Saturday . So [you]722-you see , [Mamma]132-mamma , [he]126-lord valmond must have known [I]0-i was going there all along ; are n't [men]725-men odd ? [You]722-you ca n't trust [them]725-men one minute not to be deceiving [you]722-you , only [I]0-i think on the whole [I]0-i prefer [them]725-men to [women]726-women , [they]725-men ca n't copy [your]722-you clothes at all events . After that [he]126-lord valmond seemed to think [we]727-we had quite made everything up , and went on talking in the friendliest way , but [I]0-i would not thaw ; [he]126-lord valmond shall not have the chance of blaming [my]0-i dimple again for any of [his]126-lord valmond misconduct ! At last [I]0-i said [I]0-i hated talking in [the train]393-the train , and pretended to go to sleep . But [I]0-i could not get really off , because every time [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes just to see where [we]727-we were , [I]0-i found [him]126-lord valmond looking at [me]0-i . [A huge omnibus]729-a huge omnibus was waiting for [us]727-we when [we]727-we arrived , and [several more guests]730-several more guests had come by [the same train]731-the same train and [we]727-we all drove to [the house]526-the house together . [They]730-several more guests were having tea on [the croquet lawn]733-the croquet lawn — [Lady Westaway]176-lady westaway and [some other people]734-some other people , and [[the eldest son]735-the eldest son 's wife]736-the eldest son 's wife . [You]737-you remember what a fuss there was when [he]126-lord valmond married , how [Lady Westaway]176-lady westaway had hysterics for three days . Well , [she]176-lady westaway looks as if [she]176-lady westaway could have them again any moment . [An Attractive Woman [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway is awfully pretty . [She]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway was lying in a swing chair , showing lots of petticoat and ankle . The ankle is n't bad , but the petticoat had common lace on it . [She]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway has huge turquoise earrings , and very stick - out hair arranged to look untidy with tongs . [She]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway smiles all the time , and wears lots of different colours . [She]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway calls [every one]428-every one by [their]428-every one Christian name , and always catches hold of [the men]450-the men 's coats , or fixes [their]450-the men buttonholes or ties , or holds [their]450-the men arms and whispers : and [every one]428-every one is in love with [her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway , and [she]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway has the greatest success . So [I]0-i ca n't think , [Mamma]564-mamma , why [you]564-mamma have always told [me]0-i never to do any of these things , when [you]564-mamma want [me]0-i to be [a success]743-a success so much . [Her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway voice is dreadfully shrill , and such an odd pronunciation , but [no one]744-no one seems to mind that . [I]0-i rather like [her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway , [she]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway is so jolly but [some of [the women of the party]746-the women of the party]745-some of the women of the party wo n't speak to [her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway , except to say disagreeable things . [Jane Roose]127-jane roose is [here]391-here , [she]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway has been here since [she]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway left [Nazeby]8-nazeby ( [Violet]130-violet roose is at [the sea]748-the sea ) , and [she]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway came up to [[my]0-i room]631-my room as [we]750-we were going to dress , and [I]0-i have only just got rid of [her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway . [She]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway told [me]0-i [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway was [a " dreadful creature]3122-a " dreadful creature , "[738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway] and that [no one]744-no one would know [her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway , if it was not for [[her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway mother - in - law]561-her mother - in - law receiving [her]738-an attractive woman mrs. westaway , so [they]753-they ca n't help it .
