[Hazeldene Court]16-hazeldene court , Thursday , 11th August . [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby 's Diversions Dearest [Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i shall be [home]390-home with [you]114-mamma,—i almost as soon as [you]114-mamma,—i get this . But [I]0-i must tell [you]114-mamma,—i about these last two days . [The man [I]0-i went in to dinner with the first night]759-the man i went in to dinner with the first night was so nice - looking , only [he]759-the man i went in to dinner with the first night did not seem as if [he]759-the man i went in to dinner with the first night could collect [his]759-the man i went in to dinner with the first night thoughts enough to finish [his]759-the man i went in to dinner with the first night sentences , and it left them sounding so silly sometimes , but [I]0-i found out before [we]760-we had begun the entrées that it was because [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway was sitting opposite , and [he]759-the man i went in to dinner with the first night was gazing at [her]177-mrs. westaway . [She]177-mrs. westaway looked lovely , but not like [any one]536-any one [I]0-i have seen yet since [I]0-i stayed out . [She]177-mrs. westaway had a diamond collar and two ropes of pearls ( [Jane Roose]127-jane roose said they were imitation ) , and [her]177-mrs. westaway arms quite bare and very white , but [her]177-mrs. westaway skin must come off , because [I]0-i could see a patch of white on [a footman]685-a footman 's coat where [she]177-mrs. westaway accidentally touched when helping [herself]177-mrs. westaway to potatoes . [She]177-mrs. westaway had a huge tulle bow in [her]177-mrs. westaway hair , and [her]177-mrs. westaway earrings were as big as shillings . [Lady Bobby Pomeroy]178-lady bobby said afterwards in [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room to [Jane Roose]127-jane roose that [she]127-jane roose should not take any more of [her]127-jane roose meals [downstairs]764-downstairs with this " creature ; "[178-lady bobby] and [she]127-jane roose would not have come only that [Bobby]178-lady bobby insisted , as [he]765-he was showing some horses , and it is convenient . And so , do [you]766-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby has never come out of [[her]178-lady bobby room]767-her room since , except just to go to [the Horse Show]768-the horse show , which [she]178-lady bobby drove to with [Mrs. Mannering]179-mrs. mannering in [a hired fly]769-a hired fly . [I]0-i do n't call it very polite to [the hostess]770-the hostess , do [you]766-you ? This afternoon [she]178-lady bobby amused [herself]178-lady bobby from [her]178-lady bobby bedroom window by shooting at rabbits just beyond the wire fence of [the lawn]771-the lawn with a rook rifle ; [she]178-lady bobby did not hit any rabbits , but [she]178-lady bobby got [a gardener]772-a gardener in the leg , and [the man]773-the man was very angry , and bled a great deal , and had to be taken away , and [I]0-i think it was very careless of [her]178-lady bobby , do n't [you]766-you ? Two is Company [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond was on [his]126-lord valmond way to the window seat where [Jane Roose]127-jane roose and [I]0-i were sitting the first night after dinner , but [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway caught hold of [[her]177-mrs. westaway husband]475-her husband 's coat - tails as [he]475-her husband passed and said quite loud , " [Duckie]180-duckie , [you]180-duckie must bring [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and introduce [him]126-lord valmond to [me]177-mrs. westaway , [we]776-we have n't met yet , and [I]177-mrs. westaway want to know [all [your]180-duckie friends]3123-all your friends . "[177-mrs. westaway] So [Billy Westaway]181-billy westaway , who is as obedient as [a spaniel]775-a spaniel , secured [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , and presently [we]776-we saw [them]777-them comfortably tucked into a small settee together , and there [they]777-them stayed all the evening . [She]177-mrs. westaway kept licking [her]177-mrs. westaway lips as if [he]126-lord valmond was something good to eat , and the next morning [she]177-mrs. westaway fixed a rose in [his]126-lord valmond buttonhole at breakfast and called [him]126-lord valmond " [Cousin Val]182-cousin val , "[177-mrs. westaway] and by lunch time it was plain " [Val]182-cousin val , "[177-mrs. westaway] and now it is " [Harry]117-harry . "[0-i] [I]0-i do call it bad taste , do n't [you]778-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? and [she]177-mrs. westaway is n't half so pretty in broad daylight , and [I]0-i do n't like [her]177-mrs. westaway at all now . Only [I]0-i ca n't help laughing at [Lady Westaway]176-lady westaway 's face when " [Phyllis]183-phyllis "[177-mrs. westaway] ( that is [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway 's name ) says anything especially vulgar ; [Lady Westaways]175-the westaways shudders , and takes a huge sniff at [her]175-the westaways smelling salts . [She]177-mrs. westaway keeps them always with [her]177-mrs. westaway in a long gold - topped bottle , and [she]177-mrs. westaway has to use them almost every few minutes when [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway is in [the room]401-the room . The Horse Show was rather nice ; it is held in [the park]655-the park fairly close , and [most of [us]782-us]781-most of us strolled [there]398-there in the morning before lunch to see the judging . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond joined [us]782-us , [I]0-i was walking with [Lord George Lane]121-lord george lane ( [you]784-you remember [he]121-lord george lane was [one of the Eleven at [Nazeby]8-nazeby]785-one of the eleven at nazeby ) . [I]0-i was in a very good temper , [Mamma]132-mamma , and [we]782-us had been laughing at everything [we]782-us said . [He]126-lord valmond is quite [a nice idiot]786-a nice idiot , but , when [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond came , of course [I]0-i talked as stiffly as possibly , and presently [Lord George]121-lord george lane told [him]126-lord valmond that [he]126-lord valmond was singularly backward in copybook maxims , and that there was one [he]126-lord valmond ought to write out and commit to memory , and it began with " Two 's Company , "[126-lord valmond] upon which [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond stalked on in a rage . The seats at the show were very hard boards , and the sun made one awfully drowsy ; but about half - an - hour before lunch [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond came up again , and asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i should not like to go for a turn . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had better , so as not to get cramp . [He]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond had been afraid [he]126-lord valmond would never get the chance of speaking to [me]0-i , [I]0-i was always so surrounded . [I]0-i told [him]126-lord valmond [I]0-i had only come now because of the cramp . [I]0-i am quite determined , [Mamma]132-mamma , not to unbend to [him]126-lord valmond at all . [I]0-i was not once agreeable , or anything but stiff and snubbing , and [I]0-i am sure [he]126-lord valmond has never been treated like that before , but it is awfully hard work keeping it up all the time , and when [we]787-we got in to lunch [I]0-i was quite tired . On the Lake There were numbers of [people at the show]788-people at the show in the afternoon , and all in [their]789-their best clothes . [Lady Grace Fenton]184-lady grace fenton was showing two of [[her]184-lady grace fenton hunters]790-her hunters , and [she]184-lady grace fenton kept shouting to [the grooms]791-the grooms , and [I]0-i did not think it was very attractive behaviour . [She]184-lady grace fenton takes such strides [you]792-you would think [her]184-lady grace fenton muslin dress would split . [I]0-i do n't know why it is that so many people in [the country]793-the country are ugly and weather - beaten , and all [their]789-their clothes hanging wrong . Except the house party here , and a few from other big places , there was not [a pretty person to be seen]794-a pretty person to be seen . [We]787-we had [a special reserved tent for tea]795-a special reserved tent for tea , and [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway seemed to have [every man in the place round [her]177-mrs. westaway]796-every man in the place round her , and [I]0-i heard [one man]797-one man come up and say , " Well , [Phyllis]183-phyllis , this is a joke to find [you]183-phyllis in [this respectable hole]3124-this respectable hole ; how do [you]183-phyllis like solid matrimony , [old girl]3125-old girl ? "[797-one man] and [I]0-i do think that sounded familiar and rude , do n't [you]177-mrs. westaway , [Mamma]132-mamma ? but [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway was n't a bit angry . [She]177-mrs. westaway calls [Billy]181-billy westaway " [Duckie]180-duckie , "[177-mrs. westaway] and continually pats and caresses [him]181-billy westaway ; [he]181-billy westaway does look such a fool , and [I]0-i should hate to be fingered like that if [I]0-i were [a man]496-a man , [one]658-one must feel like a bunch of grapes with the bloom being rubbed off . [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway kept [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond with [her]177-mrs. westaway all the rest of the time at the show , and then took [him]126-lord valmond on [the lake]800-the lake while [we]801-we played croquet . [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby went straight to [[her]178-lady bobby room]767-her room and sat by the window , and every now and then shouted advice to [Lord George]121-lord george lane who was playing with [me]0-i . When [we]801-we had finished , [Lady Westaway]176-lady westaway took [me]0-i to see [the conservatories]803-the conservatories , and there [we]801-we were joined by [old Colonel Blake]185-old colonel blake and [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , [I]0-i do n't know how [he]126-lord valmond had torn [himself]126-lord valmond away from [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway ! [Jane Roose]127-jane roose says [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith would be mad if [she]119-mrs. smith was [here]391-here . [He]126-lord valmond asked [me]0-i why [I]0-i had walked on ahead so fast on the way back from the Show as [he]126-lord valmond wanted [me]0-i to go on [the lake]800-the lake with [him]126-lord valmond instead of [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway . When [he]126-lord valmond had suggested going on it [he]126-lord valmond had looked at [me]0-i , but [I]0-i would take no notice , and so [he]126-lord valmond was obliged to go with [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway when [she]177-mrs. westaway offered to come , and [I]0-i was very unkind and disagreeable . [I]0-i just said if [he]126-lord valmond found [me]0-i so , [he]126-lord valmond need not speak to [me]0-i at all , [I]0-i did not care . [We]806-we looked at [one another]807-one another like two wild cats for a moment . [I]0-i am sure [he]126-lord valmond wanted to slap [me]0-i , and [I]0-i should like to have scratched [him]126-lord valmond , and then [Lady Westaway]176-lady westaway diverted the conversation by asking [me]0-i if [I]0-i thought [I]0-i should enjoy [my]0-i French visit ( how [every one]428-every one knows [one]658-one 's affairs ! ) . [I]0-i said [I]0-i hoped [I]0-i should , and [I]0-i was starting next week . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond at once pricked up [his]126-lord valmond ears , and said [he]126-lord valmond would be running over to [Paris]19-paris about then , as [he]126-lord valmond was not going to [Scotland]9-scotland till September , and [he]126-lord valmond hoped [I]0-i would let [him]126-lord valmond look after [me]0-i on the way . [I]0-i said [I]0-i did not know which day [I]0-i was going , probably Wednesday , so as [I]0-i am starting on Monday , [Mamma]132-mamma , there will be no chance of [his]126-lord valmond coming with [me]0-i , which would annoy [you]132-mamma very much [I]0-i am sure . To - day [we]810-we have done nothing but loll about and play croquet . [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby and [the men]450-the men and [some other women]812-some other women went to the Show again in the morning , but [I]0-i was having a match with [Jane Roose]127-jane roose , and so [we]810-we did not bother to go . [Paul]186-paul and [Virginia]127-jane roose This afternoon when [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby began [her]178-lady bobby rabbit shooting it seemed so dangerous on [the croquet lawn]733-the croquet lawn , especially after [she]178-lady bobby hit [the gardener]814-the gardener , that [we]810-we all went on [the lake]800-the lake in the launch . [We]810-we landed on [the island]816-the island , and somehow or other [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and [I]0-i got left alone in [the Belvedere]20-the belvedere looking at the view . [The others]487-the others went off without [us]810-we , which made [me]0-i furious , as [I]0-i am sure [he]126-lord valmond did it on purpose . But when [I]0-i accused [him]126-lord valmond of it , [he]126-lord valmond said such a thing would never have entered [his]126-lord valmond head . [He]126-lord valmond had a nasty smile all the time in the corner of [his]126-lord valmond eye , and did not take the least pains about trying to undo the other little boat which [we]810-we found at last , although [I]0-i kept telling [him]126-lord valmond [we]810-we should be late for dinner . [He]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond wished [we]810-we had not to go back at all , that [he]126-lord valmond thought [we]810-we should be very happy together on [this little island]818-this little island like [Paul]186-paul and [Virginia]127-jane roose . [I]0-i ca n't tell [you]819-you , [Mamma]132-mamma , what a temper [I]0-i was in . The Hardships of [a Marquis]416-a marquis [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had never met [him]126-lord valmond — or that [he]126-lord valmond had not been rude at [Nazeby]8-nazeby — it is so difficult to behave with dignity when [a person]821-a person has a nice voice and makes [you]819-you laugh , although [you]819-you are awfully cross with [him]821-a person inside . Then [I]0-i have to be thinking all the time about [my]0-i dimple not to let it come out , as that is what caused [his]126-lord valmond rudeness , and with one thing and another it upsets [me]0-i so , that [my]0-i cheeks are always burning when [I]0-i am with [him]126-lord valmond , and [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i should like to box [his]126-lord valmond ears or cry ; and [I]0-i hope after to - morrow [I]0-i shall never see [him]126-lord valmond again . [He]126-lord valmond rowed so slowly when [we]822-we did get into [the boat]823-the boat that [I]0-i offered to do it , but [he]126-lord valmond would not let [me]0-i . [I]0-i would not talk to [him]126-lord valmond at all . When [we]822-we got to [the landing]824-the landing [I]0-i jumped out so that [he]126-lord valmond should not help [me]0-i , and gave [my]0-i head a crack against the pole in [the boat house]825-the boat house . [I]0-i fancied [I]0-i heard [him]126-lord valmond saying , " [Darling]3126-darling ! have [you]3126-darling hurt [yourself]3126-darling ? What a brute [I]126-lord valmond am to tease [you]3126-darling ! "[126-lord valmond] but [I]0-i did not wait for any more . [I]0-i ran to [the house]526-the house as fast as [I]0-i could , and as [he]126-lord valmond had to tie up [the boat]823-the boat , [I]0-i was just getting into [the hall]396-the hall when [he]126-lord valmond caught [me]0-i up . [My]0-i head hurt dreadfully , and [I]0-i was so tired and cross , and everything , that the tears would come into [my]0-i eyes . [I]0-i did not want [him]126-lord valmond to see , but [I]0-i am afraid [he]126-lord valmond did , so before [he]126-lord valmond could speak [I]0-i rushed on again and got safely to [[my]0-i room]631-my room . [I]0-i am sure it is very rude to call [people]411-people " [darling]3126-darling "[132-mamma] without [their]411-people leave , is n't it , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i went in to dinner with [a sporting curate who lives near]831-a sporting curate who lives near , and [he]831-a sporting curate who lives near kept making [his]831-a sporting curate who lives near bread into crumbs on the cloth and then sweeping [them]411-people up with [his]831-a sporting curate who lives near knife into a heap , between every course . What strange habits [people]411-people have ! After dinner [Mrs. Westaway]177-mrs. westaway took [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and sat in the window seat , and when [he]126-lord valmond did get away , and was coming over to [me]0-i , [I]0-i said [my]0-i head was aching from the knock [I]0-i gave it , and came up to bed , and as [he]126-lord valmond has to catch [an early train]833-an early train in the morning [I]0-i sha n't come down until [he]126-lord valmond has gone . [I]0-i do n't want to see [him]126-lord valmond any more , it is too fatiguing quarrelling all the time , and [one]658-one could not forgive [him]126-lord valmond and be [friends]835-friends [I]0-i suppose after such behaviour as [his]126-lord valmond at [Nazeby]8-nazeby — could one , [Mamma]132-mamma ? Now good - night ; [I]0-i am [sleepy.—Your affectionate daughter]836-sleepy.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [P.S.—I]187-p.s.—i should hate to be [a marquis]416-a marquis always having to take [the hostess]770-the hostess in to dinner no matter how old and ugly [she]770-the hostess is , just because [a duke]839-a duke is n't present . Château De [Croixmare]22-croixmare , 16th August . A Formidable Godmother Dearest Mamma,—What a crossing [we]840-we had , perfectly disgusting ! The sky was without a cloud , but such a wind that [every one]428-every one was sick , so [one]658-one could not enjoy [oneself]658-one . Agnès became rapidly French too directly [we]840-we landed at [Dieppe]23-dieppe , and [the carriage]699-the carriage was full of stuffy people , who would not have a scrap of window open ; however , [Jean]188-jean was waiting for [us]840-we at [Paris]19-paris . [We]840-we snatched some food at [the restaurant]844-the restaurant , and then caught [the train]393-the train to [Vinant]24-vinant . [Jean]188-jean is quite good - looking , but with an awfully respectable expression . [Any one]536-any one could tell [he]847-he was married even without looking at [his]847-he wedding ring . [He]847-he was polite , and made conversation all the time in [the train]393-the train , and as the engine kept puffing and shrieking [I]0-i was obliged to continually say " Pardon ? "[0-i] so it made it rather heavy . [I]0-i think [he]847-he has changed a good deal since [their]849-their wedding — let [me]0-i see — that must be eight years ago , as [I]0-i was nine then ; [I]0-i hardly remembered [him]847-he . [Godmamma]189-godmamma was waiting for [us]840-we in [the hall]396-the hall when [we]840-we arrived . [Château de Croixmare]851-château de croixmare is a nice place , but [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i am not French . It was the hottest night of the year almost , and not a breath of air in [the house]526-the house , every shutter closed and the curtains drawn . [Héloise]190-héloise had gone to bed with a migraine , [Godmamma]189-godmamma explained , but [Victorine]191-victorine was [there]398-there . [She]191-victorine has grown up plain , and looks much more than five years older than [me]0-i . [They]849-their were n't in evening dress , or even tea - gowns like in [England]25-england — it did seem strange . [[Mme .]155-mme]854-mme . [de Croixmare]155-mme looks [a dragon]855-a dragon ! [I]0-i ca n't think how [poor papa]583-poor papa insisted upon [my]0-i having [such a godmother]857-such a godmother . [Her]191-victorine face is quite white , and [her]191-victorine hair so black and drawn off [her]191-victorine forehead , and [she]191-victorine has a bristly moustache . [She]191-victorine is also very up right and thin , and walks with an ebony stick , and [her]191-victorine voice is like a peacock 's . [She]191-victorine looked [me]0-i through and through , and [I]0-i felt all [my]0-i French getting jumbled , and it came out with such an English accent ; and after [we]858-we had bowed a good deal , and said heaps of Ollendorfish kind of sentences , [I]0-i was given some " sirop "[191-victorine] and water , and conducted to bed by [Victorine]191-victorine . [She]191-victorine is [a big dump with a shiny complexion , and such a very small mouth]859-a big dump with a shiny complexion , and such a very small mouth , and [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i shall hate [her]191-victorine , [she]191-victorine is n't a bit good - natured - looking like [Jean]188-jean . [The house]526-the house is really fine [Louis XV]192-louis xv . , and [[my]0-i bedroom]861-my bedroom and cabinet de toilette are delicious , so is [[my]0-i bed]862-my bed ; but the attitude of [Agnès]115-agnès — such a conscious pride in the superiority of [France]10-france — nearly drove [me]0-i mad . There is n't a decent dressing - table mirror , only one in an old silver frame about eight inches square , and that is sitting on the writing - table — or what would be the writing - table , if there happened to be any pens and things , which there are n't . All the hanging places open out of the panels of the wall , there are no wardrobes , only beautiful marble - topped bureaux ; but [I]0-i was so tired . [A French Family]863-a french family at [Home]390-home [I]0-i left [Agnès]115-agnès to settle everything and jumped into bed . This morning [I]0-i woke early , and had the loveliest cup of chocolate , but such a silly bath , and almost cold water . There are [no housemaids]865-no housemaids , and nothing is done with precise regularity like at [home]390-home , although [they]867-they are so rich . [Agnès]115-agnès had to fish for everything of that sort [herself]115-agnès , and such a lot of talking went on in [the passage between [her]115-agnès and [the valet de chambre]869-the valet de chambre]868-the passage between her and the valet de chambre , before [I]0-i even got this teeny tiny tray to splash in . However , [I]0-i did get dressed at last , and went for a walk in [the garden]870-the garden — not a soul about but [a few gardeners]871-a few gardeners . [The begonias]872-the begonias are magnificent , but there is no look of park beyond [the garden]870-the garden , or nice deer and things that [we]874-we would have for [such a house in [England]25-england]875-such a house in england . [It]876-it is more like [a sort of big villa]877-a sort of big villa . [I]0-i saw [Jean]188-jean at last in the distance , going round and round [a large pond]878-a large pond on [his]879-he bicycle . [He]879-he did look odd ! in a thick striped jersey , and the tightest knickerbockers ; almost as low as a " scorcher . "[879-he] [He]879-he jumped off and made a most polite bow , and explained [he]879-he was doing it for exercise . But [I]0-i do think that an idiotic reason — don't [you]880-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? It would be just as much exercise on [a road]881-a road . However , [he]879-he assured [me]0-i that , like that , [he]879-he knew exactly how many miles [he]879-he went on [the flat]882-the flat before breakfast , so [I]0-i suppose it was all right . [I]0-i saw [he]879-he wanted to continue [his]879-he ride , so [I]0-i walked on , and presently came to [a summer - house]883-a summer - house , where [Victorine]191-victorine and [the dame de compagnie]884-the dame de compagnie were doing [their]885-their morning reading . There were also [the two little girls building castles out of a heap of sand]886-the two little girls building castles out of a heap of sand , and with [them]886-the two little girls building castles out of a heap of sand [the most hideous German maid [you]888-you ever saw]887-the most hideous german maid you ever saw . [They]889-they are queer - looking little monkeys , [Yolande]193-yolande is like [Jean]188-jean , but [Marie]149-aunt maria — there are three years between [them]889-they — is as black as ink — but where was [I]0-i ? Oh , yes!--well , by this time [I]0-i was so hungry [I]0-i could have eaten them , [German bonne]194-german bonne and all ! Fortunately [Godmamma]189-godmamma turned up , and [we]890-we strolled back to [déjeûner]891-déjeûner . [Héloise]190-héloise was in [the salon]892-the salon , and [she]190-héloise is charming , such a contrast to the rest of [the party]893-the party . [She]190-héloise was beautifully dressed and so chic . [We]890-we took to [each other]437-each other at once , [she]190-héloise has not picked up that solid married look like [Jean]188-jean , so perhaps it is only [the husbands]895-the husbands who get it in [France]10-france . There was a good deal of ceremony going in to breakfast . [Jean]188-jean gave [[his]896-his mother]494-his mother [his]896-his arm , and [we]890-we trotted behind . [The dining - room]898-the dining - room is [a perfect room]899-a perfect room , except there is no carpet , and the food was lovely , only [I]0-i do hate to see a great hand covered with a white cotton glove , plopping a dish down on the lighted thing in the middle , so that one has to look at the next course all the time one is finishing the last one . The way in which [the two little monkeys]900-the two little monkeys and [the German maid]901-the german maid devoured [their]902-their breakfast quite took [one]658-one 's appetite away . [French Servants]908-french servants This afternoon [we]890-we are going to pay a visit of ceremony to [the Comte]909-the comte and [Comtesse de Tournelle]195-tournelle ; [we]890-we are going with [them]908-french servants on [[their]908-french servants yacht]910-their yacht down [the Seine]26-the seine to - morrow . A Visit of Ceremony [The young people]933-the young people have [their]933-the young people appartement in [the Champs Elysées]934-the champs elysées in [Paris]19-paris , and [the old ones]935-the old ones go to [the family hotel in [the Faubourg St. Germain]30-the faubourg st. germain]936-the family hotel in the faubourg st. germain . [We]937-we did say a lot of polite things when [we]937-we went to pay [our]937-we visit yesterday , and although [they]933-the young people know [one another]807-one another so well — as it was a " visit of ceremony "[933-the young people] to introduce [me]0-i — [we]937-we all had [our]937-we best clothes on , and sat in the large salon—(there are four [Louis XVI]202-louis xvi . arm chairs , sticking out each side of the fireplaces , in [all the salons here]939-all the salons here ) . [Héloise]190-héloise and [the Comtesse de Tournelle]195-tournelle are [great friends]940-great friends . [The Comte de Tournelle]203-the comte is charming , [he]203-the comte is like [the people in the last century Memoirs]941-the people in the last century memoirs , [he]203-the comte ought to have powdered hair , and [his]203-the comte manners have a distinction and a wit quite unlike anything in [England]25-england . [One]658-one can see [he]203-the comte is descended from [people who had [their]943-people who had their heads cut off for being aristocrats heads cut off for being aristocrats]943-people who had their heads cut off for being aristocrats . [Jean]188-jean says [he]203-the comte does not belong to [le Sporting]31-le sporting , and is fearfully effeminate . [He]203-the comte ca n't even put on [his]203-the comte own socks without [[his]203-the comte valet]944-his valet , and [he]203-the comte never rides or bicycles or anything , but just does a little motor - carring , and fights a few duels . [The Comtesse de Tournelle]195-tournelle is small and young and rather dull ; [she]195-tournelle reads a great deal . [The old boy]624-the old boy , [the Baron de Frémond]198-the baron de frémond ( [he]198-the baron de frémond owns [the Sauterelle]27-the sauterelle ) is [a jolly old soul]946-a jolly old soul , and chaffs [[his]198-the baron de frémond sister]947-his sister and [niece]948-niece , and [every one]428-every one , all the time , and thinks it so funny to talk fearful English . [The two young men]950-the two young men have n't looked at [me]0-i much . [They]950-the two young men are in uniform ! and [they]950-the two young men put [their]950-the two young men heels together and bowed deeply when [they]950-the two young men were introduced , but [we]951-we have n't spoken yet . [The Marquise de Vermondoise]199-the marquise de vermondoise is perfectly lovely , so fascinating , with such a queer deep voice , and one tooth at the side of the front missing ; and [her]195-tournelle tongue keeps getting in there when [she]195-tournelle speaks , which gives [her]195-tournelle a kind of lisp , and it is awfully attractive . [I]0-i think [de Tournelle]195-tournelle would like to kiss [her]195-tournelle , by the way [he]198-the baron de frémond looked at [her]195-tournelle when [she]195-tournelle thanked [him]198-the baron de frémond for handing [her]195-tournelle on board . The Invaluable [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte [It]204-hippolyte is [a steam yacht]952-a steam yacht with [a wee cabin]953-a wee cabin , and a deck above that , with seats looking out each side , like old omnibuses , and in the stern ( if that means the back part ) are [the sailors]954-the sailors and the engines , and the oddest arrangement of cooking apparatus . [You]955-you should just taste the exquisite breakfasts that [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte ( the Baronne de Larnac 's maître d'hôtel ) cooked for [us]951-we this morning after [we]951-we started . [He]204-hippolyte is the queerest creature , with a face like a baboon , and side whiskers , and the rest a deep blue from shaving . [The Baronne]197-the baronne says [she]197-the baronne could not live without [him]204-hippolyte ; [he]204-hippolyte is [a splendid cook]956-a splendid cook , and [a perfect femme de chambre]957-a perfect femme de chambre , and ready for anything . [He]204-hippolyte is much more familiar than [we]951-we should ever let [a servant]958-a servant be in [England]25-england . It was rough all the morning , quite waves . [The Seine]26-the seine is only half a mile from [the Château de Croixmare]959-the château de croixmare , and runs past [[the Tournelles]960-the tournelles ' garden]961-the tournelles ' garden , so [they]960-the tournelles have a private landing stage , and [we]951-we all embarked from there . [Jean]188-jean and [the Comte]203-the comte are dressed in beautiful English blue serges , and look neat enough to be under a glass case . [The old Baron]962-the old baron does not care what [he]962-the old baron wears , and this morning while [he]962-the old baron was working with [the sailors]954-the sailors had on a black Sunday coat ! [The Baronne]197-the baronne kept screaming when [the boat]823-the boat rocked a little . " Nous ferons naufrage ! [Mon Dieu]3128-mon dieu ! [Mon Dieu]32-mon dieu ! "[197-the baronne] and [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte tried to comfort [her]197-the baronne , but [she]197-the baronne did not stop till [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte popped [his]204-hippolyte head out of [the cabin]966-the cabin and said , " Pas de danger ! et il ne faut pas que Mme . la Baronne fasse la Bebête ! "[204-hippolyte] At déjeûner [we]951-we had only one plate each , and one knife and fork . It was so windy [we]951-we could not have it under the awning in the bows , and [the cabin]966-the cabin is so narrow that the seats are against the wall , and the table in the middle . [No one]744-no one can pass to wait , so between the courses [we]951-we washed [our]951-we plates in [the Seine]26-the seine , out of the window . It was gay ! [They]969-they are all so witty , but it is not considered correct to talk just to [[one]658-one 's neighbour]971-one 's neighbour , a conversation à deux . Everything must be general , so it is a continual sharpening of wits , and [one]658-one has to shout a good deal , as otherwise , with [every one]428-every one talking at once , [one]658-one would not be heard . [I]0-i know French pretty well as [you]975-you know , but [they]969-they say a lot of strange things [I]0-i ca n't understand , and whenever [I]0-i answer or ask why , [they]969-they go into fits of laughter and say , " Est elle gentille l'enfant ! hein ! "[969-they] [We]951-we are going to stop at [the next small village]976-the next small village to post the letters , so good - bye , [dear Mamma.—Your affectionate daughter]461-dear mamma.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Vernon Dearest Mamma,—The]208-vernon scenery [we]980-we came through yesterday is quite beautiful , but [I]0-i did not pay so much attention to it as [I]0-i might have done , because [Jean]188-jean and [the Comte]909-the comte would talk to [me]0-i . [You]979-you would be amused at [Vernon]33-vernon , where [we]980-we stayed the night in [such an inn]982-such an inn ! [I]0-i believe [it]33-vernon is [the only one in [the place]984-the place]983-the only one in the place , and as old as [the hills]985-the hills . [You]979-you get at [the bedrooms]986-the bedrooms from [an open gallery that runs round [the courtyard]988-the courtyard]987-an open gallery that runs round the courtyard , and that smells of garlic and [stables]989-stables . [We]980-we got [here]391-here about six , and started en masse to inspect [the rooms]534-the rooms . [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte had engaged [them]534-the rooms beforehand , and seemed rather apologetic about [them]534-the rooms , and finally , when there did not appear half enough to go round , [he]204-hippolyte shrugged [his]204-hippolyte shoulders almost up to [his]204-hippolyte ears and said , " Que voulez vous ! "[204-hippolyte] and that " Ces Messieurs "[204-hippolyte] would have to be " très bourgeois en voyage , "[204-hippolyte] and that there was nothing for it but that [Mme]155-mme . [la Comtesse de [Tournelle]203-the comte]992-la comtesse de tournelle should " partager l'appartement de [Monsieur le Comte de Tournelle]203-the comte , "[209-la comtesse de croixmare] and that [Monsieur le Comte de Croixmare]196-the comte would have to extend like hospitality to [Mme]155-mme . [la Comtesse de Croixmare]209-la comtesse de croixmare . This caused shrieks of derision . [Héloise]190-héloise said [she]190-héloise would prefer to sleep on the dining - room table , and " [Antoine]207-antoine "[204-hippolyte] said [he]204-hippolyte thought [people]411-people ought to be a little more careful of [their]411-people reputations even en voyage . Finally [they]534-the rooms unearthed [a baby]994-a baby 's cot in [the room that [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte had designed for [the Croixmare menage]996-the croixmare menage]995-the room that hippolyte had designed for the croixmare menage , and [de Tournelle]203-the comte said it was the very thing for [me]0-i , but [Jean]188-jean replied , " Mon cher ami c'est une Bébé beaucoup trop emoustillante , "[188-jean] which [I]0-i thought very rude , just as if [I]0-i snored , or something dreadful like that . Then , after a further prowl , a fearful little hole was discovered beyond , with no curtains to the windows , or blinds , or shutters , just a scrap of net . The face of [Agnès]115-agnès when [she]115-agnès saw it ! A Necessary Precaution Dinner was not until seven , so [Jean]188-jean and [I]0-i went out for a walk ; as [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte advised [us]997-us to try and find [a chemist]998-a chemist and buy some flea powder . " Je trouverai ça plus prudent , "[204-hippolyte] [he]204-hippolyte said . [Jean]188-jean is getting quite natural with [me]0-i now , and is n't so awfully polite . [The chemist]999-the chemist took [us]997-us for [a honeymoon couple]1000-a honeymoon couple ( as , of course , if [I]0-i had been French [I]0-i could not have gone for a walk with [Jean]188-jean alone ) . [He]999-the chemist — [the chemist]999-the chemist — was so sympathetic , [he]999-the chemist had only one packet of powder left , [he]999-the chemist said , as so much was required by [the voyageurs]1002-the voyageurs and [inhabitants]1003-inhabitants that [he]999-the chemist was out of it ( that did not sound a pleasant prospect for [[our]997-us night)—"Mais]3134-our night)—"mais , [madame]3135-madame "[999-the chemist] ( that 's [me]0-i ) , " n'est pas assez grasse pour les attirer , "[999-the chemist] [he]999-the chemist added by way of consolation . It was spitting with rain when [we]997-us got back , and [they]1004-they all made such a fuss for fear [I]0-i had got wet , and [they]1004-they would not for worlds stir out of doors to see [the church]1005-the church or anything , which [I]0-i heard is very picturesque . [We]997-us had such an amusing dinner , the food was wonderful , considering the place , but a horrible cloth and pewter forks and spoons . There were [two officiers]1006-two officiers at another table ( only [infantry]1007-infantry ) , and [they]1006-two officiers were so interested in [our]997-us party . [Close Quarters " Antoine]207-antoine "[999-the chemist] sat next to [me]0-i , and in a pause in the general conversation [he]999-the chemist said to [me]0-i ( it is the first time [he]999-the chemist has addressed [me]0-i directly ) , " Il fait mauvais temps , mademoiselle . "[999-the chemist] [I]0-i have heard [him]999-the chemist saying all kinds of drôle things to [the others]487-the others , so it shows [he]999-the chemist can be quite intelligent . It is just because [I]0-i am not married [I]0-i suppose , so [I]0-i said that is what [English people]1009-english people always spoke about — the weather — and [I]0-i wanted to hear something different in [France]10-france . [He]999-the chemist seemed perfectly shocked , and hardly spoke to [me]0-i after that , but [the Vicomte , who was listening]1010-the vicomte , who was listening , began at once to say flattering things across the table . [They]1011-they all make compliments upon [my]0-i French , and are very gay and kind , but [I]0-i wish [they]1011-they did not eat so badly . [The Comte]909-the comte and [the Marquise]1013-the marquise , who are [cousins]711-cousins , and of [the very oldest noblesse]1015-the very oldest noblesse , are the worst — one dare n't look sometimes . [The Comtesse]209-la comtesse de croixmare is a little better , but then [[her]209-la comtesse de croixmare family]1016-her family is only [Empire]210-empire , and [Jean]188-jean and [Héloise]190-héloise are fairly decent . [I]0-i could bear most of it , if it was n't for the peppermint glasses at the end , which [the men]450-the men have . [The whole party]1018-the whole party are very French , not a bit like [the people [we]1020-we see at [Cannes]34-cannes , who have been much with [the English]211-the english]1019-the people we see at cannes , who have been much with the english . It is a different thing altogether . When dinner was over the rain stopped , and after a lot of talk — as to whether [the ground]1021-the ground would be too damp or not — [we]1020-we at last ventured for a walk down to [the bridge]1022-the bridge and back . Then [we]1020-we returned and commenced a general powdering of the beds , beginning with [the [de Tournelles]212-the tournelles ' apartment]1023-the de tournelles ' apartment ; next [we]1020-we went to [the Marquise's]213-the marquise's — [she]213-the marquise's had such an exquisite nightgown laid out , it was made of pink chiffon . When [we]1020-we got to [[my]0-i room]631-my room [they]1025-they made all kinds of sympathies for [me]0-i having such a small and stuffy place . The powder was all gone before [we]1020-we could sprinkle the [Baronne]197-the baronne 's bed . [Agnès]115-agnès was not quite so uppish undressing [me]0-i as usual . Perhaps [she]213-the marquise's realised this part of [[her]213-the marquise's [France]10-france]1026-her france was not so good as [England]25-england . Next morning when [I]0-i got down — [we]1020-we had arranged to have [our]1020-we premier déjeûner all together , not in [[our]1020-we rooms]1027-our rooms , as [we]1020-we were to make such an early start—"Antoine "[214-the vicomte] and [Héloise]190-héloise were already there . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte and [the Baronne]197-the baronne came in soon after ; [he]214-the vicomte at once began : " Comme Mlle . est ravissante le soir ! [un petit ange à son déshabillé]3136-un petit ange à son déshabillé ! Une si éblouissante chevelure ! "[214-the vicomte] A Conjugal Experiment [The wretch]1028-the wretch had been watching [me]0-i from [the opposite gallery]1029-the opposite gallery , was n't it odious of [him]1028-the wretch , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [No Englishman]1030-no englishman would have done such a thing . "[195-tournelle] [The two young men]950-the two young men leave [us]1045-us for the day , to do [their]950-the two young men duty at [Versailles]29-versailles , but are to meet [us]1045-us again at [Rouen]35-rouen in the evening , with leave for a few days . [We]1045-us are just going on board , so [I]0-i will finish this presently . 5 p.m.—The scenery is too beautiful after [you]1046-you pass [Vernon]208-vernon , and it was so interesting getting in and out of the locks . [The Baronne]197-the baronne and [I]0-i and [Jean]188-jean talked together on [the raised deck]1047-the raised deck , while [de Tournelle]195-tournelle read to [the Marquise]1013-the marquise in the bows . [The old Baron]962-the old baron is mostly with [the sailors]954-the sailors , and [Héloise]190-héloise slept a good deal . La Baronne pionce c'est très très intéressant . "[204-hippolyte] [I]0-i ca n't tell [you]1046-you what [a drôle creature]1053-a drôle creature [he]1053-a drôle creature is . [Caudebec]38-caudebec , Saturday , 20th August . A Visit to [Rouen]35-rouen Dearest Mamma,—To - day has been the loveliest [I]0-i ever remember , not a cloud in the sky . [We]1061-we landed at [Rouen]35-rouen the day before yesterday about six , and [the hotel]1063-the hotel [we]1061-we stopped at was quite decent , and although the windows of [[my]0-i room]631-my room looked upon [the inner courtyard]1065-the inner courtyard [they]1066-they at least had shutters . [I]0-i wanted to go and see the marks the flames of [Joan of Arc]215-joan of arc 's burning had made on the wall , but [every one]428-every one was so hungry , [we]1061-we had to have dinner so early , there was n't time . [Canard]39-canard à la Rouennaise is good , it is done here with a wine called Grenache . [I]0-i had two helpings , and just as [we]1061-we were finishing , the Vicomte and " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1069-their] came in from [the station]698-the station . [They]1069-their are n't in uniform now , but [their]1069-their hair does stick up so , and somehow [their]1069-their clothes do n't look comfortable . [I]0-i liked [them]1069-their in uniform best . [Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise talked to " [Antoine]207-antoine "[216-madame de vermandoise] across the table quite a lot . That is the only way [one]658-one may speak directly to [a person]821-a person , it seems . After dinner [we]1061-we went in search of some place of amusement , but there was [no theatre open]1072-no theatre open , so [we]1061-we had to content [ourselves]1061-we with a walk along [the quay]1073-the quay , and then [we]1061-we came back and drank sirop . It is sweet and nice , and [you]1074-you can have it raspberry , or gooseberry , or what [you]1074-you like , and [I]0-i am sure if [the people in [England]25-england who drink nasty old ports and things]1075-the people in england who drink nasty old ports and things could have it [they]1075-the people in england who drink nasty old ports and things would like it much better . [The Baronne]197-the baronne calls [all the men]1076-all the men by [their]1076-all the men end names like " [Tournelle]195-tournelle , "[197-the baronne] " [Croixmare]147-madame de croixmare , "[197-the baronne] " Trémors , "[197-the baronne] & c. , and [every one]428-every one is very devoted to [her]1078-her , and [I]0-i daresay [she]1078-her is even older than [you]1074-you , [mamma]564-mamma ; is n't it wonderful ? [Jean]188-jean now always sits beside [me]0-i , [I]0-i suppose [he]0-i thinks [he]0-i is [[my]0-i host]1080-my host , but [I]0-i would rather have [the Vicomte de la Trémors , who is very amusing . But to go back to [Rouen]35-rouen]1081-the vicomte de la trémors , who is very amusing . but to go back to rouen . It was a treat to sleep fearlessly in a clean bed after [Vernon]208-vernon , and [I]0-i actually had a bath in the morning . [I]0-i do n't know where [Agnès]115-agnès retrieved it from . " [Coiffer St. Catherine]217-coiffer st. catherine "[115-agnès] [You]1074-you can see [Joan of Arc]215-joan of arc 's flames quite plain , [we]1082-we went [there]398-there as soon as [we]1082-we were dressed . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1084-him] would insist it was only the black from a smoky chimney , but [I]0-i paid no attention to [him]1084-him . [The Horloge]218-the horloge is nice , and [we]1082-we did a lot of [churches]1085-churches , but [they]1085-churches always look to [me]0-i just the same , and any way [they]1085-churches all smell alike , and [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i shall bother with any more . [We]1082-we had breakfast on [the Sauterelle]27-the sauterelle , but it was so fine after [we]1082-we left [Vernon]33-vernon , and yesterday , that [we]1082-we could have it each day in the bows under the awning , and so had not to wash [our]1082-we forks and plates . [The Châteaux]219-the châteaux are so picturesque , and [such woods]1086-such woods ! after [you]1087-you leave [Rouen]35-rouen . [Héloise]190-héloise did not sleep yesterday . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] talked so much , [no one]744-no one could really have had a comfortable nap . In the afternoon [the Marquise]1013-the marquise told [us]1082-we [our]1082-we fortunes ; [she]1013-the marquise said [Héloise]190-héloise would marry twice , which made [her]1013-the marquise look as pleased as [Punch]220-punch , but [Jean]188-jean did not think it at all funny , though [every one else]436-every one else laughed [She]1013-the marquise told [me]0-i [I]0-i should probably be [an old maid]1091-an old maid ( " [Coiffer St. Catherine]217-coiffer st. catherine "[1013-the marquise] ) , and so [I]0-i said in that case [I]0-i should run pins into [the horrid old saint]1092-the horrid old saint 's head : [I]0-i simply wo n't be [an old maid]1091-an old maid , [Mamma]564-mamma , so [they]1095-they need not make any more predictions . However , it would be worse to be one here than at [home]390-home , because even up to forty , if [you]1097-you are n't married , [you]1097-you may n't go to [the nice theatres]1098-the nice theatres , or talk to [people]411-people alone , or even speak much more than " Yes "[38-caudebec] and " No , "[38-caudebec] and [you]1097-you generally get a nasty moustache or something . [We]1100-we saw [a whole family of elderly girls at [[our]1100-we hotel at [Rouen]35-rouen]1102-our hotel at rouen]1101-a whole family of elderly girls at our hotel at rouen , and [they]1101-a whole family of elderly girls at our hotel at rouen all had moustaches or moles on the cheek . [We]1100-we got [here]391-here ( [Caudebec]38-caudebec ) yesterday soon after four . [[Our]1100-we inn]1104-our inn looks right on to [the Seine]26-the seine , and is as old nearly as [the one at [Vernon]33-vernon]1105-the one at vernon , but fortunately beautifully clean . Only [you]1097-you have to get at [[your]1097-you room]3095-your room through [somebody else]1107-somebody else 's . [Mine]1108-mine is beyond [the Baronne 's]1109-the baronne 's and [Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise gets at [hers]216-madame de vermandoise through [[the Comtesse de Tournelle]195-tournelle 's]1110-the comtesse de tournelle 's . [Hers]216-madame de vermandoise is the most ridiculous place , with a red curtain hanging across so that sometimes it can be turned into two ; and such a thing happened last night . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[203-the comte] went in with [the Comte de Tournelle]203-the comte to help [him]1111-him to shut the window , as [Madame de Tournelle]222-madame de tournelle could n't , when a gust of wind blew the door shut , and whether there was a spring lock or not [I]0-i do n't know , but any way nothing would induce it to open again . So there [they]1112-they were . [We]1113-we had stayed up rather late ; [the landlord]1114-the landlord and [the servants]1115-the servants were in bed . [They]1112-they rattled and shook and pushed , but to no purpose . [[A Misadventure]1116-a misadventure]1116-a misadventure There was only a board partition between [[my]0-i room]631-my room and [[Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise 's]1119-madame de vermandoise 's , so [I]0-i could hear everything , and [Tournelle]195-tournelle said there was nothing for it but that " [Antoine]207-antoine "[195-tournelle] would have to sleep in the other bed in [[her]195-tournelle room]767-her room . [She]195-tournelle screamed a great deal , and [they]1112-they all laughed very much , and all talked at once , so [I]0-i suppose that was why [I]0-i could not understand quite everything [they]1112-they were saying . At last [the Baronne]197-the baronne rushed into [[my]0-i room]631-my room to discover what the noise was . [She]197-the baronne looks perfectly odd when going to bed ; a good deal seemed to have come off ; [she]197-the baronne is as thin as a lath ; and on the dressing table was such a sweet lace nightcap , with lovely baby curls sewed to its edge , and when [she]197-the baronne put that on [she]197-the baronne did look sweet . It is n't that [she]197-the baronne has no hair [herself]197-the baronne , it 's thick and brown ; but [she]197-the baronne explained that having to wear a nightcap because of ear - ache , [she]197-the baronne found it more becoming with the curls . [I]0-i suppose it is on account of [the waiters]1122-the waiters coming in with the breakfast that [they]1122-the waiters have to be so particular in [France]10-france how [they]1122-the waiters look in bed . But to go on about the door . [We]1123-we sent [[the Baronne]197-the baronne 's maid]1124-the baronne 's maid and [Agnès]115-agnès to try and find [the landlord]1114-the landlord ; but , after exploring untold depths below and above , [they]1126-they only succeeded in unearthing [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte . [He]204-hippolyte came up from [his]204-hippolyte bed looking just like that very clever Missing Link that was at [Barnum 's]41-barnum 's , do [you]1127-you remember?—the one that sometimes was [an Irishwoman]1128-an irishwoman , and could do housework in a cage by itself . [I]0-i do n't know exactly what [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte had on , but it ended up with a petticoat of red and black plaid , and a pair of grey linen trousers over [his]204-hippolyte shoulders ; [his]204-hippolyte whiskers and hair were standing straight on end , and [his]204-hippolyte shaved bits were bluer than ever at night . [He]204-hippolyte said a good deal of the French equivalent of , " Here 's a pretty kettle of fish , "[204-hippolyte] and shrugged so that [I]0-i was afraid the petticoat would slip off ; and finally , when all the pushing and pulling had no effect on the door , [he]204-hippolyte said [people]411-people must resign [themselves]411-people to the accidents of travel , and as there were four beds , [he]204-hippolyte did not see that [they]1126-they had too much to complain of . " Not Much to Complain of "[190-héloise] At this moment [Héloise]190-héloise came out of [[her]190-héloise room]767-her room to see what the commotion was . [She]190-héloise understood it was [[her]190-héloise husband]475-her husband locked in [the room]401-the room , and [she]190-héloise laughed too very much , and said [they]1126-they must just stay there ; but when [she]190-héloise heard the voice of " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] [she]190-héloise seemed to think the situation grave — [I]0-i suppose because [he]204-hippolyte is not married — and [she]190-héloise also did everything [she]190-héloise could to open the door . Of course if [they]1126-they had been [Englishmen]1133-englishmen [they]1126-they would have simply kicked it down , and got out without more ado , but the French are n't strong enough for that . [Héloise]190-héloise became quite disagreeable about it , though as it was n't [Jean]188-jean [I]0-i ca n't think what business it was of [hers]190-héloise . [She]190-héloise said it was because " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] did not really try , and [she]190-héloise was sure [he]204-hippolyte had done it on purpose , upon which [Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise gurgled with mirth . [I]0-i could hear both sides [you]1134-you see , because of the wooden partition . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[204-hippolyte] came into [the inner room]1135-the inner room and said [he]204-hippolyte was " Doux comme un petit agneau , "[204-hippolyte] but [the Marquise]1013-the marquise said that [he]204-hippolyte was " Un loup dans une peau de mouton , "[204-hippolyte] and must go away . Finally [the whole of the rest of the party in different stages of déshabillé]1137-the whole of the rest of the party in different stages of déshabillé got collected outside the door . [No landlord]1138-no landlord was to be found anywhere . Then [the old Baron]962-the old baron suggested quite a simple plan , which was for [Madame de Tournelle]222-madame de tournelle to share [[Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise 's room]1140-madame de vermandoise 's room , and to leave [the Comte]909-the comte and " [Antoine]207-antoine "[909-the comte] in [[her]216-madame de vermandoise room]767-her room . [No one]744-no one seemed to have thought of this before ; and that is what [they]1144-they finally did , and at last [we]1145-we got to sleep . In the morning [no landlord]1138-no landlord could still be found , and [we]1145-we had no coffee , but presently [he]1138-no landlord arrived accompanied by [two gendarmes]1147-two gendarmes and goodness knows what [other rabble armed with sticks]1148-other rabble armed with sticks , and [they]1144-they wanted to proceed [upstairs]470-upstairs . [We]1145-we heard every sort of " Sacrés ! "[1144-they] going on between [them]1144-they and [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte , and eventually [the landlord]1114-the landlord almost crawled up apologising , and opened the door with [his]1114-the landlord key . [A Cautious Landlord]223-a cautious landlord It appears that hearing the noise of the door being tried to be opened and [Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise 's screams , [he]223-a cautious landlord had thought it wiser to decamp for the night , as two years ago there had been a murder [there]398-there , and [he]223-a cautious landlord had had " beaucoup d'embêtement , "[223-a cautious landlord] [he]223-a cautious landlord said , on account of it , and was determined not to be mixed up in one again , " En ces affaires là , il est bien assez tôt d'arriver le lendemain , "[223-a cautious landlord] [he]223-a cautious landlord said . [Everybody]404-everybody was still laughing too much over the situation to be angry with [him]1138-no landlord ; and the coffee , which [we]1145-we got at last , was so good it made up for it ; but [you]1153-you should have heard the plaisanteries [they]1144-they made over the night 's adventure ! [Caudebec]38-caudebec is [an odd place]1154-an odd place ; [it]38-caudebec used to be inhabited by [hundreds of [Protestant beaver hat - makers]1156-protestant beaver hat - makers , who fled from [there]398-there after the Edict of [Nantes]224-nantes ' affair]1155-hundreds of protestant beaver hat - makers , who fled from there after the edict of nantes ' affair , and so there are streets of [deserted houses]1158-deserted houses still , and so old , one has a stream down the middle . [I]0-i would not go into [the church]1005-the church : the usual smell met [me]0-i at the door ; so [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte and [Jean]188-jean and [I]0-i went for a walk , and now [we]1145-we are just going to start on [the Sauterelle]27-the sauterelle again , and this must be posted . [I]0-i have managed to write it on [my]0-i knee , sitting on a stone bench outside [the inn]1161-the inn door.—Good - bye , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma , with love from [[your]1162-dear mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . Hotel [Frascati]42-frascati , [Havre]43-havre , Sunday , 21st August . [Havre]43-havre to [Trouville]44-trouville Dearest Mamma,—I am sorry [our]1145-we nice voyage is nearly finished , for [we]1145-we go over to [Trouville]44-trouville this evening , and from [there]398-there by [train]915-train back to [Vinant]24-vinant . [The river]704-the river is not nearly so pretty after [you]1162-dear mamma leave [Caudebec]38-caudebec , but [Tancarville]45-tancarville is fine , and looks very imposing sitting up so high . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte has been talking to [me]0-i all the time , but [Jean]188-jean stays by . [We]1145-we were dusty and sun - burnt by the time [we]1145-we got to [Havre]43-havre , and [Héloise]190-héloise and [the Marquise]1013-the marquise and [I]0-i started at once for [the big baths]1168-the big baths . [They]1168-the big baths do not quite join [the hotel]1063-the hotel , so [we]1145-we covered a good deal of absence , in the way of dress , by [our]1145-we faithful mackintoshes and trotted across . On the steps [we]1145-we met [de Tournelle]222-madame de tournelle just coming out from [the baths]1170-the baths ; [he]1171-he laughed when [he]1171-he saw [us]1145-we , and said [he]1171-he had never before realised that garments of so much respectability could have such possibilities ! Oh ! how nice to have a real bath again ! A Gay Dinner [Agnès]115-agnès has n't enjoyed this trip much , [I]0-i can see . [Heaven]225-heaven knows where [she]115-agnès has slept ! [I]0-i thought it wiser not to ask . [We]1145-we had such a gay dinner . [I]0-i am getting accustomed to shouting across the table at [every one]428-every one ; it will feel quite queer just talking to [[one]658-one 's neighbour]971-one 's neighbour when [I]0-i get back to [England]25-england . [The restaurant at [Frascati]42-frascati]1175-the restaurant at frascati is n't at all bad , and it was agreeable to have proper food again . [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte thinks [we]1145-we are awfully greedy ; [he]204-hippolyte was heard yesterday grumbling to [[the Baronne]197-the baronne 's maid]1124-the baronne 's maid , " Mais où diable est - ce que ces dames mettent tout ce qu'elles mangent ? Elles goblottent toute la journée ! "[204-hippolyte] After dinner [we]1145-we drank [our]1145-we coffee on [the terrace]545-the terrace and listened to [the band]1178-the band . [Héloise]190-héloise would hardly speak to " [Antoine]207-antoine "[216-madame de vermandoise] all day , and [he]204-hippolyte looked perfectly miserable , and [Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise every now and then laughed to [herself]216-madame de vermandoise — [I]0-i do n't know what at . However [we]1145-we took a walk on [the pier]1179-the pier presently , and as there was such [a crowd]1180-a crowd [we]1145-we were n't able to walk all together as usual , but had to go two and two . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] walked with [Héloise]190-héloise , and [I]0-i suppose [they]1181-they made it up . [I]0-i just caught this : " N'oubliez jamais , [bien chère Madame]3142-bien chère madame , qu'une église a deux portes . "[0-i] [Héloise]190-héloise said [she]190-héloise would not forget , and [he]204-hippolyte thanked [her]190-héloise rapturously ; but what it meant [I]0-i do n't know . [They]1181-they have both smiled often since so [I]0-i expect it is some French idiom for reconciliation . [The crowd on [the pier]1179-the pier]1182-the crowd on the pier was common , and [we]1145-we returned to [[Frascati]42-frascati 's garden]1184-frascati 's garden . It was so fearfully hot , that beyond wondering if the dew was falling , [no one]744-no one suggested [we]1145-we should get cold , as [they]1181-they always do . It really has been a delightful trip , and [I]0-i have enjoyed it so . [They]1181-they are all charming . [They]1181-they seem to have kinder hearts than [some of [the people at [Nazeby]8-nazeby]677-the people at nazeby]1186-some of the people at nazeby , but what strikes [one]658-one as quite different is that [every one]428-every one is witty ; [they]1181-they are making epigrams or clever tournures de phrases all the time , and do n't seem to talk of the teeny weeny things [we]1145-we do in [England]25-england . [They]1181-they have most exquisite manners , and extraordinarily unpleasant personal habits , like eating , and coughing , and picking [their]1181-they teeth , etc . ; but [they]1181-they do have nice under - clothes , and lovely soaps and scents and things . Views for [Victorine]191-victorine [The Frascati beds]1190-the frascati beds were comfortable , and [I]0-i could not wake in the morning , in spite of [Agnès]115-agnès fussing about . [The Vicomte]965-the vicomte has awakened every one each day by rapping at [their]965-the vicomte doors , but this morning [I]0-i was at last aroused by [Héloise]190-héloise , who had [the next room]1192-the next room , and [we]1145-we had [our]1145-we coffee together . [She]190-héloise says [she]190-héloise does hope soon to get [Victorine]191-victorine married , and that [they]1193-they have [a nephew of [the Baronne]197-the baronne 's]1194-a nephew of the baronne 's in view , but [he]1194-a nephew of the baronne 's has not seen [her]190-héloise yet . It appears it is easier to get [them]1193-they off if [they]1193-they are quiet looking and dowdy , but not so aggressive as [Victorine]191-victorine . [You]1195-you have n't much chance if [you]1195-you are very pretty and lively ; as [she]190-héloise says , [the men]450-the men only like [you]1195-you to be that when [you]1195-you are married to [some one else]1197-some one else . [Héloise]190-héloise wishes to have everything smart as [the Tournelles]212-the tournelles have , but [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [Victorine]191-victorine are always against [her]190-héloise . [She]190-héloise says life there is for ever eating galette de plomp , which [I]0-i suppose means a suet pudding feeling . [We]1198-we all went to [High Mass]46-high mass at eleven ; it was very pretty , and [such a good - looking priest]1199-such a good - looking priest handed the bag . [I]0-i should hate to be [a priest]1200-a priest ; should n't [you]1195-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [You]1195-you may n't even look at any one nice . [A Full - blown Bride]1206-a full - blown bride [P.S.—I]187-p.s.—i forgot to tell [you]1195-you the story of the " Côte des deux Amants . "[1195-you] [You]1195-you know [the fearfully straight , steep hill]1207-the fearfully straight , steep hill [we]1198-we have often noticed from [the train]393-the train if [you]1195-you go to [Paris]19-paris from [Dieppe]23-dieppe . Well , [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte told [us]1198-we the story when [we]1198-we passed [it]1207-the fearfully straight , steep hill . It is quite close from [the river]704-the river , and looks as if it had been cut with a knife , it is so steep . It appears that in the Middle Ages there was [a castle on the top]1210-a castle on the top , and there lived [a Comte who had [a tremendously stout daughter]1212-a tremendously stout daughter]1211-a comte who had a tremendously stout daughter . [He]1211-a comte who had a tremendously stout daughter said [no one]744-no one should have [her]1212-a tremendously stout daughter and [her]1212-a tremendously stout daughter fortune unless [he]1211-a comte who had a tremendously stout daughter was strong enough to carry [her]1212-a tremendously stout daughter from the bottom to [the top of [the hill]1215-the hill]1214-the top of the hill . [Hundreds]228-hundreds tried — it was [a beauty then to be fat]1216-a beauty then to be fat — but [every one]428-every one dropped [her]1212-a tremendously stout daughter half - way , and [the poor thing]1218-the poor thing got " très fatiguée d'être plantée comme ça , "[1219-a handsome cavalier] when [a handsome cavalier]1219-a handsome cavalier came along , and [he]1219-a handsome cavalier succeeded . [His]1211-a comte who had a tremendously stout daughter snorts of out - of - breathness could be heard for miles , but [he]1211-a comte who had a tremendously stout daughter got [her]1212-a tremendously stout daughter to the top and then fell dead at [her]1212-a tremendously stout daughter feet ; and [she]1212-a tremendously stout daughter went into [a convent]1220-a convent and died . [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte said also that the other ending of the story was , that [she]1212-a tremendously stout daughter got so thin from pining for [the knight]1221-the knight that [the next one who came along]1222-the next one who came along had no difficulty , and so [they]1223-they married and lived happy ever after . But [I]0-i like the tragic end best . And [he]204-hippolyte said that [the peasants]1224-the peasants still declare [they]1224-the peasants can hear [the knight]1221-the knight wheezing on moonlight nights , but " [Antoine]207-antoine "[204-hippolyte] said it was probably a traction engine . And [I]0-i do n't think it nice of [him]1211-a comte who had a tremendously stout daughter ; do [you]1226-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? Château de Croixmare , 24th August . Dearest Mamma,—I am quite sure [I]0-i shall never be able to stand the whole fortnight more here . [We]1227-we got back on Monday evening , and [Godmamma]189-godmamma was as disagreeable as could be . [She]189-godmamma said all sorts of spiteful things about [the Tournelles]960-the tournelles , and especially [the Baronne]197-the baronne ; and [Jean]188-jean looked nervous and uncomfortable , and [Héloise]190-héloise like a mule ; and [Victorine]191-victorine said [I]0-i had no doubt enjoyed [myself]0-i , but for [her]191-victorine part [she]191-victorine would be sorry to be taken for [a " young married woman]3143-a " young married woman , "[191-victorine] which was what [Madame de Visac]229-madame de visac ( [a woman who came to call after [we]1227-we left]1229-a woman who came to call after we left ) had said—"Qui est cette jeune femme avec [votre belle soeur]3144-votre belle soeur ? "[1229-a woman who came to call after we left] [Modest Maidens]230-modest maidens [She]1229-a woman who came to call after we left had seen [us]1227-we embarking . So [I]0-i said [I]0-i was flattered , as that seemed to mean in [France]10-france all that was attractive in contrast to [the girls]569-the girls . Did [you]1231-you ever hear of such a cat , [Mamma]132-mamma ? and considering that [I]0-i am only seventeen , and [she]1229-a woman who came to call after we left is [an old maid of twenty - two]1232-an old maid of twenty - two ; [I]0-i think it too ridiculous . [She]1229-a woman who came to call after we left need not fear , [no one]744-no one would ever think [she]1229-a woman who came to call after we left was married , [she]1229-a woman who came to call after we left looks like [a lumping German governess]1234-a lumping german governess . [Two of [[her]1229-a woman who came to call after we left girl friends]1236-her girl friends]1235-two of her girl friends came to breakfast yesterday , of course with [[their]1235-two of her girl friends mothers]620-their mothers , and [you]1231-you should have heard the idiot conversation [we]1238-we had ! [All]501-all plopped down on the great sofa in [the big salon]1240-the big salon , like a row of dolls . [They]1241-the two friends asked [me]0-i endless questions , and giggled , and [I]0-i did tell [them]1241-the two friends some things ! [They]1241-the two friends asked also about [England]25-england , and was it really true that when [we]1238-we went to a ball [we]1238-we stayed with [[our]1238-we danseurs]1242-our danseurs till the next dance ? [I]0-i said [I]0-i had not been to a ball yet , but had always heard that is what [one]658-one did . [One of [the friends]1245-the friends]1244-one of the friends is quite nice - looking , but with such dirty nails . It appears [you]1246-you do n't wash much till [you]1246-you are married , it is not considered bien vu , in fact rather lancé , and [you]1246-you ca n't have fine under - clothes , it has all got to be as unattractive as possible , and that shows [you]1246-you are as good as gold and will make [a nice wife]1247-a nice wife . [The Trouville Casino]47-the trouville casino But it must be a bother picking up a taste for having baths and things afterwards , if it is n't from instinct , do n't [you]1246-you think so , [Mamma]132-mamma ? And [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i am not French . It is even eccentric if [you]1246-you sleep with [your]1246-you window open ; [Héloise]190-héloise screamed at [me]0-i for that . [They]1245-the friends all assure [me]0-i it gives sore eyes , besides encouraging an early grave . [I]0-i said at last that in [England]25-england [we]1248-we slept the whole summer in the open air . [I]0-i was so exasperated , and [they]1245-the friends would believe anything . Oh , [I]0-i wish [we]1248-we were back on [the Sauterelle!—which]48-the sauterelle!—which reminds [me]0-i [I]0-i have never told [you]1246-you anything about [Trouville]44-trouville . [The whole place]1249-the whole place was full of [such beautiful ladies]1250-such beautiful ladies , and such nice clothes . [They]1245-the friends must all have been married , [their]1245-the friends things were so becoming . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte seemed to know [them]1245-the friends well , and [they]1245-the friends all spoke of [them]1245-the friends by [their]1245-the friends Christian names , such as , [Voilà Blanche]231-voilà blanche d'Antin ! or [Emilie]232-emilie something else , as [we]1248-we passed [them]1245-the friends , but [none of [our]1248-we party]1251-none of our party bowed to [the really pretty ones]1252-the really pretty ones , which [I]0-i thought very queer if [they]1245-the friends knew [them]1245-the friends well enough to speak of [them]1245-the friends by [their]1245-the friends Christian names . [I]0-i remember [you]1253-you always told [me]0-i never to do that — [I]0-i mean to use [people]411-people 's first names in speaking of [them]411-people if [you]1253-you are not acquainted with [them]411-people — but evidently it is different here . [The Tournelles]212-the tournelles and [all the others]1255-all the others did stop to speak to heaps of [duller looking people]1256-duller looking people , and [every one]428-every one tried to persuade [us]1248-we to stay and go to [the races]1258-the races . [We]1248-we had two boxes , and [they]1245-the friends kept talking to [me]0-i all the time , so [I]0-i really could not pay much attention to the acting . Down below [us]1248-we was [[the Marquise de Vermandoise]233-the marquise de vermandoise 's brother - in - law]1260-the marquise de vermandoise 's brother - in - law , with [a rather dowdy little woman]1261-a rather dowdy little woman .
