Then [we]1248-we played " [Petits Chevaux]234-petits chevaux , "[0-i] and [I]0-i won every time ; [I]0-i do like it very much . A Bathing Party [We]1248-we came back to [Vinant]24-vinant by [the two o'clock train]1266-the two o'clock train , but first [we]1248-we went to bathe . [I]0-i was really annoyed at having to have a hired dress , a frightful thing , and weighing a ton . [The Marquise]233-the marquise de vermandoise and [the others]487-the others had brought [theirs]1268-theirs on the chance of [our]1248-we having time for a dip . [The Baronne]197-the baronne 's and Héloise 's were too sweet . [The Baronne]197-the baronne 's cap had the same kind of lovely little curls round it that [she]197-the baronne wears at night ; but [she]197-the baronne is [a great coward]1269-a great coward , and hardly went in deeper than [her]197-the baronne ankles , in spite of all the entreaties of " [Antoine]207-antoine "[197-the baronne] and [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte . [The Marquise de Vermandoise]233-the marquise de vermandoise looks splendid in the water , just like [a goddess]1271-a goddess , and [her]233-the marquise de vermandoise bathing - dress was thin enough red silk for [us]1248-we to see how beautifully [she]233-the marquise de vermandoise is made . The splashing about seemed to make [her]233-the marquise de vermandoise so gay , [she]233-the marquise de vermandoise kept putting [her]233-the marquise de vermandoise tongue into the gap where [her]233-the marquise de vermandoise tooth is gone , and looked so wicked [they]1272-they would all have swam anywhere after [her]233-the marquise de vermandoise . [She]233-the marquise de vermandoise and [de Tournelle]222-madame de tournelle went out a long way to [a boat]1273-a boat , and [they]1272-they did seem to be having a good time . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could swim like that . [Héloise]190-héloise and " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] made la planche together ; it is simply floating , only [you]1274-you have some one to hold [you]1274-you up in case [you]1274-you float out too far . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte wanted to teach [me]0-i , and as [I]0-i was getting rather tired of pretending to swim with one leg down , [I]0-i tried , and it feels lovely , and [we]1275-we did laugh so over it . At last [the Baronne]1036-the baronne came out quite up to [her]1036-the baronne knees to call to [us]1275-we " Trémors , c'est défendu de faire des bêtises . "[1036-the baronne] [I]0-i suppose [she]1036-the baronne thought [he]214-the vicomte would let [me]0-i drown . [Jean]188-jean and [the Comtesse de Tournelle]195-tournelle watched [us]1275-we from [the plage]1277-the plage . [The old Baron]962-the old baron swims splendidly , and went quite out of sight . [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte was waiting among [the other servants with [[our]1275-we peignoirs]1280-our peignoirs]1279-the other servants with our peignoirs , and presently [he]204-hippolyte clapped [his]204-hippolyte hands to insure attention , and shouted , " Il ne faut pas que Madame la Baronne reste trop longtemps se mouillant les pieds , elle prendrait froid , mieux vaut sortir de l'eau ! "[204-hippolyte] End of the Trip [I]0-i am glad [my]0-i hair curls naturally , because [I]0-i laughed so at the face of [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte , gesticulating at [the Baronne]197-the baronne , that [I]0-i did not pay attention to a wave , and it threw [me]0-i over , and [I]0-i went right under water . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte pulled [me]0-i up , but there was no need of [him]214-the vicomte to have been so long about it , and [I]0-i told [him]214-the vicomte so . [He]214-the vicomte apologised , and said it was [his]214-the vicomte fear that [I]0-i should drown , but [we]1275-we were only up to [our]1275-we chests in water , so [I]0-i do n't believe it a bit . After that [we]1275-we came out , and it is just as well one has [a peignoir to put on immediately]1281-a peignoir to put on immediately , as the bathing gowns are so tight and thin , when wet they look quite odd . There were hundreds of [other people]1282-other people bathing too , and some of the dresses were so pretty . One was all black and very tight , with red dragons running over it , and [she]1283-she had a gold bangle on [her]1283-she ankle . [I]0-i wish [we]1275-we could have stayed longer , it was so gay . In [the train]393-the train coming back [we]1275-we played all sorts of games . [Jean]188-jean and [the old Baron]962-the old baron went " smoking , "[188-jean] and [we]1275-we eight squashed into [the same carriage]1286-the same carriage , so as not to be separated . [We]1275-we had to go right up to [Paris]19-paris ( as [the express]1287-the express does not stop at [Vinant]24-vinant ) , and then back again . [One]658-one can just see [the high roof of [Croixmare]22-croixmare]1289-the high roof of croixmare from [the train]393-the train . Yesterday [those tiresome girls]1291-those tiresome girls came to déjeûner , and to - day [we]1275-we go to pay another visit of ceremony at [the Tournelles ']212-the tournelles , to thank [them]1291-those tiresome girls for [our]1275-we nice trip . [I]0-i shall be glad to see [them]1291-those tiresome girls again after looking at [Godmamma]189-godmamma for two whole days . The evenings are awful . Although it is so warm [no one]744-no one thinks of walking in [the garden]870-the garden , or even sitting out on [the perron]1294-the perron . When [we]1275-we come out from dinner , though it is broad daylight , every shutter is shut and curtains drawn , and there [we]1275-we sit in [the salon]892-the salon , all arranged round in a semi - circle , and make conversation , and [sirop]1296-sirop comes at nine , and , thank goodness , [we]1275-we get off to bed at ten ! But even if [you]1297-you wanted to talk nicely to [the person sitting by]1298-the person sitting by [you]1297-you [you]1297-you could n't , because [every one]428-every one would at once stop what [they]428-every one were saying and listen . There is going to be an entertainment at [the Tournelles ']1300-the tournelles ' in about a week , a kind of fête champêtre . [We]1275-we are to dine in [a pavilion in [the garden]870-the garden]1301-a pavilion in the garden , and then have a cotillon.-Good - bye , dear [Mamma]132-mamma , with love from [[your]132-mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . Château de [Croixmare]22-croixmare , 25th August . [Croixmare]22-croixmare again [Dearest Mamma,—The]208-vernon longer [I]0-i stay , here the more glad [I]0-i am that [I]0-i am not French ! [Victorine]191-victorine is going to be shown to [her]191-victorine future fiancé to - day , but [I]0-i must first tell [you]132-mamma how it came about . [We]1275-we went to [Château de Tournelle]50-château de tournelle yesterday to pay [our]1275-we visit , [Godmamma]189-godmamma , [Victorine]191-victorine , and [I]0-i in [the victoria]1304-the victoria , and [Jean]188-jean and [Héloise]190-héloise in the phaeton . [They]1305-they were in [the garden]870-the garden playing tennis with [a party of friends from [Versailles]29-versailles]1307-a party of friends from versailles , and among [them]1305-they , of course , [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte and " [Antoine]207-antoine . "[214-the vicomte] [They]1305-they were all so glad to see [me]0-i , and [the Baronne]197-the baronne called [me]0-i [her]197-the baronne " chère petite , "[197-the baronne] and kissed [me]0-i on both cheeks , as if [we]1275-we had been parted for months . [The Vicomte]965-the vicomte — when [he]965-the vicomte had done putting [his]965-the vicomte heels together and bowing to [Victorine]191-victorine and [me]0-i , and kissing [Héloise]190-héloise 's and [Godmamma]189-godmamma 's hands — managed to get in , in a lower voice , that [his]965-the vicomte ride from [Versailles]29-versailles now seemed to [him]965-the vicomte to have been very short . Upon which [Victorine]191-victorine at once said , " Comment ? "[191-victorine] with the expression of [a terrier whose ears are suddenly cocked up on the alert]1309-a terrier whose ears are suddenly cocked up on the alert . [He]965-the vicomte bowed more deeply than ever , and said that [he]965-the vicomte was saying it was a long ride from [Versailles]29-versailles ! So [you]0-i see that [Frenchmen]235-frenchmen are not truthful , [Mamma]132-mamma ! Well — then [we]1275-we were sent to look at [the gardens]519-the gardens , accompanied by [Jean]188-jean and [the Curé]1311-the curé . [An Untruthful Frenchman The Comtesse]1312-an untruthful frenchman the comtesse " adores "[1312-an untruthful frenchman the comtesse] le tennis , and plays very well , it quite animates [her]1312-an untruthful frenchman the comtesse . [The Baronne]197-the baronne plays too , but [she]197-the baronne does n't hit the ball much , and screams most of the time ; [she]197-the baronne was in the middle of a game when [we]1275-we arrived , and only stopped to pay all kinds of civilities to [[our]1275-we party]1313-our party . [Her]197-the baronne pretty feet show when [she]197-the baronne runs about , but [she]197-the baronne wears a large black tulle hat with fluffy strings , and it does not seem very suitable for tennis . [I]0-i had to walk with [the old Curé]236-the old curé when [the path]643-the path was not wide enough to trot all together . [The gardens]519-the gardens really are lovely , with all kinds of strange shrubs and trees , and fontaines and bosquets , and nooks , but [I]0-i do n't see the least use in them if one has always to walk three in a row , if not more , do [you]1316-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [The Curé]236-the old curé was [a charming old fellow]1317-a charming old fellow , and explained all the plants to [me]0-i . [We]1275-we had no sooner got back to [the tennis ground]1318-the tennis ground than [one]658-one felt something momentous was taking place between [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [the Baronne]197-the baronne . [She]197-the baronne had finished [her]197-the baronne tennis , and [they]1320-they were sitting away from [the others]487-the others , nodding [their]1320-they heads together . [Victorine]191-victorine at once put on a conscious air , and minced more than usual . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] and [Héloise]190-héloise seemed speaking seriously , while [she]191-victorine examined [his]236-the old curé new racket . [The Vicomte]965-the vicomte had begun a game , so could not talk to [us]1275-we , but [some more officers]1323-some more officers were introduced , and , after the usual bowing , [we]1275-we began to talk . " Vous aimez le tennis , mademoiselle ? "[1323-some more officers] " Oui , [monsieur]3146-monsieur , "[191-victorine] from [Victorine]191-victorine . " Moi , je le déteste , "[0-i] from [me]0-i . "[1325-the officers] from [the officers]1325-the officers , & c. , & c. Very interesting , [you]1326-you see , [one]658-one 's conversations here ! A Marriage Arranged All this time [the Baronne]197-the baronne and [Godmamma]189-godmamma were nodding [their]1320-they heads , and when [Jean]188-jean and [Héloise]190-héloise joined [them]1320-they , [they]1320-they looked like those sets of mandarins that used to be on [Uncle Charles]237-uncle charles 's mantelpiece , and as [we]1275-we said Good - bye , [the Baronne]1036-the baronne said to [Godmamma]189-godmamma , " Bien , chère [madame]3135-madame , c'est entendu alors c'est pour demain . "[1036-the baronne] All the way [home]390-home in [the carriage]699-the carriage , [Victorine]191-victorine simpered . [I]0-i felt [I]0-i could have slapped [her]191-victorine . In the evening there was an air of mystery about [them]1320-they all , and , quite unlike [her]191-victorine usual custom , [Héloise]190-héloise came into [[my]0-i room]631-my room to chat when [I]0-i was going to bed . Of course [Agnès]115-agnès stayed as long as [she]191-victorine could , but no sooner had [we]1275-we got rid of [her]191-victorine , than [Héloise]190-héloise told [me]0-i what it was all about . It appears [the Baronne]197-the baronne has [a nephew]1332-a nephew , who has made a heap of debts ; [he]1332-a nephew is [a Marquis]416-a marquis , and [he]1332-a nephew wants to " redorer le blason . "[1332-a nephew] It is necessary for [him]1332-a nephew to secure a large dot , but [he]1332-a nephew is " si terriblement volage , "[197-the baronne] that the extreme plainness of [Victorine]191-victorine may put [him]1332-a nephew off . [The Baronne]197-the baronne has been arranging it , and [he]1332-a nephew is to be brought with [[his]1332-a nephew parent]1334-his parent to breakfast , to sample [her]191-victorine ! [They]1335-they have not seen [one another]807-one another yet , and it has been difficult to get [him]1332-a nephew to face the situation seriously . [Victorine]191-victorine has been dragging on so , that [the family]1337-the family will be delighted to let [her]191-victorine go , even to a less fortune than [she]191-victorine has . " Ils devraient être joliment contents , un gros paquet comme ça ! "[204-hippolyte] as [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte , who knows [every one]428-every one 's business , said to [[the Baronne]197-the baronne 's maid]1124-the baronne 's maid — [Héloise]190-héloise told [me]0-i — and that explains it ; [she]1124-the baronne 's maid said it would be such a mercy if [he]1332-a nephew will settle the affair at once . [She]1124-the baronne 's maid had come to ask [me]0-i a favour . [I]0-i did wonder what it was ! And [you]1340-you will laugh , [Mamma]132-mamma , when [you]1340-you hear ! [Victorine]191-victorine is sure to be nervous , [Héloise]190-héloise said , and in that case [her]191-victorine face gets red , and it would be a pity to distract [his]1332-a nephew attention in any way , and in short would [I]0-i mind putting on [my]0-i most unbecoming dress , and not speaking while [the Marquis]1341-the marquis is [here]391-here ? The Fiancé Appears So here [I]0-i am , [Mamma]132-mamma , writing to [you]132-mamma up in [[my]0-i room]631-my room , dressed in that horrid beige linen that [we]1344-we chose at night , and [I]0-i sha n't go down till déjeûner is ready , pouf ! [I]0-i can hear [a carriage]665-a carriage coming , [I]0-i must go to the window . Yes , it is the fiancé , accompanied by [[his]1332-a nephew mother]494-his mother and [aunt]1347-aunt . [He]1332-a nephew is nice - looking , except that [he]1332-a nephew has got a silly fair beard . [I]0-i can hear [them]1348-they arriving in [the hall]396-the hall ; such a lot of talking ! [Héloise]190-héloise and [Victorine]191-victorine have just been [here]391-here . [Héloise]190-héloise even has got an ugly dress on , and [Victorine]191-victorine has scrubbed [her]191-victorine face with soap — [I]0-i suppose to get that greasy look off — until it shines like an apple , [her]191-victorine nose is crimson , and [her]191-victorine eyes look like two beads . [They]1348-they have gone [downstairs]764-downstairs . More talking — [I]0-i am sure [he]1332-a nephew is putting [his]1332-a nephew heels together . [I]0-i 'll finish this after [they]1348-they have gone , so as to tell [you]1352-you what happens . Evening.—Such a day ! After [I]0-i had heard mumbling talking for quite a while — the windows were all open , and [the salon]892-the salon is under [me]0-i — suddenly the piano began . [Victorine]191-victorine plays really well generally — that is , [she]191-victorine has brilliant execution — but [you]1352-you should have heard the jumble ! hardly a note right , and in the middle of it up rushed [Héloise]190-héloise to [me]0-i and sank into a chair . It was going as badly as it possibly could , [she]191-victorine said . [Victorine]191-victorine was so nervous that [her]191-victorine voice was like a file , and [her]191-victorine face so crimson that [the Marquis]1341-the marquis must think [she]191-victorine has erysipelas ! And then , to complete matters , when [she]191-victorine is told by [Godmamma]189-godmamma to show [her]191-victorine accomplishments , to think that [she]191-victorine should play like this ! Especially as [the Marquis]1341-the marquis is very musical ! [Héloise]190-héloise said [she]191-victorine could see [he]1341-the marquis was quite " dégoûté , "[1341-the marquis] and the only thing for it now , was for [me]0-i to change [my]0-i frock instantly , and to put on a becoming one , and to go down and talk . Then [he]1341-the marquis would go away having enjoyed [his]1341-the marquis visit , [he]1341-the marquis wo n't reason why , and will come again ; and then when [I]0-i am gone , [he]1341-the marquis can be pushed into the marriage with [Victorine]191-victorine ! [She]191-victorine rang for [Agnès]115-agnès while [she]191-victorine spoke , and [I]0-i was simply pitched into the blue batiste , and hustled [downstairs]764-downstairs . Such a scene in [the salon]892-the salon ! [The Baronne]197-the baronne seated on the large sofa with [Jean]188-jean ; [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [the mother of [the young man]1359-the young man in two of the armchairs]1358-the mother of the young man in two of the armchairs ; while [Victorine]191-victorine fumbled with some music on the piano with [the dame de compagnie]884-the dame de compagnie , whom [Héloise]190-héloise calls " le Remorqueur , "[191-victorine] because [she]191-victorine looks like a teeny tug pulling along a coal barge ( [Victorine]191-victorine ) . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis was standing up by [himself]1341-the marquis — with [his]1341-the marquis hat and gloves in [his]1341-the marquis hand — first on one foot , then on the other ; and [Marie]149-aunt maria and [Yolande]193-yolande were making horrid , shuffling , squeaking noises , sliding on the parquet by the window . [Wandering Glances]238-wandering glances When [I]0-i was introduced and had made a reverence to [the old ladies]1362-the old ladies , [the Marquis]1341-the marquis was presented , and when [we]1364-we had done bowing , [he]1341-the marquis said : " Vous êtes anglaise , mademoiselle ? "[1341-the marquis] and , even for that , [Victorine]191-victorine 's eyes shot two yellow flames at [me]0-i ! [Héloise]190-héloise nipped [my]0-i arm to tell [me]0-i to talk , so of course everything went out of [my]0-i head , and [I]0-i could only think of " Oui , [monsieur]3146-monsieur . "[190-héloise] Just then breakfast was announced , and [we]1364-we all went in arm - in - arm , [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis together . It is a huge round table , and [I]0-i had done the flowers , because [they]1366-they wanted to be shown how [we]1364-we have tables in [England]25-england . [I]0-i was next but one to [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , with [Héloise]190-héloise between . [We]1364-we had scarcely sat down , when [he]1341-the marquis began . How beautiful the table looked , and what taste in the flowers ! Upon which [Héloise]190-héloise said , that they were lovely , and were the arrangement of [her]190-héloise " [chère petite belle - soeur]3149-chère petite belle - soeur ! "[190-héloise] and [she]190-héloise smiled angelically at [Victorine]191-victorine , who looked down with conscious pride . Then [Héloise]190-héloise said that it was a great joy in life to have the absorbing love of flowers as [Victorine]191-victorine had ! and [I]0-i could not help laughing , because [Victorine]191-victorine does n't know one from another , and would not even help [me]0-i this morning . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis looked and looked at [me]0-i when [I]0-i laughed , and then lifting [his]1341-the marquis glass of vin ordinaire , [he]1341-the marquis said : " Les belles dents rendent gai . "[1341-the marquis] Was n't it nice of [him]1341-the marquis ? [I]0-i think it is hard [he]1341-the marquis should be tied to [Victorine]191-victorine . [He]1341-the marquis talked to [me]0-i all the time after that , across [Héloise]190-héloise , and considering [she]191-victorine told [me]0-i to be agreeable to [him]1341-the marquis , [I]0-i do n't see why [she]191-victorine should have been annoyed . After breakfast — which [we]1369-we left as usual arm - in - arm — [we]1369-we sat in [the salon]892-the salon , while [the Marquis]1341-the marquis and [Jean]188-jean went back to smoke . It was appalling ! If [Victorine]191-victorine had been a four - legged cat , [she]191-victorine would have spit at [me]0-i , but fortunately the two - legged ones ca n't spit in [drawing - rooms]1372-drawing - rooms , so [I]0-i escaped . [The Baronne]1036-the baronne , after a good deal of manoeuvring , got by [me]0-i near the window , and then said in a distinct voice , " Ma petite chérie j'ai trop chaud , donnez - moi votre bras un instant ; "[1036-the baronne] and so [we]1369-we got outside on [the terrace]545-the terrace , where the huge orange trees in pots stand . A Lecture on Duty As soon as [we]1369-we were out of earshot , [she]1036-the baronne began to scold [me]0-i . Why had [I]0-i attracted [the Marquis]1341-the marquis ? how naughty of [me]0-i , when it was essential [his]1341-the marquis debts should be paid , etc . , etc . If [she]1036-the baronne had not been so nice , [I]0-i should have been furious , and [you]1376-you can see , [Mamma]132-mamma , how impossible to understand [them]1377-them it is ; to be told one moment to be nice , and then , when one Is , to be scolded ! [I]0-i just said as respectfully as [I]0-i could , that [I]0-i had done nothing , and that [Héloise]190-héloise had told [me]0-i to do it , and the reason why . That made [the Baronne]197-the baronne think a little . [I]0-i am sure [she]1036-the baronne wished for the advice of [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte ; but the end of it was , that [she]1036-the baronne asked [me]0-i how much dot [you]1376-you were going to allow [me]0-i ! [I]0-i said [I]0-i did not know , and that seemed to stump [her]1036-the baronne . At last [she]1036-the baronne said [she]1036-the baronne supposed , as [we]1378-we were [people of consideration]1379-people of consideration , and that [I]0-i was [the only child]1380-the only child , it would be something considerable . [I]0-i do believe , [Mamma]132-mamma , [she]1036-the baronne was thinking that [I]0-i might do for [the Marquis]1341-the marquis ! It was only a question of having [his]1341-the marquis debts paid — [any one who could do that would answer]1382-any one who could do that would answer . It did make [me]0-i cross , just as if [I]0-i would dream of marrying into a nation that eats badly , and does n't have a bath except to be smart . Think of always having to shout across the table , day after day , and never to be able to do anything except by rules and regulations ; and [the stuffy rooms]1383-the stuffy rooms and the eight armchairs ! [I]0-i saw [myself]0-i ! and probably ending up with a moustache , or an embonpoint , or something like that . [The Baronne]1036-the baronne at last patted [my]0-i hand , and said : Well , well , [she]1036-the baronne supposed [I]0-i had not meant anything , but that [I]0-i must leave [the Marquis]1341-the marquis alone , and turn [my]0-i attention to " [Gaston]200-gaston "[1036-the baronne] ( [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte ) , who was really in love with [me]0-i . Then if [I]0-i made [him]1341-the marquis sufficiently miserable , [he]1341-the marquis would be willing to fall in with another plan of [hers]1036-the baronne , when [I]0-i was gone , through sheer désoeuvrement . So [you]1387-you see , [Mamma]132-mamma , [they]1388-they look upon [me]0-i as [a regular catspaw]1389-a regular catspaw , and [I]0-i wo n't put up with it . [I]0-i shall just talk to [the Marquis]1341-the marquis or " [Gaston]200-gaston "[1341-the marquis] whenever [I]0-i like , [I]0-i was quite polite to [the Baronne]197-the baronne , because [she]197-the baronne is such [a dear]1391-a dear ; but [I]0-i am afraid , if [Godmamma]189-godmamma had said it all , [I]0-i should have been impudent . An Alternative Plan By this time [the others]487-the others had joined [us]1393-us on [the terrace]545-the terrace . [They]487-the others had all been up to fix [their]487-the others hats on , because even if [you]1395-you have been out , and are running out again just after , [you]1395-you always have to take [your]1395-you hat off , and make a toilette for déjeûner ; it does seem waste of time . [The Baronne]197-the baronne is considered quite eccentric because [she]197-the baronne keeps hers on sometimes . [I]0-i had not even a parasol . [Godmamma]189-godmamma looked as if [she]189-godmamma thought it almost indecent . [Presently Jean]188-jean and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis came out of [the smoking - room]1397-the smoking - room and joined [us]1393-us . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis at once began to pay compliments about the sun on [my]0-i hair , and was really so clever in getting in little things , while [he]1341-the marquis was talking to [Godmamma]189-godmamma , that [I]0-i quite took to [him]1341-the marquis . [Victorine]191-victorine had to converse with [her]191-victorine future belle - mère all the time , and finally [the carriage]699-the carriage came round , and [they]1400-they went . [They]1400-they were no sooner out of sight , than [Godmamma]189-godmamma said , with a long rigmarole , that [she]189-godmamma felt it [her]189-godmamma duty to [you]1401-you to look after [me]0-i , and [she]189-godmamma must tell [me]0-i that it was inconvenant for [a young girl]1402-a young girl to smile or speak to [a man]496-a man as much as [I]0-i had done to [the Marquis]1341-the marquis . [I]0-i was so furious at that , that [I]0-i said , as [I]0-i found it impossible to understand [their]1400-they ways , [I]0-i would ask [Agnès]115-agnès to pack [my]0-i things at once , if [she]115-agnès would kindly spare [a servant]958-a servant to go with a telegram to [you]1401-you , to say [I]0-i was coming [home]390-home immediately . [She]115-agnès was petrified at [my]0-i answering [her]115-agnès ! It appears [no one else]1407-no one else ever dares to ; and [she]115-agnès at once tried to smooth [me]0-i down , especially when [I]0-i said [I]0-i should just like time to write and tell [the Baronne]1036-the baronne why [I]0-i was leaving , as [she]115-agnès had been so kind to [me]0-i . After that [they]1409-they all tried to cajole [me]0-i , except [Victorine]191-victorine , who left [the room]401-the room and slammed the door . And so [I]0-i have consented to stay , and here [I]0-i am finishing [my]0-i letter to you.—With best love , from [[your]1411-your affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Champs Elysées]51-champs elysées , Friday , 26th August . A Visit to [the Dentist Dearest]1413-the dentist dearest [Mamma,—You]239-mamma,—you will be surprised to see this address , but [Héloise]190-héloise and [I]0-i are only staying [here]391-here for the night , and go back to [Croixmare]22-croixmare to - morrow . Early this morning [she]516-your affectionate daughter had bad toothache , and said [she]516-your affectionate daughter must go to [Paris]19-paris to see [[her]516-your affectionate daughter dentist]1415-her dentist [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [Jean]188-jean made as much fuss about it as if [the poor thing]1218-the poor thing had suggested something quite unheard of ; and [one]658-one could see how [she]516-your affectionate daughter was suffering , by the way [she]516-your affectionate daughter kept [her]516-your affectionate daughter handkerchief up to [her]516-your affectionate daughter face . [Godmamma]189-godmamma said [she]189-godmamma could not possibly accompany [her]516-your affectionate daughter , as [she]189-godmamma had to pay some important calls ; and [Jean]188-jean had promised to be at [St. Germain]52-st. germain to see some horses with the Vicomte , so [Héloise]190-héloise suggested [I]0-i should go with [her]516-your affectionate daughter ; and that [we]1418-we should stay the night at [the appartement in [the Champs Elysées]934-the champs elysées]1419-the appartement in the champs elysées , so that [she]516-your affectionate daughter could have two appointments with [M. Adam]240-m. adam , [the dentist]1421-the dentist . [She]516-your affectionate daughter has such beautiful teeth , it seems hard that they should ache , and [I]0-i felt very sorry for [her]516-your affectionate daughter . After a lot of talking it was arranged that [we]1418-we should go up by [the 11 o'clock train]1422-the 11 o'clock train , and accordingly [we]1418-we started with as much fuss as if [we]1418-we had been departing for a month . [We]1418-we had no sooner got to [Paris]19-paris than [Héloise]190-héloise felt better . [She]516-your affectionate daughter left [me]0-i to go on with [the maids]1423-the maids and luggage to [the Champs Elysées]934-the champs elysées , while [she]516-your affectionate daughter went to see [M. Adam]240-m. adam . [Paris]19-paris looked out - of - seasonish and full of [Americans]241-americans as [we]1418-we drove through . [I]0-i am sitting in [the little salon]1425-the little salon now , waiting for [her]516-your affectionate daughter to come in , and [I]0-i have got awfully tired just looking out of the window . Everything is covered up with brown holland , but [I]0-i dare say it is nice when [they]241-americans are [here]391-here . The tapestries are beautiful , so is the furniture , judging by the piece [I]0-i have lifted the coverings from . If [she]516-your affectionate daughter does not come in soon [I]0-i shall go for a walk with [Agnès]115-agnès . [Paris]19-paris in August 9 p.m.—Héloise came in just as [I]0-i was writing this morning , and [we]1418-we had a scrappy kind of déjeûner on the corner of the dining - room table . Then [she]516-your affectionate daughter said [we]1418-we had better go to [her]516-your affectionate daughter couturier in the [Rue de la Paix]53-rue de la paix . [She]516-your affectionate daughter seemed all right now , and said [M. Adam]240-m. adam had not hurt [her]516-your affectionate daughter much , and that [she]516-your affectionate daughter was to go to [him]240-m. adam again to - morrow morning . [I]0-i always like [Paris]19-paris even out of the season , do n't [you]516-your affectionate daughter , [Mamma]132-mamma ? it is so gay . [We]1418-we had a little victoria and rushed along , not minding who [we]1418-we ran into , as is always the way with [French cabs]1427-french cabs . When [we]1418-we got to [Paquin 's]54-paquin 's there were [nobody]1428-nobody but [Americans]241-americans [there]398-there , and [every one]428-every one looked tired . [Héloise]190-héloise tried on [her]516-your affectionate daughter things , and [we]1418-we went to [Caroline 's]134-carry for some hats . They were too lovely , and [Héloise]190-héloise gave [me]0-i a dream ; it 's an owl lighting on a cornfield , which perhaps is a little incongruous as they only come out at night , but the effect is good . After that [she]516-your affectionate daughter said [she]516-your affectionate daughter felt [she]516-your affectionate daughter should like to go and see [[her]516-your affectionate daughter confesseur]1431-her confesseur at [the Madeleine]56-the madeleine , and [we]1418-we started [there]398-there on the chance of finding [him]1431-her confesseur . [She]516-your affectionate daughter kept looking at [her]516-your affectionate daughter watch , so [I]0-i suppose [she]516-your affectionate daughter was afraid [he]1431-her confesseur would be gone . [We]1418-we stopped at the bottom of the big steps , and [she]516-your affectionate daughter said if [I]0-i would not mind waiting a minute [she]516-your affectionate daughter would go in and see . [I]0-i always thought [one]658-one only confessed in the morning , but [she]516-your affectionate daughter seemed so anxious about it that perhaps if [you]1434-you have anything particular on [your]1434-you mind [you]1434-you can get it off in the afternoon ; it might have been the stories [she]516-your affectionate daughter told about [Victorine]191-victorine 's liking flowers . [I]0-i thought [she]516-your affectionate daughter would never come back , [she]516-your affectionate daughter was such a time , quite three - quarters of an hour ; and it was horrid sitting there alone , with every creature staring as [they]1435-they passed . Directly after [she]516-your affectionate daughter went in [I]0-i caught a glimpse of " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1436-he] in a coupé , going at a great pace , but [I]0-i could not make [him]1436-he see [me]0-i before [he]1436-he had turned down [the street that goes to the back of [the Madeleine]56-the madeleine]1437-the street that goes to the back of the madeleine . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i should have even been glad to see [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond . At last [I]0-i got so cross , what with [the people]1439-the people staring , and the heat and the smells , that [I]0-i jumped out and went to look for [Héloise]190-héloise in [the church]1005-the church . [She]190-héloise was nowhere to be seen , and [I]0-i did not like to peer into every box [I]0-i came to , so at last [I]0-i was going back to [the cab]1441-the cab again , when from the end door that leads out into [the other street]1442-the other street at the back , [the rue Tronchet]1443-the rue tronchet , [she]190-héloise came tearing along completely essoufflée . So [I]0-i suppose there must be some confessing place beyond . [She]190-héloise seemed quite cross with [me]0-i for having come to find [her]190-héloise , and said it was not at all proper to walk about [a church]1444-a church alone , which does seem odd , does n't it , [Mamma]132-mamma ? As one would have thought if there was any place really respectable to stroll in , it would have been [a church]1444-a church . [Church Etiquette]1446-church etiquette [I]0-i told [her]190-héloise how bored [I]0-i was , and about " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] passing , and how [I]0-i had tried to make [him]1447-him see . [She]190-héloise was awfully shocked at the idea of [my]0-i wanting to speak to [him]1447-him in [the street]1448-the street anyway , and said [I]0-i surely must know it was the custom here for [the men]450-the men to bow first . [She]190-héloise was altogether so cross and excited and different that [I]0-i felt sure [[her]190-héloise confesseur]1431-her confesseur must have given [her]190-héloise some disagreeable penance . [We]1451-we went for a drive in [the Bois]1452-the bois after that , and [Héloise]190-héloise recovered , and was nice to [me]0-i . Is n't this [a queer country]1457-a queer country , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [Morals]242-morals and [Manners]1458-manners [We]1451-we drove until quite late , and just as [we]1451-we were arriving at the door , who should pass but [the Marquis]1341-the marquis ? [He]1341-the marquis stopped at once and helped [us]1451-we out . [He]1341-the marquis is quite amusing ; [he]1341-the marquis looked at [me]0-i all the time [he]1341-the marquis was talking to [Héloise]190-héloise . [She]190-héloise said [no Frenchman]1464-no frenchman would dream of such a thing — [us]1451-we two alone — it was unheard of ! and [she]190-héloise only hoped [no one]744-no one had seen [us]1451-we talking to [him]1341-the marquis in [the street]1448-the street as it was ! [I]0-i said [I]0-i liked the English way best , as in that case [we]1451-we should be going out and enjoying [ourselves]1451-we , instead of eating a snatchy meal alone . [Château de Croixmare]243-château de croixmare , Monday , 29th August . [The Sights of [the Foire Dearest Mamma,—Oh]244-the foire dearest mamma,—oh]1470-the sights of the foire dearest mamma,—oh , [we]1451-we had such fun yesterday ! After Mass [the Baronne]1036-the baronne sent over to ask if [Jean]188-jean , [Héloise]190-héloise , and [I]0-i would go with [them]1468-french people to [the Foire]1472-the foire at [Lavonnière]58-lavonnière , [a village about ten miles off]1473-a village about ten miles off . [It]1472-the foire is [a very celebrated Foire]1474-a very celebrated foire , and in the last century [every one]428-every one went from [Versailles]29-versailles , and even now [lots of people who spend the summer there]1476-lots of people who spend the summer there attend . [You]1477-you go in the evening after dinner , and there are no horrid cows and things with horns rushing about , or [tipsy people]1478-tipsy people . [Godmamma]189-godmamma looked awfully severe when [she]189-godmamma heard of the invitation ; but since the row , when [they]1468-french people had to cajole [me]0-i , [she]189-godmamma has been more civil , so [she]189-godmamma said [I]0-i might go if [Héloise]190-héloise would really look after [me]0-i , although if [I]0-i was [Victorine]191-victorine [she]189-godmamma would not have permitted it for a moment . On [a Motor Car]1479-a motor car [We]1480-we left here about six , and then picked up the party at [Tournelle]195-tournelle . [They]1468-french people all went — [the old Baron]962-the old baron , and every one , except [[the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's mother]1483-the marquis 's mother . [We]1480-we dropped the brougham there , and went on with [them]1468-french people in [a huge motor car]1484-a huge motor car ( that is another fad of [the Baron]1485-the baron 's ) . It is lovely motor - carring ; [you]1486-you get quite used to the noise and smell , and [you]1486-you fly along so , it takes [your]1486-you breath away ; even with [your]1486-you hat tied on with a big veil , [you]1486-you have rather the feeling [you]1486-you have got to screw up [your]1486-you eyebrows to keep it from blowing away . [We]1480-we seemed to be no time doing the ten miles . [The Baronne]197-the baronne and [Héloise]190-héloise hate it , and never go in it except under protest . [The Foire]59-the foire is just [one very long street]1487-one very long street , with booths and merry - go - rounds , and [Montagnes Russes]60-montagnes russes , and all sorts of amusing things down each side . There are rows of poplar trees behind them , and evidently on ordinary occasions it is just [the usual French road]1488-the usual french road , but with all the lights and [people]411-people [it]59-the foire was gay . [We]1480-we stopped at [[the village]640-the village inn]1491-the village inn , [the " Toison d'Or]3150-the " toison d'or "[245-the duc de cressy] which is famous for [[its]1491-the village inn restaurant and [its]1491-the village inn landlady]1492-its restaurant and its landlady . In the season [[the Duc de Cressy]245-the duc de cressy 's coach]1493-the duc de cressy 's coach comes here from [Paris]19-paris every Thursday . [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte was there already ; [he]204-hippolyte had been sent on to secure a table for [us]1480-we . [We]1480-we had no sooner sat down under the awning than [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte and " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1494-two other officers] and [two other officers]1494-two other officers turned up . [They]1495-they had ridden from [Versailles]29-versailles , which is near . [Such extraordinary people]1496-such extraordinary people sat at some of the tables ! [Families of almost peasants]1497-families of almost peasants at one , and then at the next perhaps [two or three lovely ladies , with very smart dresses and big hats , and lots of pearls]1498-two or three lovely ladies , with very smart dresses and big hats , and lots of pearls , and [some young men in evening dress]1499-some young men in evening dress . And then [some respectable bourgeois]1500-some respectable bourgeois , and so on . [I]0-i could hardly pay attention to what [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , who sat next [me]0-i , was saying , the sight was so new and entertaining . The tables had cloths without any starch in them , and the longest bread rolls [I]0-i have ever seen . One of [the beautiful ladies with the pearls]1502-the beautiful ladies with the pearls used [hers]1503-hers to beat [the man next to [her]1503-hers]1504-the man next to her before [they]1495-they had finished dinner . [We]1480-we did not have fresh forks and knives for everything , but the famous dish of [the place]984-the place made up for it . It is composed of poussins — that is , very baby chickens — raw oysters , and cream and truffles . [You]1506-you get a hot bit of chicken into [your]1506-you mouth and think it is all right , and then [your]1506-you tongue comes against an iced oyster , and the mixture is so exciting [you]1506-you are stimulated all the time ; and [you]1506-you drink a very fine old Burgundy with it , which is also a feature of [the place]984-the place . [I]0-i am sure it ought to poison [us]1480-we , as oysters are n't in for another month , but it is awfully good . Chevaux au [Galop]61-galop One of [the strange officers]1508-the strange officers is so amusing ; [he]1509-he looks exactly like [the young man [the Marquise de Vermandoise]233-the marquise de vermandoise]1510-the young man the marquise de vermandoise was walking in [the Bois with]1511-the bois with , but it could not be [he]1509-he , as [she]233-the marquise de vermandoise seemed so surprised to see [him]1509-he at [the Foire]59-the foire , and said [they]1512-they had not met for ages . [The Comte]909-the comte sat on [my]0-i other side ; [he]909-the comte said [I]0-i would be greatly amused at the booths presently , and was [I]0-i afraid of [Montagnes Russes]60-montagnes russes ? That is only an ordinary switchback , [Mamma]132-mamma , so of course [I]0-i am not afraid . There were [Tziganes]1514-tziganes playing while [we]1515-we dined , and it was all more amusing than anything [I]0-i have done here yet . When [we]1515-we had drunk [our]1515-we coffee [we]1515-we started down [the Foire]1472-the foire . There were hundreds of [people of every class]1517-people of every class , but not one drunk or rude or horrid . The first entertainment was [the Chevaux au Galop]1518-the chevaux au galop , a delightful merry - go - round with the most fiery prancing horses , three abreast , and all jumping at different moments . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis helped [me]0-i up , and [Jean]188-jean got on the other side ; [we]1515-we all rode except [the Comtesse]1038-the comtesse and [the old Baron]962-the old baron . It was too lovely ; [you]1522-you are bounced up and down , and [you]1522-you have to hold on so tight , and every one screams , and [the band]1178-the band plays ; and [I]0-i wish [you]1522-you could do it , [Mamma]132-mamma . [I]0-i am sure the thorough shaking would frighten [your]1522-you neuralgia away . [I]0-i could have gone on for an hour , but there was such a lot to see , [we]1515-we could not spare the time for more than one turn . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis whispered when [he]1341-the marquis helped [me]0-i off that [his]1341-the marquis walk down [the Champs Elysées]934-the champs elysées had indeed been fortunate , as [he]1341-the marquis had seen [me]0-i , and that it was [he]1341-the marquis who had suggested to [the Baronne]197-the baronne to come to [the Foire]59-the foire . So of course [I]0-i felt grateful to [him]1341-the marquis . [We]1515-we walked all together more or less , but [Jean]188-jean kept glued to [my]0-i side , which was rather a bore , only [the Marquis]1341-the marquis or [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte were always at the other side . The Ennui of the Lions The next place [we]1515-we came to was a huge menagerie of clever animals , with [their]1528-their Dompteurs — cages of lions , bears , tigers , & c. There were sets of seats before the cages where anything interesting was going on , and [the audience]1529-the audience moved up as [each new Dompteur]1530-each new dompteur came in to the animals . [We]1515-we sat down at first in front of the tigers ' cage , the [Baronne]197-the baronne next to [me]0-i this time . The creatures went through astonishing tricks , and looked such lazy great beautiful cats . [The Dompteur]246-the dompteur was [a handsome man]1531-a handsome man , just the type [they]1532-they always are , with a wide receding forehead and flashing eyes . [They]1532-they positively blazed at [the brutes]1533-the brutes if [they]1533-the brutes did not obey [him]1341-the marquis instantly . [I]0-i wonder why all " tamers "[965-the vicomte] have this shape of head ? [I]0-i asked [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte , but [he]965-the vicomte did not know . The bears came next , horrid cunning white things , and turning in [their]1532-they toes like that does give [them]1532-they such a frumpish look . The attraction of the show was to see [the great Dompteur]1535-the great dompteur , [Pezon]247-pezon . [He]247-pezon had been almost eaten by [his]247-pezon lions a few months ago , and was to make [his]247-pezon reappearance accompanied by [a beautiful songstress who would charm the beasts to sleep]1536-a beautiful songstress who would charm the beasts to sleep . [Pezon]247-pezon was just like [the other Dompteurs]1537-the other dompteurs , only older and fatter , and [the beautiful lady]1538-the beautiful lady was such a pet ! Enormously stout , in pink satin , with quite bare neck and arms ; [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte said that the lions had to be surfeited with food beforehand , to keep [them]1533-the brutes from taking [their]1533-the brutes dessert off this tempting morsel . [She]1538-the beautiful lady began to sing through [her]1538-the beautiful lady nose about " l'amour , "[1538-the beautiful lady] & c. , and those lions did look so bored ; [the eldest one]1540-the eldest one simply groaned with ennui . [His]1540-the eldest one face said as plainly as if [he]1540-the eldest one could speak , " At it again to - night ! "[1540-the eldest one] and " Oh ! que cela m'embête . "[1540-the eldest one] When the song was finished , [the Belle Chanteuse]1541-the belle chanteuse stretched [herself]1541-the belle chanteuse on two chairs , making [herself]1541-the belle chanteuse into a sort of bridge for the animals to jump over . From [our]1542-we position [we]1542-we could only see mountains of pink satin embonpoint , and the soles of [her]1541-the belle chanteuse feet . The lions had the greatest difficulty in jumping not to kick [her]1541-the belle chanteuse . What a life , [Mamma]132-mamma ! Then [Pezon]247-pezon put [his]247-pezon head right into the old lion 's mouth , and so ended the performance . Inspecting [the Machinery]248-the machinery When [we]1542-we got outside , [a man]496-a man was ringing a bell opposite , to invite [every one]428-every one in to see [a woman with only a head]1545-a woman with only a head ; [she]1545-a woman with only a head could speak , [he]496-a man said , but had no body . [The Baronne]197-the baronne insisted upon going in . It was [a tiny cell of a place]1546-a tiny cell of a place and crammed full . Presently a head appeared on a pedestal and spoke in a subdued voice . [All the others]1255-all the others said it was a fraud , but [I]0-i thought it wonderful . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1548-a villainous - looking old hag , who was exhibiting the creature] wanted to go beyond the barrier and touch it , which was mean of [him]496-a man , [I]0-i think . Presently [a villainous - looking old hag , who was exhibiting [the creature]1549-the creature]1548-a villainous - looking old hag , who was exhibiting the creature , came over , and whispered in " [Antoine]207-antoine 's "[1548-a villainous - looking old hag , who was exhibiting the creature] ear . [I]0-i only caught " cinq francs , "[0-i] but [his]496-a man face looked interested at once , and [he]496-a man and [Jean]188-jean disappeared behind the curtain and the head disappeared too , so [we]1542-we went outside , and bought " farings "[1255-all the others] at the next booth . There [they]1255-all the others joined [us]1542-we . " [Alors]249-alors , [mes]249-alors amis ? "[1255-all the others] demanded [every one]428-every one . " Pas la peine , très mal faite , "[1255-all the others] said " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1255-all the others] ; so [I]0-i suppose it was the machinery [they]1255-all the others had been examining . The next thing [we]1542-we came to was a sort of swing with [flying boats]1551-flying boats , but [no one]744-no one was brave enough to try it except [the Marquise]1013-the marquise and [me]0-i , though all [the men]450-the men wanted to come with [us]1542-we . [You]1555-you sit opposite [one another]807-one another , and [they]1557-they are much higher than the ones in [England]25-england . [Jean]188-jean would come with [me]0-i , though [I]0-i wanted the Vicomte — so [I]0-i was glad it made [him]1558-he look quite green . It chanced that " [Antoine]207-antoine "[188-jean] was beside [me]0-i as [we]1542-we walked to [the pistol booth]1559-the pistol booth , so [I]0-i asked [him]1558-he if [he]1558-he had been in [Paris]19-paris on Friday , and [he]1558-he looked so hard at [me]0-i , [you]1555-you would have thought [I]0-i was asking a State secret ; but [he]1558-he said that alas ! no , [he]1558-he had been detained at [Versailles]29-versailles . So it could not have been [him]1558-he after all ; there must be a lot of [French people]1468-french people exactly alike , [I]0-i never keep making these mistakes in [England]25-england . Have [you]1555-you ever fired off a pistol , [Mamma]132-mamma ? it is simply horrid . [The pistol booth]1559-the pistol booth was next after the " [farings "[195-tournelle] shop]3151-farings " shop , and the prizes were china monsters and lanterns , & c. [The Comtesse]195-tournelle is a splendid shot , and hit the flying ball almost each time ; [she]195-tournelle is such a quiet little thing , one would not expect it of [her]195-tournelle . [The Baronne]197-the baronne made a lot of fuss , and said [she]197-the baronne knew it would kill [her]197-the baronne , until [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte , who was behind the party with [her]197-the baronne cloak , said : " [Madame la Baronne]197-the baronne doit essayer c'est nécessaire que toutes les belles jeunes dames sachent comment se défendre . "[204-hippolyte] And [she]197-the baronne fired off the pistol at last with [her]197-the baronne eyes shut , and it was a mercy it did not kill [the attendant]1562-the attendant , the ball lodged in the wall just beside [him]1562-the attendant , so [we]1563-we thought [we]1563-we had better leave after that ! [The Montagnes Russes]60-montagnes russes Next came [the Montagnes Russes]60-montagnes russes . How [I]0-i love a switchback , [Mamma]132-mamma ! If [I]0-i were [the Queen]1564-the queen [I]0-i would have a private one for [myself]0-i , and [[my]0-i particular friends]1565-my particular friends , round [Windsor Castle]62-windsor castle ; [I]0-i could go on all day . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis and [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte kept so close to [me]0-i that [Jean]188-jean could not take the seat beside [me]0-i , as [I]0-i saw [he]1341-the marquis intended to , and then [the other two]1567-the other two made quite a shuffle , but [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte won . [The person who sits next [you]1570-your]1569-the person who sits next you is obliged to hold [your]1570-your arm to prevent [your]1570-your tumbling out . [I]0-i looked round to see , and [every one]428-every one was having [her]428-every one arm held , but [I]0-i do n't believe [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte need have gripped [mine]0-i quite so tight as [he]1341-the marquis did . [We]1573-we had three turns ; next time [the Marquis]1341-the marquis was beside [me]0-i , and [he]1341-the marquis was more violent than [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte . So when it came to the last , and [Jean]188-jean scrambled in , and began to hold tighter than either of [the others]487-the others , [I]0-i just said [my]0-i arm would be black and blue , and [I]0-i would rather chance the danger of falling out , in a seat by [myself]0-i , than put up with it . That made [him]1341-the marquis sit up quite straight . [I]0-i ca n't see why [people]411-people want to pinch one ; can [you]1578-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i call it vulgar , and [I]0-i am sure [no Englishman]1030-no englishman would do it . It seems that [Frenchmen]1580-frenchmen are awfully respectful , and full of ceremony and politeness , and then every now and then — directly [they]1580-frenchmen get the opportunity — [they]1580-frenchmen do these horrid little tricks . The next entertainment was really very curious . It was [a marble woman]1581-a marble woman down to [her]1581-a marble woman waist , and as [you]1578-you looked , the marble turned into flesh , [her]1581-a marble woman eyes opened , and [she]1581-a marble woman spoke ; then [her]1581-a marble woman colour faded , and [she]1581-a marble woman turned into marble again , and was handed round [the audience]1529-the audience ; was n't it wonderful , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i ca n't think how it was done , and as " [Antoine]207-antoine "[188-jean] and [Jean]188-jean did not go behind the curtain to examine the machinery , [I]0-i suppose [we]1583-we shall never know . The Fun of the Fair After that there were endless shows — performing dogs , fortune - telling , circuses , etc.—but the nicest of all was another merry - go - round , with seats which went up and down like [a boat]1273-a boat in [a very rough sea]1585-a very rough sea . [Hardly one of [them]1587-them]1586-hardly one of them would venture , but [I]0-i made [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte come with [me]0-i for two turns ; [he]214-the vicomte looked so pale at the end of it , and when [I]0-i wanted to go a third time , [he]214-the vicomte said [we]1583-we must be getting on , and [no one else]1407-no one else offered to come . Was n't it stupid of [them]1587-them , as it was by far the most exciting part of [the Foire]59-the foire ? It was half - past twelve before [we]1583-we got back to the " Toison d'Or , "[214-the vicomte] and there had supper , with " Punch à l'Américaine . "[1591-the ladies with the pearls] It is good , and [you]1589-you do feel so gay after it . [One of [the ladies with the pearls]1591-the ladies with the pearls , who was also supping , was so friendly to [the man next [her]1590-one of the ladies with the pearls , who was also supping , was so friendly to the man next her]1592-the man next her]1590-one of the ladies with the pearls , who was also supping , was so friendly to the man next her ; [Pezon]247-pezon was of [[their]1587-them party]1593-their party , and [he]247-pezon did look common in clothes , while [he]247-pezon was quite handsome in spangled tights . [We]1583-we were obliged to go slowly in [the motor car]1594-the motor car returning , there were such heaps of [people]411-people and carts and things on [the road]1596-the road , but [we]1583-we got back to [Croixmare]22-croixmare about two ; and [I]0-i have slept so late this morning , so now , good - bye , [dear Mamma.—Your affectionate daughter]461-dear mamma.—your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Château de Croixmare]243-château de croixmare , Wednesday , August 31st . Back at [Croixmare]22-croixmare Dearest Mamma,—To - day is the dinner and cotillon at [the de Tournelles ']212-the tournelles . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis and [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte and [" Antoine]207-antoine "[428-every one] and [every one]428-every one will be [there]398-there , and [I]0-i am sure it will be fun . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte ca n't get leave for the night , so [the Baronne]197-the baronne — who was [here]391-here yesterday on [her]197-the baronne bicycle — told [us]1583-we . [He]214-the vicomte will have to ride back to [Versailles]29-versailles , as there are [no trains]1603-no trains at that time , to be [there]398-there for some duty at six in the morning . [I]0-i ca n't tell [you]1605-you how many miles it is ; [he]214-the vicomte will be tired , [poor thing]1606-poor thing . These last two days have been just alike , that is why [I]0-i have not written — the same tiresome ceremony about everything , and the same ghastly evenings . [We]1583-we went for a drive on Monday , and [Godmamma]189-godmamma did nothing but question [me]0-i as to what [we]1583-we had done every minute of the time while [we]1583-we were in [Paris]19-paris . This is the first chance [she]189-godmamma has had with [me]0-i alone . So [I]0-i would not tell [her]189-godmamma a scrap , even a simple thing like [Héloise]190-héloise going to [the Madeleine]56-the madeleine . [She]189-godmamma thinks [I]0-i am fearfully stupid , [I]0-i can see . [I]0-i forgot to tell [you]1605-you about the morning [we]1583-we left [Paris]19-paris ; [Héloise]190-héloise went to see [Adam]240-m. adam again , and [I]0-i went shopping with [Agnès]115-agnès , but [I]0-i would not even tell [Godmamma]189-godmamma that ! [Victorine]191-victorine says spiteful things to [me]0-i whenever [she]191-victorine can , but [Jean]188-jean and [Héloise]190-héloise are so charming that [I]0-i do n't mind the rest . [We]1583-we are to wear sort of garden - party dresses and hats at the entertainment to - night . Dinner is to be at eight , in [a large pavilion]1607-a large pavilion , where [they]1608-they have had a beautiful parquet floor laid down , and then when the tables are cleared away , [we]1583-we shall begin the cotillon . As [I]0-i have never danced in one before , [I]0-i hope [I]0-i sha'n't make an idiot of [myself]0-i . Etiquette of [the Bathroom]1609-the bathroom This morning [I]0-i very nearly had another row with [Godmamma]189-godmamma — [you]1610-you will never guess what for , [Mamma]564-mamma ! [She]189-godmamma knocked at the door of [[my]0-i room]631-my room before [I]0-i was quite dressed , and then came in with a face as glum as [a church]1444-a church . [She]189-godmamma began at once . [She]189-godmamma said that [she]189-godmamma had heard something about [me]0-i that [she]189-godmamma hoped was a mistake , so [she]189-godmamma thought it better to ask [me]0-i [herself]189-godmamma . [She]189-godmamma understood that [I]0-i went down to [the Salle de Bain]64-the salle de bain every day , instead of just washing in [[my]0-i room]631-my room . ( [I]0-i have done so ever since [Agnès]115-agnès discovered there really was water enough for a decent bath [there]398-there , and that [no one else]1407-no one else seemed to use it . ) [I]0-i began to wonder if [she]189-godmamma was going to accuse [me]0-i of tampering with the taps — but not a bit of it ! After a rigmarole , as if [she]189-godmamma thought it almost too shocking to mention , [she]189-godmamma said [she]189-godmamma understood from [[her]189-godmamma maid]477-her maid , who had heard it from [the valet de chambre who clears out the bath after [I]0-i leave]1618-the valet de chambre who clears out the bath after i leave , that there never were any wet chemises , and that [she]189-godmamma was therefore forced to conclude that [I]0-i got into [my]0-i tub " toute nue ! "[189-godmamma] [I]0-i had been so worked up for something dreadful , that [I]0-i am sorry to say , [Mamma]132-mamma , [I]0-i went into a shriek of laughter . That seemed to annoy [Godmamma]189-godmamma very much ; [she]189-godmamma got as red as a turkey - cock , and said [she]189-godmamma saw nothing to cause mirth — in fact , [she]189-godmamma had hoped [I]0-i should have been ashamed at such deplorable immodesty , if , as [she]189-godmamma feared from [my]0-i attitude , [her]189-godmamma accusation was correct . [I]0-i said , when [I]0-i could stop laughing , of course it was correct , how in [the world]476-the world else should [one]658-one get into a bath ? The Marquis Again [Her]189-godmamma eyes almost turned up into [her]189-godmamma head with horror ; [she]189-godmamma could only gasp , " Mais si quelqu'un ouvrait la porte ? "[189-godmamma] " Mais je la ferme toujours à clef , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and then [I]0-i asked [her]189-godmamma if in [France]10-france [they]1621-they also dried [themselves]1621-they in [their]1621-they wet chemises ? But [she]189-godmamma said that that was a childish question , as [I]0-i must know it would be an impossibility ; and when [I]0-i said [I]0-i could not see any difference in washing or drying , [she]189-godmamma was so stumped [she]189-godmamma was obliged to sit down and fan [herself]189-godmamma . [I]0-i smoothed [her]189-godmamma down by assuring [her]189-godmamma it was the English custom , and that [I]0-i was sorry [I]0-i shocked [her]189-godmamma so . At last [I]0-i got rid of [her]189-godmamma , evidently thinking [[our]1622-our nation]1623-our nation " brûlée , "[0-i] as well as " toquée "[0-i] . Now are n't [they]1621-they too odd , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i suppose a nice big bath is such a rare thing for [them]1621-they that [they]1621-they are obliged to make as much fuss as possible over it . [One]658-one would think [they]1621-they received [company there]1625-company there , dressing up like that ! [Héloise]190-héloise and [the smart people]1626-the smart people wash all right ; it is only [the girls]569-the girls and [the thoroughly goody ones like [Godmamma]189-godmamma who are afraid of water]1628-the thoroughly goody ones like godmamma who are afraid of water . 5.30 p.m.—The [Marquis]252-the marquis came over from [Tournelle]195-tournelle with a note from [the Baronne]197-the baronne after déjeûner to - day . [I]0-i happened to be getting some music out of [the big salon for [Héloise]190-héloise]1629-the big salon for héloise when [he]252-the marquis arrived . This was a fortunate chance — more than [he]252-the marquis had dared to hope — would [I]0-i promise to dance the cotillon with [him]252-the marquis to - night ? etc . , etc . [Château de Croixmare]243-château de croixmare , September 1st . A Proposal of Marriage [Dearest Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i have had a proposal ! Is n't it too interesting ? It all happened at [the de Tournelles]1635-the de tournelles ' last night , but [I]0-i never blushed or did any of the things [they]1636-they used to in [Miss Edgeworth]253-miss edgeworth 's novels that [you]1637-you have allowed [me]0-i to read ; but [I]0-i must go straight on . [We]1638-we were quite punctual at [Château de Tournelle]50-château de tournelle , and got [there]398-there as the clock struck eight . [Héloise]190-héloise looked perfectly lovely , [she]190-héloise does hold [herself]190-héloise and walk so beautifully , and [her]190-héloise head is such a nice shape . [I]0-i am going to be like [her]190-héloise , and not like [the women at [Nazeby]8-nazeby ( who all slouched ) when [I]0-i am married]1640-the women at nazeby ( who all slouched ) when i am married . [Victorine]191-victorine looked better than usual too , and [Héloise]190-héloise had put some powder on [her]191-victorine face for [her]191-victorine , but afterwards it came off in patches and made [her]191-victorine look piebald ; however , to start [she]191-victorine was all right , and [everybody]404-everybody was in a good temper . There were [lots of people]1642-lots of people [there]398-there already , and [the Baronne]197-the baronne and [the Comtesse]1038-the comtesse received [us]1645-us in [the hall]396-the hall . [I]0-i wore the white silk and [my]0-i pink tulle hat . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis and [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte both flew across when [we]1645-us arrived , and [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte got to [me]0-i first , as [Godmamma]189-godmamma detained [the Marquis]1341-the marquis ; and this is where [Frenchmen]235-frenchmen shine , for although [he]1341-the marquis told [me]0-i afterwards that [he]1341-the marquis wanted to murder [her]1650-her , [he]1341-the marquis stood with a beautiful grin on [his]1341-the marquis face all the time . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte at once began to assure [me]0-i [I]0-i had promised [him]1341-the marquis the cotillon , but [I]0-i would not say ; and as [he]1341-the marquis could only get words in edgeways , with [Victorine]191-victorine listening all the time , it made it rather difficult for [him]1341-the marquis . Then [the Comte]909-the comte and [René]254-rené , [[his]909-the comte little boy]1652-his little boy , came round with a silver basket full of buttonholes and little cards with names , and by the kind of flower [we]1653-we got [we]1653-we were to know which table [we]1653-we were to sit at , as they were to be decorated with the same . [Les Jeunes Filles]1654-les jeunes filles Of course [the Baronne]197-the baronne had arranged for [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte to take [me]0-i in ; and [our]1653-we table was pink and white carnations . Presently [the whole company]1655-the whole company had arrived , and [we]1653-we started — [a huge train]1656-a huge train , two and two , arm - in - arm — for [the pavilion]1657-the pavilion . It was pretty ; all the trees hung with electric lights and Chinese lanterns , and [the pavilion]1657-the pavilion itself a fairyland of flowers . There were about twelve tables , three of different coloured carnations for the " jeunes filles , "[189-godmamma] and the rest with roses for [the married people]1659-the married people . [Godmamma]189-godmamma thought it most imprudent separating [them]1660-them like that , and would hardly let [Victorine]191-victorine sit down so far away from [her]189-godmamma until [she]189-godmamma saw [the daughter of [the Princesse d'Hauterine]1662-the princesse d'hauterine]1661-the daughter of the princesse d'hauterine at the same table . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis sat with [the Comtesse]1038-the comtesse at [her]1341-the marquis table , and [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [the other bores]1668-the other bores had a table with [the old Baron]962-the old baron , etc . [The Baronne]197-the baronne had [quite [a young man]1671-a young man next [her]197-the baronne]1670-quite a young man next her . [Most of [the girls]569-the girls at [our]1676-our table]1674-most of the girls at our table were either ill - at - ease or excited at the unusual pleasure of being without [[their]1674-most of the girls at our table mothers]620-their mothers , and at first [no one]744-no one talked much . [The French country people]1679-the french country people are almost as frumpy as [the English]211-the english , only in a different way , but [many of [the guests]1681-the guests]1680-many of the guests were very smart , and of course had come from [Paris]19-paris . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte did say such a lot of agreeable things to [me]0-i , and [the others]487-the others were so occupied with [their]487-the others one chance of talking to [a young man]1671-a young man that [they]487-the others did not listen as much as usual . [He]1671-a young man said [he]1671-a young man had never spent such an agitated night as the one at [Vernon]33-vernon . So [I]0-i said No , the fleas were horrid . "[1671-a young man] There was [an oldish girl next to [him]1671-a young man whom [he]1671-a young man knew]1684-an oldish girl next to him whom he knew ; [she]1684-an oldish girl next to him whom he knew has coiffed [St. Catherine]217-coiffer st. catherine for several years now , and was put at [our]1685-our table , [I]0-i believe , to be [a kind of chaperon]1686-a kind of chaperon . [She]1684-an oldish girl next to him whom he knew happened to be listening just then , as [[her]1684-an oldish girl next to him whom he knew partner]1687-her partner would talk to [[Victorine]191-victorine 's friend]1688-victorine 's friend — [the pretty one with the dirty nails — who was at [his]1671-a young man other side]1689-the pretty one with the dirty nails — who was at his other side . [I]0-i said it was about [our]1685-our journey on [the Sauterelle]27-the sauterelle , where , at [Vernon]33-vernon , [Monsieur de la Trémors]206-monsieur de la trémors had been so badly bitten by the fleas that [they]1690-they had given [him]206-monsieur de la trémors silly dreams . [He]206-monsieur de la trémors said [his]206-monsieur de la trémors dreams were as beautiful as those produced by [the Hachis of [Monte Cristo]65-monte cristo]1691-the hachis of monte cristo ( whatever that is ) , so [the old girl]1692-the old girl exclaimed , " Quel pouvoir pour une puce ! "[1692-the old girl] [She]1692-the old girl thought [we]1685-our were mad ; and [I]0-i overheard [her]1692-the old girl presently telling [[her]1692-the old girl partner]1687-her partner — when [she]1692-the old girl could get [him]1687-her partner to listen — that [no one]744-no one would believe the bizarre conversations of [the toqués English]1695-the toqués english unless [they]1696-they actually heard them ! [The Cotillon]1697-the cotillon [I]0-i would not say [I]0-i would dance the cotillon with [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte . [I]0-i told [him]206-monsieur de la trémors [I]0-i had half promised it to [the Marquis]1341-the marquis ; and when [he]206-monsieur de la trémors seemed offended , [I]0-i said if [he]206-monsieur de la trémors was going to be disagreeable [I]0-i would certainly dance it with [Monsieur de Beaupré]255-monsieur de beaupré ( [the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's name , which [I]0-i forgot to tell [you]1701-you before ) . [I]0-i remember hearing [Octavia]150-octavia say once that it never did to make [oneself]1702-oneself easy to [young men]1703-young men , that [the more capricious one]1704-the more capricious one was the better ; and [you]1701-you know how nice [Octavia]150-octavia is , and [I]0-i meant to be like [her]150-octavia . [He]206-monsieur de la trémors went on imploring ; so [I]0-i told [him]206-monsieur de la trémors that [I]0-i had come [there]398-there to enjoy [myself]0-i , not to amuse [him]206-monsieur de la trémors , so [I]0-i should just dance with whom [I]0-i pleased , or not at all if [I]0-i happened not to want to . [He]206-monsieur de la trémors said [I]0-i was " très cruelle , "[206-monsieur de la trémors] and looked perfectly wobbly - eyed at [me]0-i , but [I]0-i did not mind a bit . As dinner went on [all the girls]1706-all the girls began to talk and to get excited , and laugh , and [every one]428-every one was so gay ; but [I]0-i could see [Godmamma]189-godmamma craning [her]189-godmamma neck with anxiety and disapproval , and [I]0-i am sure , if it had not been for [the Princesse]1708-the princesse d'Hauterine being at [her]189-godmamma table , [she]189-godmamma would have jumped up and clawed [Victorine]191-victorine away . It came to an end at last , and [we]1709-we returned arm - in - arm to [the house]526-the house , while [the servants]1115-the servants arranged the pavilion for the cotillon . [Godmamma]189-godmamma collected [Victorine]191-victorine and [me]0-i , and made [us]1709-we stay by [her]189-godmamma ; and that horrid old [Mme . de Visac]256-mme . de visac — the one who called [me]0-i a " jeune femme"—came[256-mme . de visac] up , and [they]1712-they had a conversation . [Godmamma]189-godmamma said it was " très imprudent "[189-godmamma] having the dinner first , that the champagne would go to [the young men]1713-the young men 's heads , and with all the care in [the world]476-the world [no one]744-no one could foresee the consequences ! [The garden]870-the garden , too ! If [they]1713-the young men should dance the farandole ! what opportunities ! It was all the fault of [the chère Baronne]197-the baronne , so sadly giddy for [her]197-the baronne age . [She]197-the baronne never thought of the anxieties of [other mothers]1717-other mothers , having married [[her]197-the baronne only daughter]1718-her only daughter so young ! [I]0-i do n't know what [Godmamma]189-godmamma feared , but [I]0-i should hate to think [you]189-godmamma could not trust [me]0-i to behave like [a lady]1719-a lady , [Mamma]132-mamma , if [I]0-i was out of [your]189-godmamma sight a moment . Nearly a Duel [I]0-i saw [the Marquis]1341-the marquis talking to [a very young youth]1721-a very young youth ; [he]1341-the marquis seemed pleading with [him]1341-the marquis about something , and presently [the youth]1722-the youth crossed over and kissed [Godmamma]189-godmamma 's hand , then asked [Victorine]191-victorine for the cotillon . [She]191-victorine looked furious , but [she]191-victorine was obliged to say yes , as [no one else]1407-no one else had asked [her]191-victorine ; it was getting late , and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis was busy speaking to [some other ladies]1725-some other ladies . Presently [he]1341-the marquis came up to [us]1726-us , and [the young youth]1727-the young youth said before [he]1727-the young youth could speak : " N'ai - je pas de la veine , mon cher , Mlle . de Croixmare m'a promis le cotillon . "[1341-the marquis] Upon which [the Marquis]1341-the marquis asked [me]0-i to dance it with [him]1341-the marquis — right out loud before [Godmamma]189-godmamma ! and when [I]0-i said [I]0-i had half promised it to [Monsieur de la Trémors]206-monsieur de la trémors , [he]206-monsieur de la trémors looked so cross and offended , that [I]0-i thought it was better to be firm with [him]206-monsieur de la trémors , as [I]0-i had been with [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte . [He]214-the vicomte — [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte — came up just then , and [they]1730-they looked as if [they]1730-they wanted to fight [each other]437-each other ; so [I]0-i said if [they]1730-they would stop frowning , [I]0-i would dance it with both of [them]1730-they , but if [they]1730-they were nasty , [I]0-i should not dance it with either ; and so that is how it ended , [I]0-i was to have one on each side . [Godmamma]189-godmamma said to [me]0-i that it was unheard of conduct , and might have produced a duel , and when [I]0-i tried to explain to [her]189-godmamma that that was just what [I]0-i had avoided , [she]189-godmamma looked angrier than ever , and would not understand . Was n't it stupid of [her]189-godmamma , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [The Two Partners]1732-the two partners At last [we]1733-we got to [the pavilion]1657-the pavilion , and all sat round , and having both [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis to talk to , [I]0-i did have fun . [They]1730-they arranged that [our]1733-we chairs should be against the wall , and not in the row that [the chaperons]1672-the chaperons were behind . [Godmamma]189-godmamma tried to make signs to [me]0-i to come and sit by [Victorine]191-victorine in front of [her]189-godmamma , but [I]0-i pretended not to see , until all the chairs were filled up . [The Marquise de Vermandoise]233-the marquise de vermandoise was next [me]0-i , with the Vicomte between ; [she]233-the marquise de vermandoise was dancing with [the Comte]203-the comte . [We]1733-we were gay ! The first set of presents were big brocade bags , and [we]1733-we called one [our]1733-we " pot au feu "[233-the marquise de vermandoise] and pretended it was for the ingredients to make bon ménage , and so all the presents that were small enough afterwards [we]1733-we put in there to keep for [me]0-i . [I]0-i did have lots ! A cotillon is very easy , [Mamma]132-mamma , as [you]132-mamma have often told [me]0-i , and it was fun dancing with all sorts of strange people that [one did not even know]1738-one did not even know . In one figure [a huge Russian prince]1739-a huge russian prince got hold of [me]0-i , and squeezed [me]0-i until [I]0-i very nearly screamed ; [you]132-mamma see , [Mamma]132-mamma , how dreadful [foreigners]1740-foreigners are like that . It was like being hugged by a bear in [the Zoo]399-the zoo ; and after it , [he]1739-a huge russian prince kept giving [me]0-i flowers or presents if [I]0-i dared to sit down for a moment , but [he]1739-a huge russian prince did not say a word except once or twice a mumble of " [Adorable mademoiselle]257-adorable mademoiselle . "[1739-a huge russian prince] [[My]0-i two partners]1742-my two partners were nice , [we]1743-we had a perfectly beautiful time , [they]1742-my two partners laughed at everything [I]0-i said ; and [Madame de Vermandoise]216-madame de vermandoise leant over and whispered — while [they]1742-my two partners were both away doing a figure — that never had [any one]536-any one had such a succès as [me]0-i , and that [all the old ladies]1745-all the old ladies would be ready to tear [my]0-i eyes out . [Héloise]190-héloise did not dance with " [Antoine]207-antoine , "[1739-a huge russian prince] but [he]1739-a huge russian prince sat next [her]190-héloise , and [they]1742-my two partners talked while [[his]1739-a huge russian prince partner]1746-his partner was away with [other people]1282-other people . It is much better to have [two partners]1748-two partners , [Mamma]132-mamma , because then one is not left to oneself at all , and [they]1748-two partners are each trying to be nicer than [the other]923-the other all the time . [The Comtesse]195-tournelle led the cotillon with [a cousin of hers]1750-a cousin of hers ; [he]1739-a huge russian prince does do it well , and does nothing else in [Paris]19-paris , [the Baronne]1036-the baronne told [me]0-i . At last [we]1752-we got on towards the end , and [they]1748-two partners began the farandole . [You]0-i know it , [Mamma]564-mamma ? [A lady]1719-a lady and [a gentleman]1755-a gentleman take hands , then [she]1719-a lady beckons [some one]717-some one , and [he]717-some one has to come ; and then [he]717-some one calls [another lady]1757-another lady , and so on . It goes on until [the whole company]1655-the whole company are hand - in - hand ; and [the leader]1759-the leader runs about everywhere with this chain of [people]411-people after [him]1759-the leader , dancing a long sliding step , to such a lovely go - ahead tune . [The leader]1759-the leader tears all over [the garden]870-the garden , and [one]658-one is obliged to follow in and out . It is too exciting , and just as [we]1752-we got to the furthest end of [the illuminated paths]1764-the illuminated paths , and had rushed round into the dark , [some one]717-some one let go , and in the confusion of trying to catch on again , [the Marquis]1341-the marquis and [I]0-i were left behind . To Elope with [the Marquis]1341-the marquis It was then the proposal happened , [he]1341-the marquis did not wait a moment ; [he]1341-the marquis talked so fast [I]0-i could hardly understand [him]1341-the marquis . [He]1341-the marquis said [he]1341-the marquis had heard that it was the custom of [[our]1752-we country]1768-our country to speak directly to [the person [one loved]1770-one loved , without consulting [the parents]1771-the parents]1769-the person one loved , without consulting the parents ; so [he]1341-the marquis hoped [I]0-i would believe [he]1341-the marquis meant [me]0-i no disrespect , but that [he]1341-the marquis adored [me]0-i . [He]1341-the marquis had fallen in love at first sight , when [he]1341-the marquis went to review [Victorine]191-victorine — that [he]1341-the marquis implored [me]0-i to fly with [him]1341-the marquis , as [[his]1341-the marquis mother]494-his mother would never consent to [his]1341-the marquis marrying [an English woman]1773-an english woman ! Think of it , [Mamma]132-mamma ! [me]0-i flying with [the Marquis]1341-the marquis ! without a wedding cake , or [bridesmaids]1775-bridesmaids , or pages , or trousseau , or any of the really nice bits of getting married — only the boring part of just going away and staying with [one man]797-one man , without any of the other things to make up for it . [I]0-i nearly laughed at the ridiculousness of it , only [he]1341-the marquis was so deadly in earnest , and would hold [my]0-i hand . [I]0-i said [I]0-i could not think of such a thing , and would [he]1341-the marquis take [me]0-i back to [the pavilion]1657-the pavilion ?
