[He]1341-the marquis became quite wild then , and said [he]1341-the marquis would kill [himself]1341-the marquis with grief ; and such a lot of things about love ; but [I]0-i was so wanting to join in the farandole again — [we]1778-we heard [them]1779-them coming nearer — that [my]0-i attention was all on that , and [I]0-i did not listen much . Anyway , [I]0-i am sure runaway matches are n't legal in [France]10-france , from what [I]0-i heard [Jean]188-jean saying two nights ago at dinner ; and [I]0-i told [him]1341-the marquis so at last , and that pulled [him]1341-the marquis up short . And just then [the train]393-the train passed , and [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i hand to [the last man]1781-the last man , and was whirled away back to [the pavilion]1657-the pavilion and [the people]1439-the people . [I]0-i was glad to get away from [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , because [he]1341-the marquis looked desperate , and [you]1785-you ca n't trust [foreigners]1740-foreigners , [they]1740-foreigners have pistols and things in [their]1740-foreigners pockets , and [he]1341-the marquis might have shot [me]0-i . When [we]1787-our got back to [our]1787-our seats , [the défilé]1788-the défilé began and [I]0-i took [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte 's arm to go and make [our]1787-our curtsey to [the Comtesse]1038-the comtesse and [the Baronne]1036-the baronne . It was just as well [the Marquis]1341-the marquis was away , because [they]1740-foreigners might have quarrelled as to which one 's arm [I]0-i was to take . [[Godmamma]189-godmamma 's Friends]1793-godmamma 's friends Just before the supper tables were brought in , [Monsieur de Beaupré]255-monsieur de beaupré turned up again . [His]255-monsieur de beaupré face was green ; [he]255-monsieur de beaupré came up behind [me]0-i , and whispered through [his]255-monsieur de beaupré teeth that [I]0-i had broken [his]255-monsieur de beaupré heart , and that [he]255-monsieur de beaupré should marry [Victorine]191-victorine ! So [you]1794-you see , [Mamma]132-mamma , nothing could have turned out better , and [they]1793-godmamma 's friends ought to be very grateful to [me]0-i . [We]1795-we had the gayest supper , all at little tables ; and it was arranged that [we]1795-we should go with the de Tournelles , and [the Baronne]1036-the baronne , to a Ralli de Papier to - day , given by [the 75th Cuirassiers at [the Forêt de Marly]66-the forêt de marly]1797-the 75th cuirassiers at the forêt de marly . While [we]1795-we were going to [the house]526-the house to get [our]1795-we wraps , [I]0-i overheard [two ladies]1799-two ladies talking of [Godmamma]189-godmamma . [They]1799-two ladies said [she]189-godmamma gave [herself]189-godmamma great airs , and considering that [every one]428-every one knew that years ago [she]189-godmamma had been [the amie of [that good - looking Englishman at [the Embassy]1803-the embassy]1802-that good - looking englishman at the embassy]1801-the amie of that good - looking englishman at the embassy these high stilts of virtue were ridiculous . [I]0-i suppose to be [an amie]1804-an amie is something wicked in French , but it does n't sound very bad , does it , [Mamma]132-mamma ? And , whatever it is , [I]0-i wonder if [poor papa]583-poor papa knew , as [he]583-poor papa was at [the Embassy]1803-the embassy , and it might have been [one of [[his]583-poor papa friends]1808-his friends]1807-one of his friends , might n't it ? [I]0-i expect [she]189-godmamma had not a moustache then . [I]0-i am dreadfully afraid [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte wo n't be able to be at [the Ralli]67-the ralli to - day , although [he]965-the vicomte did whisper when [he]965-the vicomte was putting on [my]0-i cloak that nothing should keep [him]965-the vicomte away , and that then [I]0-i would believe the extent of [his]965-the vicomte devotion . [He]965-the vicomte wo n't have gone to bed at all , if [he]965-the vicomte does turn up , as [he]965-the vicomte will only have got back to [Versailles]29-versailles just in time for [his]965-the vicomte duty at six , and how [he]965-the vicomte is to be in [the Forêt de Marly]1810-the forêt de marly by ten [I]0-i do n't know , but [we]1811-we shall see . It is just time to start , the brake is at the door , so good - bye , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma , with love from [[your]1162-dear mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Château de Croixmare]243-château de croixmare , Thursday Night , September 1st . The " Ralli de Papier "[114-mamma,—i] Dearest [Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i wonder if [you]1162-dear mamma have ever been to [a Ralli de Papier]1814-a ralli de papier ? It is fun . [We]1811-we got to [Marly]68-marly at last after a long drive . [The rendezvous]1815-the rendezvous was in [the middle of [the forest]1817-the forest]1816-the middle of the forest , in such a lovely glade , and although it rained for the last twenty minutes of [our]1811-we drive , the sun came out when [we]1811-we got [there]398-there , and the lights through the trees on the wet green were so beautiful . There were quantities of [carriages already arrived]1819-carriages already arrived , every sort — [victorias]1820-victorias , [coaches]1821-coaches , [pony carts]1822-pony carts , [charabancs]1823-charabancs , [motor cars]1824-motor cars , and a few of the really odd kinds of [shandrydans that one]1825-shandrydans that one sees coming to [country garden parties in [England]25-england]1826-country garden parties in england . There were also numbers of [officers riding in uniform]1827-officers riding in uniform — [cuirassiers]1828-cuirassiers , [chasseurs]1665-chasseurs , [dragons]1830-dragons — and [they]1827-officers riding in uniform were to take part in the chase . There was [one officer who was to lead [the carriages]1832-the carriages in a procession through the short cuts]1831-one officer who was to lead the carriages in a procession through the short cuts , so that [we]1811-we might not miss any of the jumps , and [he]1831-one officer who was to lead the carriages in a procession through the short cuts had a horn slung over [his]1831-one officer who was to lead the carriages in a procession through the short cuts shoulder . [I]0-i do think it such a sensible plan ; and if [we]1811-we could have the foxes trained in [England]25-england to go just where [they]1833-they should , and then always drive to where the jumps are , like that , how much nicer hunting would be — wouldn't it , [Mamma]132-mamma ? Better than Fox - hunting Well , at last [every one]428-every one seemed to be arrived , and it was gay . [I]0-i was glad [Godmamma]189-godmamma had been too tired to come , so [Victorine]191-victorine was actually trusted with [Jean]188-jean and [Héloise]190-héloise and [me]0-i . [We]1811-we had picked up [the Baronne]197-the baronne and [the Comte]203-the comte and [the Marquise de Vermandoise]233-the marquise de vermandoise at [Tournelle]195-tournelle on [our]1811-we way . [The brake]1835-the brake was not quite like an English one ; [it]1835-the brake had seats facing , and then an extra one behind for [the grooms]791-the grooms , and [Jean]188-jean drove with [Héloise]190-héloise beside [him]1837-him ; but [he]1837-him does look like a trussed pigeon , and if the horses were not as quiet as mice , [I]0-i am sure [the Baronne]197-the baronne would never have trusted [herself]197-the baronne with [him]1837-him . [The Vicomte]965-the vicomte up to Time [They]1839-they all began to chaff about [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte ; " Il ne chevauchera jamais si loin , pas même pour vos beaux yeux , "[1013-the marquise] [the Marquise]1013-the marquise said . [Victorine]191-victorine seemed annoyed that [any one]536-any one should expect [he]1837-him would do anything for [me]0-i . " Evidemment Monsieur de la Trémors ne viendra pas , "[191-victorine] [she]191-victorine said . [I]0-i saw a beautiful black horse being led about by [a groom]1842-a groom , apart from [the crowd]1843-the crowd , and [I]0-i wondered who would ride [it]1844-it . Just before the horn sounded for [the carriages]1832-the carriages to start , from the farthest end of [the allée]1846-the allée [we]1847-we saw [an officer]1848-an officer galloping as hard as [he]1848-an officer could . " Mon Dieu ! C'est Gaston ! "[197-the baronne] screamed [the Baronne]197-the baronne . " C'est pour vous , Enchanteresse , "[909-the comte] said [the Comte]909-the comte . " Que c'est ridicule , "[191-victorine] snapped [Victorine]191-victorine , while [the Marquise]1013-the marquise laughed and put [her]1013-the marquise tongue into [her]1013-the marquise gap . " Oh ! [la belle jeunesse]3152-la belle jeunesse ! "[1013-the marquise] [she]1013-the marquise said . Meanwhile [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte had dismounted , jumped on to the fresh black horse , and was bowing beside [us]1847-we . " Vous voyez je suis venu , "[965-the vicomte] [he]965-the vicomte said , and [he]965-the vicomte looked only at [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n't know why , [Mamma]132-mamma , but [I]0-i felt the blood rushing all over [my]0-i cheeks ; it was nice of [him]965-the vicomte , was n't it ? [He]965-the vicomte had arranged it all yesterday , and by changing horses and galloping the whole way , [he]965-the vicomte had managed just to get to the rendezvous in time . [I]0-i do n't believe [any Englishman that [I]0-i know]1852-any englishman that i know would do so much for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i was touched . [We]1847-we were fortunate in being almost [the first carriage behind [[our]1847-we leader]1854-our leader]1853-the first carriage behind our leader , [the officer with the horn]1855-the officer with the horn , and [he]965-the vicomte took [us]1847-we across [roads]1856-roads , and [we]1847-we halted at last , where [we]1847-we could see the whole hunt advancing to some hurdles which had been erected at a few yards ' distance from each other down [the allée]1846-the allée . Such an excitement ! [every one encouraging [them]1859-them at the top of [their]1859-them voices]1858-every one encouraging them at the top of their voices , [their]1859-them uniforms glittering in the sun . The jumps were not very high , and [most of [the officers]1325-the officers]1860-most of the officers got over all right , only [one cuirassier]1862-one cuirassier fell , and [every one]428-every one shrieked , but [he]428-every one was n't a bit hurt . [We]1847-we clapped those who jumped especially well , and cried " Bravo ! "[1847-we] It was fun . Then , when [they]1859-them had all passed , [we]1847-we were conducted through some more short cuts to another set of hurdles covered with green boughs , and these were a little higher . It did sound lively , with horns blowing and [people]411-people shouting all the time . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte was among the last , as [he]214-the vicomte passed [us]1847-we following the paper , but [he]214-the vicomte waved gaily . [We]1847-we had to drive very quickly to be in time for the next " obstacles "[214-the vicomte] and so it went on . When [we]1847-we watched [the last ones]1865-the last ones , [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte was among the very front four . [Rewards of Gallantry]258-rewards of gallantry Then the exciting part began , as [they]1859-them had to race for the ribbons , white for the winner and blue for the second ; but it was quite a long way , so [we]1847-we had time to get to the winning - post , [the flat place near where [the Château]69-the château stood formerly]1866-the flat place near where the château stood formerly . There were long tables laid out with goûter , and the bands of [the regiments]1867-the regiments playing nice tunes . [Victorine]191-victorine began to be disagreeable directly [we]1847-we saw [them]1859-them coming , [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte well to the front . " Comme c'est cruel de [Monsieur de la Trémors]206-monsieur de la trémors , de presser son cheval à ce point , "[191-victorine] [she]191-victorine said , while even [the Comte]909-the comte became excited , and shouted , " Bravo , [Gaston]200-gaston ! "[909-the comte] [I]0-i was pleased when [he]214-the vicomte came in first , and really [he]214-the vicomte rides quite nicely , [Mamma]132-mamma . Then [every one]428-every one got out of [the carriages]1832-the carriages and there was a ceremony . [The wife of [the Colonel of [the 75th chasseurs]1873-the 75th chasseurs]1872-the colonel of the 75th chasseurs ( young and nice looking ) placed a white ribbon with gold fringe ends round the neck of [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte]1871-the wife of the colonel of the 75th chasseurs ( young and nice looking ) placed a white ribbon with gold fringe ends round the neck of the vicomte , while [he]214-the vicomte knelt and kissed [her]191-victorine hand on the damp grass , and when [he]214-the vicomte got up there was quite a wet stain on [his]214-the vicomte knees . [The second man]1875-the second man — [a great lumbering cuirassier]1876-a great lumbering cuirassier — got a blue ribbon , and as [he]1875-the second man was heavier the stain showed worse on [his]1875-the second man red trousers . After that , [we]1877-we all began to eat cakes and drink drinks ( [I]0-i do n't know what they were made of , that is why [I]0-i say " drinks , "[0-i] anyway they were sweet and nice ) , and as the rain had stopped [we]1877-we danced on [the green]1878-the green , after [we]1877-we had finished . Now [you]1879-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , [we]1877-we could never have any fun like this in [England]25-england . What [Englishman]259-englishman would think of dancing the Lancers on sopping grass , quite gravely , with a white ribbon round [his]259-englishman neck like a pet lamb , and [his]259-englishman trousers wet through at the knees ? [They]1880-they would simply laugh in the middle , and spoil the whole thing . [The Vicomte]965-the vicomte danced with [me]0-i , of course , and while [we]1877-we were advancing to [our]1877-we vis - à - vis in the first figure , [he]965-the vicomte managed to whisper that [he]965-the vicomte adored [me]0-i , and now that [he]965-the vicomte had ridden all night , and won the white ribbon for [me]0-i , [I]0-i ought to believe [him]965-the vicomte . [I]0-i did not answer because there was not time just then , and [he]965-the vicomte looked so reproachfully at [me]0-i for the rest of the Lancers . [The Whispered Declaration]1882-the whispered declaration It began to rain again before [we]1877-we finished , and [we]1877-we got into the brake as quickly as [we]1877-we could . It was a perfect wonder that [they]1880-they were not all exclaiming at [their]1880-they wet feet , and catching cold ; but it seems that dancing on the green and these sort of fêtes champêtres are national sports , and [you]1883-you do n't catch cold at [them]1880-they . It is only washing , and having the windows open , and [the house]526-the house aired , and things like that , that give cold in [France]10-france . [The Vicomte]965-the vicomte came back with [us]1877-we , and , as [he]965-the vicomte was one too many for the brake , [we]1877-we had to sit very close on [our]1877-we seat . [He]965-the vicomte was between [the Baronne]197-the baronne and [Victorine]191-victorine , who made room for [him]965-the vicomte when [he]965-the vicomte was just going to sit down by [me]0-i . [She]191-victorine kept giggling all the way [home]390-home , and [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte looked so squashed and uncomfortable . [I]0-i was next , beyond [the Baronne]197-the baronne , and as [both of [them]525-both of them]525-both of them could not keep up [their]525-both of them umbrellas , [Victorine]191-victorine was obliged to put down [hers]191-victorine , and the drips from [the Baronne]197-the baronne 's umbrella got on to the roses in [Victorine]191-victorine 's hat . At last they ran in a red stream right down [her]191-victorine nose , and [she]191-victorine did look odd , and each time [she]191-victorine said anything to [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte , [he]965-the vicomte nearly had a fit to keep from laughing , and when [we]1888-we got back and [she]191-victorine found how [she]191-victorine was looking [she]191-victorine was cross . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte took hold of [my]0-i hand when [he]214-the vicomte helped [me]0-i out , it was n't in saying good - bye , as of course [unmarried people]1889-unmarried people only bow and do n't shake hands . Somehow [his]214-the vicomte spur caught in [my]0-i dress , and [we]1888-we had to stop a minute to disentangle it , [the others]487-the others had bolted into [the house]526-the house , as [they]487-the others were afraid of the rain , so [we]1888-we were alone for an instant . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte at once kissed [my]0-i hand and said , " Je vous adore . "[214-the vicomte] It was done so quickly that [even [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte , who had come out with an open umbrella to help [us]1888-we , did not see — at least [I]0-i hope [he]204-hippolyte did n't]204-hippolyte . [We]1888-we went in to [Tournelle]195-tournelle to have something to drink , while the horses were being rubbed down , as [we]1888-we had had such a long drive ; and it was at the first mirror [Victorine]191-victorine discovered [her]191-victorine red striped nose . While [I]0-i was sipping [my]0-i punch , [I]0-i heard [the Baronne]197-the baronne telling [Héloise]190-héloise that [[her]197-the baronne nephew]1892-her nephew , [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , had consented to marry [Victorine]191-victorine ; and that [the Baron]1485-the baron would go over to [Croixmare]22-croixmare the next day to make the formal demand for [her]197-the baronne hand . Then [she]197-the baronne whispered something , and [they]1895-they looked at [me]0-i , and [Héloise]190-héloise laughed , while [the Baronne]197-the baronne said , " Pauvre garçon . C'est dommage qu'il ne puisse pas combiner le plaisir avec les affaires . "[197-the baronne] And when [we]1888-we got back to [Croixmare]22-croixmare , [Héloise]190-héloise came to [[my]0-i room]631-my room and kissed [me]0-i , and thanked [me]0-i ; [she]190-héloise had heard , [she]190-héloise said , from [the Baronne]197-the baronne , how [I]0-i had broken [the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's heart , and so got [him]1341-the marquis to consent to take [Victorine]191-victorine ! [I]0-i am glad , [Mamma]132-mamma , that getting married is differently arranged with [us]1888-we . [I]0-i should hate to have some one because [somebody else that [he]1341-the marquis wanted]1898-somebody else that he wanted would not have [him]1341-the marquis . However , [Victorine]191-victorine is as pleased as can be , and has been smiling to [herself]191-victorine all the evening . Now [I]0-i must go to bed , so good - bye , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma , with love from [[your]132-mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . Château de [Croixmare]22-croixmare , Saturday , September 3rd . In Due Form Dearest Mamma,—I am sure what [I]0-i am going to tell [you]132-mamma will surprise [you]132-mamma quite as much as it has done [me]0-i . [Victorine]191-victorine is really engaged ! The day after the Ralli de Papier it rained again , and as [we]1888-we were sitting in [the little salon]1425-the little salon after breakfast [the old Baron]962-the old baron was announced . [He]962-the old baron was dressed in a frock coat and a tall hat , just as if it was [Paris]19-paris and the height of the season . [They]1903-they made conversation for about ten minutes , and then [he]962-the old baron got up and , putting [his]962-the old baron heels together , [he]962-the old baron said [he]962-the old baron had come to request a private interview with [Mme]256-mme . de visac . [la Comtesse Douairière de Croixmare]209-la comtesse de croixmare , and [Monsieur le Comte de Croixmare]196-the comte , [son fils]1904-son fils ; upon which [Victorine]191-victorine looked coy , and began scrabbling with [her]191-victorine toes on the paquet . [Héloise]190-héloise was not in [the room]401-the room , and [Godmamma]189-godmamma said to [me]0-i that it was time for [our]1888-we walk , as the rain had stopped , and [Mdlle . Blanc]260-mdlle . blanc ( " [the Tug "]3153-the tug "[260-mdlle . blanc] ) would be waiting . So [we]1888-we bundled out of [the room]401-the room , and [Victorine]191-victorine for the first time became affectionate as [we]1888-we went [upstairs]470-upstairs . " Il est venu pour demander ma main , pour [son neveu]3154-son neveu , [Monsieur de Beaupré]255-monsieur de beaupré , "[191-victorine] [she]191-victorine said , putting [her]191-victorine arm round [my]0-i waist ; " J'espère que cela ne vous chagrine pas , chérie ? "[191-victorine] And when [I]0-i asked [her]191-victorine why in [the world]476-the world it should grieve [me]0-i [she]191-victorine said that , as [every one]428-every one had noticed how [I]0-i had flirted with [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , [she]191-victorine supposed [his]1341-the marquis preferring [another girl]1911-another girl could not be quite pleasant ! [I]0-i could have screamed with laughter , if [I]0-i had not been so angry ; [I]0-i felt dreadfully tempted to tell [her]191-victorine of [the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's proposal to [me]0-i , and why [he]1341-the marquis was marrying [her]191-victorine — only that would have been playing down to [her]191-victorine level of meanness . So [I]0-i said that the English idea of flirting and the French were different ; that [the Marquis]1341-the marquis seemed to [me]0-i to be quite [an agreeable Frenchman]1914-an agreeable frenchman , and no doubt [she]191-victorine would be very happy ; and far from it grieving [me]0-i , [I]0-i was delighted to think [she]191-victorine would be settled at last , as twenty - two was rather on the road to [fixing [St. Catherine]217-coiffer st. catherine 's tresses]1915-fixing st. catherine 's tresses . [She]191-victorine dragged [her]191-victorine arm away in such a hurry that [she]191-victorine scratched [her]191-victorine hand on a pin that Agnès had stupidly left in [my]0-i belt . " Voyez ! vous avez fait saigner ma main , "[191-victorine] [she]191-victorine said almost crying with fury . All [I]0-i said was , " Qui s'y - frotte s'y pique , "[0-i] and as [we]1916-we had got to the door of [[my]0-i room]631-my room , [I]0-i went off in fits of laughter — [she]191-victorine looked so like a cross monkey [I]0-i could not help it ! [Girlish Amenities]261-girlish amenities Well , [you]1918-you can think , [Mamma]564-mamma , [we]1916-we did not have an agreeable walk . [Victorine]191-victorine talked in [her]191-victorine most prudish goody style to " the Remorqueur , "[191-victorine] and never addressed [me]0-i ; while [poor Mademoiselle Blanc]144-mademoiselle was so nervous trying to speak to [both]1920-both . As [we]1916-we got to [the turn into Vinant]1921-the turn into vinant , [Monsieur Dubois]262-monsieur dubois — [[Victorine]191-victorine 's music - master]1922-victorine 's music - master — came up [the street]1448-the street . [He]262-monsieur dubois is [a rather vulgar looking person]1924-a rather vulgar looking person , with a black moustache , and lemon yellow gloves , and horrid if [you]1918-you have to be quite close to [him]262-monsieur dubois . Just then [we]1916-we stopped to give some sous to [a beggar - woman]1925-a beggar - woman , so as [he]262-monsieur dubois passed [he]262-monsieur dubois said , with a great flourish of the hat : Was [he]262-monsieur dubois to come on Saturday as usual for the lesson ? [Victorine]191-victorine looked down all the time modestly , and " [the Tug]3155-the tug "[191-victorine] answered : Of course ; so [he]262-monsieur dubois said it would be a never - to - be - sufficiently - thanked kindness , if [Mademoiselle]144-mademoiselle would take back with [her]144-mademoiselle this roll of music [he]262-monsieur dubois had been on [his]262-monsieur dubois way to deliver chez elle , as it was much out of [[his]262-monsieur dubois road]1926-his road , and [he]262-monsieur dubois was pressed for time at [his]262-monsieur dubois next lesson . [Victorine]191-victorine at once seized it , and [he]262-monsieur dubois bowed again and walked on . [Mademoiselle Blanc]144-mademoiselle had already a parcel in each hand [she]144-mademoiselle was taking to [the embroidery shop]1927-the embroidery shop . After that [Victorine]191-victorine was distraite , and seemed in a great hurry to get [home]390-home ; [she]191-victorine even spoke to [me]0-i , and while " the Tug "[191-victorine] was looking at wools in [the shop]1929-the shop [she]191-victorine fidgeted so with the music that it came undone . [I]0-i offered to carry it , as [I]0-i had no parcels , but [she]191-victorine snatched it up as if it was gold , and in doing so a bit of paper fell out of it , and as [I]0-i picked it up [I]0-i could not help seeing it began " Ma cruelle adorée . "[191-victorine] [She]191-victorine said , in a great rage , that it was only the words of a song , as [she]191-victorine put it in [her]191-victorine pocket ; so [I]0-i do n't see why [she]191-victorine should have been so furious with [me]0-i seeing it , do [you]1930-you , [Mamma?—but]263-mamma?—but [she]191-victorine had not got over the pin in [my]0-i belt , [I]0-i suppose . Anyway [she]191-victorine made [us]1931-us trot [home]390-home with seven - leagued boots . [The Music - master Godmamma]1933-the music - master godmamma met [us]1931-us in [the hall]396-the hall , radiant , and , clasping [Victorine]191-victorine to [her]1933-the music - master godmamma breast , said [she]1933-the music - master godmamma must announce to [her]1933-the music - master godmamma the joyful news that [M. le Baron de Frémond]198-the baron de frémond had made the demande , on the part of [[his]198-the baron de frémond sister]947-his sister , [the Marquise de Beaupré]264-the marquise de beaupré , for the hand of [her]1933-the music - master godmamma peerless Victorine , for [[her]1933-the music - master godmamma son]1936-her son and [[his]198-the baron de frémond nephew]1937-his nephew , [the Marquis de Beaupré]1938-the marquis de beaupré , and that [she]1933-the music - master godmamma — [Godmamma]189-godmamma — had consented to relinquish to [them]1939-they this treasure . [Jean]188-jean came out of [the smoking - room]1397-the smoking - room just then and [they]1939-they all began kissing — it was awful . [I]0-i got [upstairs]470-upstairs as quickly as [I]0-i could , and [Héloise]190-héloise soon joined [me]0-i [there]398-there . [She]190-héloise was enchanted at the idea of really getting rid of [Victorine]191-victorine , and [she]190-héloise said [Godmamma]189-godmamma 's rheumatism was growing so bad [she]190-héloise would soon have to spend the summer at [German baths]1943-german baths , and so [they]1939-they would fortunately at last have [Croixmare]196-the comte to [themselves]1939-they ; and [she]190-héloise could not thank [me]0-i enough for having assisted at this dénoûment . All the evening [Victorine]191-victorine played the tunes [the music - master]1944-the music - master gave [her]191-victorine , and once or twice broke into a song of joy ; but when [I]0-i asked [her]191-victorine to try the one beginning " Ma cruelle adorée , "[191-victorine] [she]191-victorine looked green , and said [she]191-victorine was tired , and would go to bed . A Game of Billiards Then [Jean]188-jean and [I]0-i had a game of billiards — [we]1945-us often do now after dinner . [The salle de billard]1946-the salle de billard opens out of [the salon]892-the salon , and there is a glass like a window over the mantelpiece , so that [you]1948-you can see into [the two rooms]1949-the two rooms from each other . It always reminds [me]0-i of [Alice]265-alice , in " Through the Looking Glass"—you[265-alice] expect to find a mirror , and [you]1948-you see into [another room]1950-another room . [Godmamma]189-godmamma generally accompanies [us]1945-us into [the billiard - room]553-the billiard - room , and sits bolt upright in an armchair watching [us]1945-us , but to - night [she]189-godmamma was too excited to pay [us]1945-us so much attention , and stayed talking to [Héloise]190-héloise about the engagement . [Jean]188-jean seemed nervous and sad , and knocked about the balls aimlessly , not trying a bit . It is only French billiards , but still [one]658-one has to play properly , so at last [I]0-i said that evidently the good news of [Victorine]191-victorine 's engagement had so distracted [him]1953-he that [he]1953-he could not pay attention to the game . [He]1953-he seemed quite startled . " Ma foi ! le jeu ! "[1953-he] [he]1953-he said vacantly . [I]0-i put down [my]0-i cue and asked [him]1953-he quite gently what was the matter ? Just then the bangle [you]188-jean gave [me]0-i last Christmas came undone , so [Jean]188-jean put [his]1953-he cue down too , and offered to fasten it . It is difficult to do oneself , so [I]0-i thanked [him]1953-he and handed [him]1953-he [my]0-i wrist ; [his]1953-he hands trembled so [he]1953-he could not do it . [I]0-i thought [he]1953-he was ill , and bent over [him]1953-he to see . Fortunately at that moment [we]1954-we happened to be at the one part of the table which ca n't be seen from [the other room]1955-the other room ; because [Jean]188-jean behaved so queerly — [I]0-i feel sure [Godmamma]189-godmamma would have been horrified . [He]1953-he did not worry about the bangle , but just began kissing [my]0-i hand ; simply dozens of kisses . [I]0-i pulled and pulled to try and get it away , but [he]1953-he would not let go , and kept murmuring that at last , at last , [he]1953-he was alone with [me]0-i ! Now was n't it too annoying , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i could not call out or make a fuss , because there would have been such a scene , and [you]1956-you would never think [a Frenchman]1957-a frenchman could be so strong . For although [I]0-i wrenched and dragged [I]0-i could not get [my]0-i hand away , and it was making [me]0-i crosser and crosser every minute . At last , when [he]1953-he began to kiss [my]0-i wrist , it tickled so [I]0-i was afraid [I]0-i should laugh , and then [he]1953-he would think [I]0-i was not serious ; so [I]0-i seized [my]0-i cue with the other hand , and just told [Jean]188-jean in a firm voice that if [he]1953-he did not let go that instant [I]0-i would break it over [his]1953-he head ! That stopped [him]1953-he ! [He]1953-he pulled [himself]1953-he together and said " Oh ! pardon , pardon , "[1953-he] and that [he]1953-he was awfully sorry , and that it was because [I]0-i was going away soon and [he]1953-he was mad . And that is what [I]0-i believe it was , [Mamma]132-mamma — a fit of some kind . Did [you]1958-you ever hear there was anything odd in [the Croixmare family]1959-the croixmare family ? Anyway it shows [foreigners]1740-foreigners are not to be trusted , for , even if [they]1740-foreigners have n't pistols ready to shoot [you]1958-you , [they]1740-foreigners are doing something queer like this . Indigestion ! Presently [he]1953-he took up [his]1953-he cue and began playing again , and [Héloise]190-héloise came in from [the salon]892-the salon . [She]190-héloise noticed [he]1953-he looked different and said at once , " Qu'avez - vous , [mon ami]3156-mon ami ? "[190-héloise] " Une mauvaise digestion , "[188-jean] replied [Jean]188-jean , and [he]1953-he went and drank sirop at the side - table . [I]0-i think [I]0-i should perhaps tell [Héloise]190-héloise what it really was , and warn [her]190-héloise to keep an eye on [him]1953-he , but then it might worry [her]190-héloise , and [he]1953-he may not have another attack for a long time . [No one]744-no one would suspect [him]1953-he of being cracked , [he]1953-he looks as quiet and respectable as the pony that mows [the lawn]771-the lawn . The post is starting , and [I]0-i must go to breakfast , so now good - bye , with love from [[your]1964-your affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . P.S.—The day after to - morrow there is to be a dinner - party here for [the fiancés]1966-the fiancés to meet . All the Tournelle party , and [[his]1953-he mother]494-his mother and [a couple of [cousins]711-cousins]1968-a couple of cousins will be [here]391-here , besides [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte and " [Antoine]207-antoine , "[243-château de croixmare] and [the Marquise]1013-the marquise , who are staying at [Tournelle]195-tournelle . [Château de Croixmare]243-château de croixmare , Tuesday , September 6th . [Victorine]191-victorine 's Indisposition Dearest Mamma,—The dinner for the fiancés came off last night . It was the first time [we]1972-we have had real evening dresses on since [I]0-i have been [here]391-here . [I]0-i wore the pink silk , and [Héloise]190-héloise was delighted with it , [she]190-héloise says [you]1974-you could not possibly improve upon the style [you]1974-you dress [me]0-i in — it is ideal for [a young girl]1402-a young girl . The day after [Jean]188-jean behaved so queerly , [he]1976-he was not at breakfast ; [he]1976-he went to [Paris]19-paris and [I]0-i did not see [him]1976-he until the evening , when [he]1976-he was as stolid and quiet as usual , so it must have been a fit , and perhaps [he]1976-he went up to [Paris]19-paris to see [[his]1976-he doctor]1977-his doctor . [Victorine]191-victorine had [her]191-victorine music lesson , and [I]0-i do n't know what could have upset [her]191-victorine ; but " [the Tug]3155-the tug , "[191-victorine] who always sits in [the room]401-the room with [her]191-victorine , came flying out , saying [Victorine]191-victorine was faint and [she]191-victorine must get [her]191-victorine a glass of water ; so [I]0-i ran into [the salle d'étude]1979-the salle d'étude to see if [I]0-i could help [her]191-victorine . There [she]191-victorine was flopping on the music - stool , with [Monsieur Dubois]262-monsieur dubois kneeling by [her]191-victorine , looking cross and reproachful , and just like [the villain in the pantomimes]1980-the villain in the pantomimes . [I]0-i heard [her]191-victorine say , " Cela doit être complètement oublié entre nous à présent que je vais être Marquise . "[191-victorine] [I]0-i do n't know what it was about , but if [she]191-victorine was telling [him]262-monsieur dubois [she]191-victorine would not be friendly with [him]262-monsieur dubois any more , [I]0-i do call it snobbish , do n't [you]1981-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? just because [she]191-victorine is going to be [a Marquise]1982-a marquise . It is n't as if [he]262-monsieur dubois was [an English Marquis]1983-an english marquis even , like [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , that would be of some importance — but a trumpery French title , without any land or money , it is ridiculous . Of course , here [no one]744-no one has [[his]744-no one own land]1985-his own land really since the Revolution , [I]0-i mean like " [Tournelle]195-tournelle , "[0-i] [they]1986-they only call [the new house that]1987-the new house that ; [I]0-i believe the real " Tournelle "[1986-they] is down in [Touraine]71-touraine somewhere and belongs to [some one else]1197-some one else now . This is [Château de Croixmare]243-château de croixmare , but then [[Jean]188-jean 's great - grandfather]1989-jean 's great - grandfather bought it back again . Now [I]0-i have wandered from what [I]0-i was telling [you]1990-you — oh ! yes , about [Victorine]191-victorine and [M. Dubois]266-m. dubois . [He]266-m. dubois got up from [his]266-m. dubois knees when [he]266-m. dubois saw [me]0-i , and began fanning [her]191-victorine , while [she]191-victorine flopped more than ever , but [I]0-i do n't think [she]191-victorine felt very faint , [her]191-victorine face was so red . And when " [the Tug]3155-the tug "[1991-they] returned with the water [I]0-i came away , as [they]1991-they both looked as if [they]1991-they wanted to murder [me]0-i . The excitement had made [Monsieur Dubois]262-monsieur dubois ' collar quite give way , and [he]266-m. dubois looked [a dirtier and more pitiable object]1992-a dirtier and more pitiable object than usual . The " Dîner des Fiançailles "[1992-a dirtier and more pitiable object] Such an affair the " Dîner des fiançailles ! "[191-victorine] [Victorine]191-victorine wore a pink dress too , with horrid bunches of daisies on [her]191-victorine shoulders and in [her]191-victorine hair ; and , as that is dark and greasy , and dragged off [her]191-victorine face , and done in the tightest twist at the top , it does not look a suitable place for daisies to be sprouting from . [I]0-i hate things in the hair anyway , do n't [you]1993-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? However [she]191-victorine was delighted with [herself]191-victorine , so it was all right . [We]1994-we waited in [the big salon]1240-the big salon , standing behind [Godmamma]189-godmamma to receive [the company]1996-the company . First arrived [the old Baron]962-the old baron and [the Baronne]1036-the baronne , and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis and [[his]1341-the marquis mother]494-his mother . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis kissed [Victorine]191-victorine 's hand as well as [Godmamma]189-godmamma 's and [Héloise]190-héloise 's , and [you]1993-you should have seen [her]191-victorine bridling ! When [he]1341-the marquis got to [me]0-i [he]1341-the marquis made the stiffest bow ; and just then [the Comte]909-the comte and [Comtesse de Tournelle]195-tournelle , [the Marquise de Vermandoise]233-the marquise de vermandoise , and [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte were announced , and immediately following , " [Antoine]207-antoine "[214-the vicomte] and [two cousins of [Godmamma]189-godmamma 's]2003-two cousins of godmamma 's . To finish the party there were a batch of [[the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's relations , who had come specially from [Paris]19-paris]2005-the marquis 's relations , who had come specially from paris . [We]2006-we were spared [Yolande]193-yolande and [Marie]149-aunt maria , who usually sit up to dinner with [their]2007-their German bonne , and eat everything that [they]2007-their should n't , and then scream in the night . There was a buzz of conversation , and [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte talked to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i could not help hearing what [the Marquis]1341-the marquis said to [Victorine]191-victorine — " Vous aimez la bicyclette , mademoiselle ? "[1341-the marquis] " Oui , [monsieur]3146-monsieur . "[1341-the marquis] " Moi j'aime mieux l'automobile . "[1341-the marquis] " Mais il y a toujours de la poussière ! "[1341-the marquis] And [they]2010-they are going to be married in a month ! [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte kept bending over [me]0-i and looking silly , and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis fidgeted so that [he]1341-the marquis could not go on talking to [Victorine]191-victorine — one eye was always fixed on [us]2006-we . That seemed to please [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte , for [he]1341-the marquis got more and more empressé , and [I]0-i could not help laughing in return . At dinner [he]1341-the marquis took in [Mme . de Vermandoise]267-mme . de vermandoise , but sat next [me]0-i , and on [my]0-i other hand was one of [the cousins]2012-the cousins , [a harmless idiot]2013-a harmless idiot too timid to speak much , and with all kinds of horrid baby fluffs growing on [his]2013-a harmless idiot face . If [men]725-men are to wear beards ( which [I]0-i should forbid if [I]0-i were [the Queen]1564-the queen ) [they]725-men ought to be shut up till [they]725-men are really grown . A Contretemps Opposite to [us]2006-we were [Victorine]191-victorine and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , and [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [the Baron]1485-the baron , and [Jean]188-jean and [[the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's mother]1483-the marquis 's mother . [They]725-men did look a dull lot , and [[the Marquis]252-the marquis 's mother]1483-the marquis 's mother eats worst of all ! [We]2006-we had the greatest fun at [our]2006-we side , [Mme]267-mme . de vermandoise . [de Vermandoise]267-mme . de vermandoise was delicious with gaiety , [the Comte]909-the comte was on [her]1483-the marquis 's mother other hand , and [we]2006-we four never stopped joking and laughing the whole of dinner . It was such a big party , so the conversation could not be quite as general as usual . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis got gloomier and gloomier as time went on . [I]0-i could not look up that [I]0-i did not find [his]1341-the marquis angry eyes fixed on [me]0-i . Even [Victorine]191-victorine 's aggressive joy at having caught [him]1341-the marquis was damped when [she]191-victorine could not get [him]1341-the marquis to pay attention to what [she]191-victorine was saying . At last when [he]1341-the marquis was straining [his]1341-the marquis ears to try and hear [my]0-i conversation with [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte , [she]191-victorine got absolutely exasperated with [him]1341-the marquis , and addressed a question to [him]1341-the marquis in a loud , sharp voice . It made [him]1341-the marquis jump so that [he]1341-the marquis bounced round in [his]1341-the marquis seat ; and as [she]191-victorine had lowered [her]191-victorine head to put the piece of bécassine — which had been poised on [her]191-victorine fork while [she]191-victorine spoke — into [her]191-victorine mouth , [his]1341-the marquis jumping round , and [her]191-victorine raising [her]191-victorine head suddenly , made [her]191-victorine daisies catch on [his]1341-the marquis beard ; and [you]2024-you never saw such a funny sight , [Mamma]564-mamma ! It was a nasty little wired dewdrop that got fixed in poor Monsieur [de Beaupré]264-the marquise de beaupré 's fur , and there they were : [she]191-victorine still grasping [her]191-victorine fork and [he]1341-the marquis looking ready to eat [her]191-victorine with annoyance . [Their]2026-their two heads were fastened together , and there [they]2026-their would have remained , only [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte ( who always goes everywhere with [the Baronne]197-the baronne ) came to the rescue , and untangled [them]2026-their . But it hurt [the Marquis]1341-the marquis very much , as some of the hairs had to be pulled out , and it did not mend [matters Hippolyte]204-hippolyte muttering , " Cela doit être que [Monsieur le Marquis doit faire plus attention à l'affaire qu'il a en main]3160-monsieur le marquis doit faire plus attention à l'affaire qu'il a en main , s'il désire garder ses cheveux intacts . "[204-hippolyte] [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte 's Proposal The affair made quite a commotion at the table , and [Victorine]191-victorine so nearly cried with rage that [[the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's mother]1483-the marquis 's mother had to give [her]191-victorine smelling salts . [Mme . de Vermandoise]267-mme . de vermandoise was overcome with laughter , and [her]191-victorine tongue was hardly ever out of [her]191-victorine gap , while [the Marquis]1341-the marquis sat , white with fury . When [we]2031-we left the table , arm - in - arm , things cleared up , and , while [we]2031-we were alone when [the men]450-the men went back to smoke , [Victorine]191-victorine was made to " play something , "[191-victorine] and [she]191-victorine really plays very well . It was so stiflingly hot that at last [some one]717-some one — [the Comtesse]195-tournelle , [I]0-i believe — asked to have the windows opened on to [the terrace]545-the terrace . There was a fair - sized moon , and [we]2031-we all went out there , even [Godmamma]189-godmamma for a few moments . [The men]450-the men came out of the smoking - room windows and joined [us]2031-we , and for the first time since [I]0-i have been in [France]10-france [we]2031-we talked to [the persons [we]2031-we wanted to]2036-the persons we wanted to , without either shouting across [some one else or making a general conversation]2037-some one else or making a general conversation . " [Antoine]207-antoine "[190-héloise] and [Héloise]190-héloise leant over the balustrade ; [the Comte]909-the comte and [the Marquise]1013-the marquise stayed by the window , while [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte whispered to [me]0-i by the steps ; and [Victorine]191-victorine and [[her]191-victorine Marquis]2041-her marquis stood like two wax figures , not saying a word , by the orange trees . [I]0-i do n't know whether it was owing to the moon or not , but [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte did say such a lot of charming things to [me]0-i . [He]214-the vicomte said [he]214-the vicomte loved [me]0-i , and would [I]0-i marry [him]214-the vicomte ; [he]214-the vicomte would arrange it all , as fortunately [he]214-the vicomte has [no parents]2042-no parents to consult . [I]0-i seem to be getting quite used to proposals now , because it did not excite [me]0-i in the least . But [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i want to marry [any one]536-any one yet , [Mamma]132-mamma ; so [I]0-i told [him]214-the vicomte [you]214-the vicomte would never let [me]0-i marry [a Frenchman]1957-a frenchman , and [he]214-the vicomte had better forget all about [me]0-i . [He]214-the vicomte said as much about love as [he]214-the vicomte could in the ten minutes [we]2045-we were left talking together , and put it so nicely — not a bit that violent want - to - eat - one - up - way [the Marquis]1341-the marquis has . [I]0-i felt once or twice quite inclined to say yes , if only it had been an affair of a week ; but unfortunately , even in [France]10-france , [you]214-the vicomte have to stay on with [people]411-people longer than that , and that is the part [I]0-i could not have managed . [I]0-i made [him]214-the vicomte understand at last that [I]0-i really meant not to have [him]214-the vicomte , and [he]214-the vicomte was very miserable . But [you]214-the vicomte ca n't tear [your]214-the vicomte hair or cry , with [every one]428-every one looking on , and , as it all had to be done in a voice as if [one]658-one was talking about the weather , [he]214-the vicomte did not show much . Only [he]214-the vicomte looked very white when [we]2045-we came into the lights again , but [he]214-the vicomte whispered as [he]214-the vicomte said good - night that [he]214-the vicomte did not despair ; [he]214-the vicomte would always love [me]0-i , and when [I]0-i married [some one else]1197-some one else [his]214-the vicomte day would come , which [I]0-i did not think kind of [him]214-the vicomte , as [I]0-i do n't want to be [a widow]2051-a widow . [The Marquis]252-the marquis had not a chance to say a word to [me]0-i ; [he]252-the marquis tried often , but [I]0-i avoided [him]252-the marquis , [he]252-the marquis looked so out of temper . [I]0-i am sure it would have been something disagreeable . [He]252-the marquis and [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte nearly came to blows going out of the door , just over a silly thing like the Vicomte 's sword knocking against [the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's boot . [I]0-i hope [they]2054-they wo n't really fight . When [they]2054-they had all gone , and [we]2055-we were going up to bed , [I]0-i thought [Jean]188-jean looked as if [his]252-the marquis fit was coming on again , so [I]0-i bolted into [[my]0-i room]631-my room ; and on the whole [I]0-i am rather glad to be coming back to [England]25-england on Thursday . To - day [we]2055-we go over to [Tournelle]195-tournelle , a visit of ceremony for [me]0-i to say good - bye , and [they]2054-they are [all dear people]2057-all dear people [there]398-there , and [I]0-i shall always hope to see [them]2054-they again.—Now good - bye , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma , with love from [[your]1162-dear mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . P.S.—I wish [his]2061-his hair was n't cut en brosse . But of course [one]658-one could n't marry [a Frenchman]1957-a frenchman anyway . Château de [Croixmare]22-croixmare , Wednesday , September 7th . [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte 's Testimonial [Dearest Mamma,—It]268-dearest mamma,—it was really quite sad saying good - bye to [all the people at [Tournelle]195-tournelle]2064-all the people at tournelle . [The Baronne]197-the baronne almost wept over [me]0-i , and said that [they]2054-they would be dreadfully dull without [me]0-i . [They]2054-they all kissed [me]0-i on both cheeks , and even [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte as [he]204-hippolyte put [us]2065-us into [the carriage]699-the carriage after [I]0-i tipped [him]204-hippolyte , remarked , " Mieux vaut épouser un français et rester toujours chez nous , vous êtes trop belle demoiselle pour le brouillard d'Angleterre ! "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder after all if [the Marquis]1341-the marquis will ever marry [Victorine]191-victorine , as it seems , when [he]1341-the marquis got back last night , [he]1341-the marquis was in such a temper that [he]1341-the marquis made a scene with [the Baronne]197-the baronne and [[his]1341-the marquis mother]494-his mother . [He]1341-the marquis said that [Victorine]191-victorine made [him]1341-the marquis look ridiculous , that [she]191-victorine was unappetising , without wit , and ugly enough to have tranquillised [St. Anthony]269-st. anthony at [his]1341-the marquis worst moment of temptation — whatever that means . ( [I]0-i overheard [the Baronne]197-the baronne tell all this to [Héloise]190-héloise while [the old Baron]962-the old baron was making [me]0-i compliments in [his]962-the old baron fearful English . ) [The Marquis]1341-the marquis stamped [his]1341-the marquis foot , and finally , bursting into tears , announced that [he]1341-the marquis would go to [Paris]19-paris , back to [Adèle]72-adèle — whoever [she]72-adèle is — and find consolation ! So off [he]1341-the marquis started this morning the first thing . What [a man]496-a man , [Mamma]132-mamma ! crying like [a child]403-a child ! [[His]1341-the marquis mother]494-his mother and [the Baronne]197-the baronne are very anxious about [him]1341-the marquis , as if [he]1341-the marquis really decides to " jeter le manche après la cognée , "[197-the baronne] who is to pay [his]1341-the marquis debts ! [The Baronne]197-the baronne also said , that if " [Elisabet]270-elisabet "[197-the baronne] ( that 's [me]0-i ) had only been married , it would have been all a simple matter ; because then there would be no cause for [him]1341-the marquis to despair , and [he]1341-the marquis would not have occupied [himself]1341-the marquis about an ordinary subject , like who [they]2074-they married [him]1341-the marquis to in the meantime . But , as it is , the contrast between [us]2075-us — [Victorine]191-victorine and [me]0-i — whom [he]1341-the marquis can not obtain — is too great , and the sooner [I]0-i am out of [his]1341-the marquis sight the better ! It does sound all Greek , does n't it to [you]2076-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [I]0-i repeat it just as [the Baronne]197-the baronne said it . Etiquette for the Fiancés [We]2075-us went into [the garden]870-the garden presently , and [the Marquise]1013-the marquise and [the Comte]909-the comte and [I]0-i walked together ; [she]2080-she had not got over the affair at dinner , and did nothing but laugh and joke about it . [She]2080-she said that [Victorine]191-victorine at all events will give [the Marquis]1341-the marquis no anxieties in the future , but [she]2080-she is sure [he]1341-the marquis will have to " se griser "[2080-she] to get through the wedding . Fortunately [Victorine]191-victorine was not with [us]2075-us , as [Godmamma]189-godmamma was too tired to accompany [her]191-victorine ; it would not have been proper for [her]191-victorine to come with only [[her]191-victorine brother and sister - in - law]2082-her brother and sister - in - law , as [[her]191-victorine fiancé]2083-her fiancé , being supposed to be at [Tournelle]195-tournelle , [she]191-victorine might have had private conversation with [him]1341-the marquis not under [Godmamma]189-godmamma 's eye ! Oh ! must n't it be awful to be French ! [Héloise]190-héloise says it is n't so bad as this in the smart set in [Paris]19-paris ; [they]2084-they speak to [one another]807-one another there quite a lot before getting married , and do almost English things , but [Godmamma]189-godmamma is of the old school . Before [we]2075-us left , [the Marquis]1341-the marquis turned up , [he]1341-the marquis looked thoroughly worn out and as piano as a beaten dog . [He]1341-the marquis was awfully polite to [Jean]188-jean and [Héloise]190-héloise , and hardly looked at [me]0-i , but as [I]0-i did not want to leave with [him]1341-the marquis still feeling cross with [me]0-i , [I]0-i got the chance at last to tell [him]1341-the marquis [I]0-i hoped [he]1341-the marquis would be happy , and to congratulate [him]1341-the marquis . [He]1341-the marquis bowed deeply and thanked [me]0-i , and then under [his]1341-the marquis breath , as [he]1341-the marquis stooped to pick up a flower [I]0-i had dropped , [he]1341-the marquis said , " Vous avez brisé mon coeur , et cela m'est égal ce qui arrive,"—but[1341-the marquis] [I]0-i do n't believe it , [Mamma]132-mamma , [he]1341-the marquis has not got a heart to break , [he]1341-the marquis is only [a silly doll]2087-a silly doll and worthy of [Victorine]191-victorine . [I]0-i saw [the Baronne]197-the baronne talking to [him]1341-the marquis seriously while [we]2088-we were having " five o'clock ; "[197-the baronne] and just as [we]2088-we were starting , [she]197-the baronne came up and said low to [Héloise]190-héloise , who was beside [me]0-i , " J'espère que tout va bien , Adèle l'a remplacé , et ne veut plus de lui ! Oh ! la bonne fille ! "[197-the baronne] So whoever " Adèle "[197-the baronne] is , [I]0-i suppose [she]197-the baronne has done [Victorine]191-victorine a good turn . [I]0-i asked [Héloise]190-héloise on [our]2088-we way [home]390-home if " Adèle "[190-héloise] was [a relation of [the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's]2090-a relation of the marquis 's , and [she]190-héloise went into fits of laughter and said , " Oui , [une]3161-une très proche , "[190-héloise] but [I]0-i ca n't see anything to laugh at , can [you]0-i , [Mamma]564-mamma ? A Country Dinner Party In the evening there was a ghastly dinner party at [Croixmare]22-croixmare . [Three sets of [provincial families]2094-provincial families]2093-three sets of provincial families . [They]2093-three sets of provincial families are really awful these entertainments , and so different to [English ones]2095-english ones ! [Nobody]1428-nobody bothers about even numbers . [You]0-i feel obliged to ask the X 's , [the Y]271-the y 's , and [the Z]272-the z 's from duty , and so [you]0-i do . It does n't in the least matter if [they]2093-three sets of provincial families are mostly [females]2097-females ; [you]0-i have to ask [the family]1337-the family , because if [the daughters]2099-the daughters are grown up [they]2099-the daughters ca n't be left at [home]390-home alone — [they]2099-the daughters would be getting into mischief . This is the kind of assortment that arrives : [Papa X]273-papa x , [Mamma X]132-mamma , and [two girl X'es]2101-two girl x'es ; [Papa Y]271-the y , [Mamma Y]274-mamma y , and [Master]2102-master and [Miss Y]275-miss y ; [Papa Z]272-the z , [Mamma Z]132-mamma , [Aunt Z]277-aunt z , and [Mdlle]260-mdlle . blanc . Z — such a party ! [Godmamma]189-godmamma just revels in these frumps ; [they]2103-they make [Héloise]190-héloise furious , and the airs of [Victorine]191-victorine , [her]191-victorine coyness and giggling , nearly drove [me]0-i wild . [I]0-i sat next to [Monsieur Y]278-monsieur y , and although [he]278-monsieur y is [a Baron of very old family]2104-a baron of very old family [he]278-monsieur y ate like a pig . The food was extraordinarily good , but the proof of good service here is to get the whole dinner — of [I]0-i do n't know how many courses — over under the hour . So [one]658-one has no sooner swallowed a mouthful , when [one]658-one 's plate is snatched away , and [one]658-one begins to devour something else . But with [this awful man]2108-this awful man gobbling at [my]0-i side , and [those foolish girls]2109-those foolish girls giggling beyond , even the forty minutes seemed ages . Afterwards in [the salon]892-the salon [the " jeunes filles "]3162-the " jeunes filles "[132-mamma] were sent to talk at the other side of [the room]401-the room , supervised by " [the Tug]3155-the tug , "[132-mamma] who did not dine , but was in waiting . If [you]2112-you had heard [their]2109-those foolish girls conversation , [Mamma]132-mamma ! It was worse than the day [the two]444-the two came to breakfast . Just one endless string of questions to [Victorine]191-victorine about [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , with giggles over possibilities of [their]2109-those foolish girls own fiançailles ! It is so extraordinary that [they]2109-those foolish girls can ever turn into [witty , fascinating women like [Héloise]190-héloise and [the Marquise]1013-the marquise]2115-witty , fascinating women like héloise and the marquise . Of course , these are just [provincial nobodies , whom [Héloise]190-héloise would not dream of knowing in [Paris]19-paris]2117-provincial nobodies , whom héloise would not dream of knowing in paris ; perhaps [the girls there]2118-the girls there are better . [A Cure for a Fit Victorine]191-victorine told [them]2109-those foolish girls [the Marquis]1341-the marquis was " Beau comme l'Archange [Michel]279-michel , "[1341-the marquis] and had for [her]191-victorine " une brûlante dévotion ! "[191-victorine] What will [she]191-victorine say if after all [he]1341-the marquis refuses to come to the scratch ! [Jean]188-jean is to accompany [Agnès]115-agnès and [me]0-i up to [Paris]19-paris to - morrow to see [us]2120-us safely off to [Dieppe]23-dieppe . [I]0-i hope [he]1341-the marquis wo n't have another fit in [the train]393-the train , [I]0-i shall tell [Agnès]115-agnès to take plenty of salts and brandy in [her]115-agnès bag , and a bottle of soda water , because [I]0-i have always heard that a sudden shock is best for [people in fits]2122-people in fits , and one could pop the soda water over [him]1341-the marquis if the worst came to the worst.—Now , good - night , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma , [[your]1162-dear mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . P.S.—An awful wind is blowing . [I]0-i hope [I]0-i sha n't be drowned crossing [the Channel.—E. Château de Croixmare]2125-the channel.—e. château de croixmare , Thursday night . The Emotion of [the Marquis]1341-the marquis Dearest [Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i hope [you]1162-dear mamma got the telegram all right to - day saying [I]0-i would not leave . The storm became really so fearful [they]2127-they would not hear of [my]0-i starting , and as it has turned out [I]0-i am very glad , for to - night [we]2128-we dined at [Tournelle]195-tournelle to celebrate [the Baronne]197-the baronne 's birthday , and [we]2128-we had such an amusing time . [All the usual lot]2129-all the usual lot were [there]398-there , as well as [those two officers who came to [the Foire]59-the foire with [us]2128-we , and about three or four more people from [Paris]19-paris]2131-those two officers who came to the foire with us , and about three or four more people from paris , so [we]2128-we were quite a large party . [Everybody]404-everybody gave [the Baronne]197-the baronne a present , and such baskets of flowers as [she]197-the baronne had in [the salon]892-the salon ! " Assez pour tourner la tête , "[204-hippolyte] as [Hippolyte]204-hippolyte said . [The Baronne]1036-the baronne was dressed in pale mauve and looked lovely , only such a funny thing happened at dinner . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte , who sat next to [her]1036-the baronne , made [her]1036-the baronne laugh dreadfully , just as [she]1036-the baronne was eating [her]1036-the baronne soup , and [she]1036-the baronne choked , and suddenly one cheek quite fell in , while the other stuck out as if a potato was in it . [One]658-one could not think what had happened ; but it appears that [she]1036-the baronne wears " plumpers , "[1036-the baronne] of a kind of red guttapercha , to keep [her]1036-the baronne face nice and round , and in choking the right cheek 's one got jerked across into the left cheek , and that is how [she]1036-the baronne got the toothachy look . Must n't it be a bother , [Mamma]132-mamma , to have to do all that ? but [the Baronne]1036-the baronne is such [a dear]1391-a dear that [one]658-one did not even laugh . [The Marquis]1341-the marquis had to sit by [Victorine]191-victorine , and [I]0-i saw [him]1341-the marquis looking at the pink rosebuds in [her]191-victorine hair with a cautious eye ; and [he]1341-the marquis sat up as straight as anything in case [she]191-victorine should get caught in [him]1341-the marquis again . But it is all right , [he]1341-the marquis means to go through with it — [the Baronne]1036-the baronne told [Héloise]190-héloise directly [we]2141-we got [there]398-there . So [I]0-i thought , as it was finally settled , there would be no harm in talking to [him]1341-the marquis a little . [He]1341-the marquis looked at [me]0-i at dinner , [I]0-i smiled , and it was so quaint , [Mamma]132-mamma , [his]1341-the marquis whole face seemed to flush until [his]1341-the marquis forehead was even pink , with the veins showing at the side . [He]1341-the marquis lifted [his]1341-the marquis champagne glass and kissed the edge of it , and bowed to [me]0-i , and [no one]744-no one saw but [the Comte]196-the comte , and [he]1341-the marquis went into a chuckle of laughter , as [he]1341-the marquis whispered to [me]0-i that if [Victorine]191-victorine had seen [she]191-victorine would certainly tear [my]0-i eyes out on the way [home]390-home . [Elizabeth Sandwiched]113-elizabeth Afterwards , in [the salon]892-the salon , [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte managed to stand behind [me]0-i while [I]0-i was talking to [the old Baron]962-the old baron , and [he]965-the vicomte said in a low voice : Why had [I]0-i come back ? [He]1341-the marquis was at peace waiting till [his]1341-the marquis day came , and [here]391-here [I]0-i had upset everything , and [he]1341-the marquis should have to go through endless more restless nights ! [I]0-i said that [I]0-i was sorry the storm had prevented [my]0-i starting , especially as [I]0-i was unwelcome . So [he]1341-the marquis threw prudence to the winds , and said out loud before [the Baron]1485-the baron that [I]0-i knew it was not that , and [he]1341-the marquis looked so devoted and distressed that [the dear old Baron]198-the baron de frémond patted [him]1341-the marquis on the back , and turning away said , " [Mon brave Gaston]280-mon brave gaston , moi aussi j'étais jeune une fois . "[1341-the marquis] And [he]1341-the marquis left [us]2150-us alone by the window , while [he]1341-the marquis stood a sort of sentry in front . [The Vicomte]214-the vicomte did whisper a lot of things ; [he]214-the vicomte said just for one evening [I]0-i might make [him]1341-the marquis happy and pretend [I]0-i loved [him]1341-the marquis , and let [him]1341-the marquis call [me]0-i " chérie . "[1341-the marquis] So [I]0-i said " all right ; "[0-i] [I]0-i did not think it could matter , as [I]0-i am coming [home]390-home to - morrow , [Mamma]564-mamma , and shall probably never see [him]1341-the marquis again , and [you]2153-you said [one]658-one ought always to be kind - hearted and do little things for [people]411-people . When [I]0-i said " all right , "[0-i] [his]1341-the marquis forehead got pink , and the veins showed just like [the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's had done at dinner , and [he]1341-the marquis said , " Chérie — ma chérie , [ma bien]3164-ma bien - aimée "[1341-the marquis] in such a voice ! It made [me]0-i feel quite as if [I]0-i wanted to listen to some more , only , unfortunately at that moment , [Godmamma]189-godmamma came up ; [she]189-godmamma brushed [the Baron]1485-the baron aside , and said [I]0-i should certainly catch cold by the window , and must come with [her]189-godmamma , while [she]189-godmamma annihilated [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte with a look . [There]398-there [I]0-i was , taken off to a sofa at the other side of [the room]401-the room , and stuffed down between [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [[the Marquis]1341-the marquis 's mother]1483-the marquis 's mother . [You]2162-you can think [I]0-i was cross . However , [I]0-i paid [her]189-godmamma out , for [I]0-i just looked at [the Marquis]1341-the marquis , who was seated by [his]1341-the marquis Victorine almost silent and like a dummy ( [they]2164-they are allowed to talk together now , as long as [they]2164-they are not alone in [the room]401-the room ) . It made [him]1341-the marquis fidget so , [he]1341-the marquis could not attend to what [she]189-godmamma was saying . And when finally [he]1341-the marquis got up and came over to [us]2166-us and said , had [I]0-i seen the new " Nattier "[1341-the marquis] [the Comte]909-the comte had just bought , which was in [the other salon]2168-the other salon , and would [I]0-i come and look at it?—I think [Godmamma]189-godmamma wished [she]189-godmamma had left [me]0-i safe with [the Vicomte]214-the vicomte . [She]189-godmamma could not say anything , as [half the party]2169-half the party had already gone to look at the picture , so [I]0-i got up at once and went with [him]1341-the marquis . [[His]1341-the marquis mother]494-his mother is years older than [the Baronne]197-the baronne , and not a bit gay like [her]494-his mother . [I]0-i saw [them]2171-them — [her]494-his mother and [Godmamma]189-godmamma — nodding [their]2171-them heads anxiously as [we]2172-we left ; no doubt [they]2171-them were deploring the bad bringing - up of [the English]211-the english . The Fiancés Together [The Marquis]252-the marquis said it was awful what [he]252-the marquis was going through ; and when the dancing began presently would [I]0-i give [him]252-the marquis the first valse ? [I]0-i said Certainly , and by that time [we]2172-we were in [the other salon]2168-the other salon , and beside [the Marquise]1013-the marquise . [She]494-his mother smiled [her]494-his mother dear little smile , which always seems to mock at everything , and put [her]494-his mother tongue into [her]494-his mother gap and whispered : " Quelle comédie ! c'est bien petite espiègle , amusez - vous ! "[494-his mother] And so [I]0-i did ! [I]0-i ca n't tell [you]494-his mother what fun it was , [Mamma]132-mamma . [I]0-i was in wild spirits , and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis answered back , and [we]2172-we were as gay as larks , until [I]0-i overheard [[the Marquis]252-the marquis 's mother]1483-the marquis 's mother , who had followed [us]2172-we , say to [him]252-the marquis , in an acid voice , that [he]252-the marquis seemed to have forgotten that it was arranged for [him]252-the marquis to give [Victorine]191-victorine the engagement ring that evening and say a few appropriate words to [her]191-victorine , and [he]252-the marquis must take [her]191-victorine to see the flowers in [the conservatory]2177-the conservatory , and get it over there . So off [he]252-the marquis had to go , looking black and peevish , and supervised by [the two mothers]2178-the two mothers — who stood at the risk of catching [their]2178-the two mothers deaths of cold by the door — [he]252-the marquis and [Victorine]191-victorine went arm - in - arm into [the conservatory]2177-the conservatory , and disappeared behind some pots of palms . It appears [Mme . de Vermandoise]267-mme . de vermandoise and [the Comte]909-the comte were in [there]398-there too , and saw what happened , and [she]191-victorine told [Héloise]190-héloise and [me]0-i afterwards . [The fiancés]1966-the fiancés came and stood quite close to [them]1966-the fiancés , with only a bank of flowers between ; and [they]1966-the fiancés said the palms were pretty and were growing very tall , and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis coughed , and [Victorine]191-victorine began scrabbling with [her]191-victorine toes on the marble floor in that irritating way [she]191-victorine has , and [they]1966-the fiancés neither of [them]1966-the fiancés spoke . At last [the Marquis]1341-the marquis dashed at it , and said , as [she]191-victorine already knew , [[their]1966-the fiancés parents]2185-their parents had arranged [they]1966-the fiancés should marry , and [he]1341-the marquis hoped [he]1341-the marquis would make [her]191-victorine happy . At that moment the piano struck up very loud in [the salon]892-the salon , and prevented [Victorine]191-victorine from quite catching what [he]1341-the marquis said ; [he]1341-the marquis got very red and repeated it again , but [he]1341-the marquis mumbled so [she]191-victorine still was not sure , and had to say " Pardon ? "[1341-the marquis] for the second time . That upset [the Marquis]1341-the marquis to such a point that [he]1341-the marquis said " Damn , "[1341-the marquis] which is the only English word [he]1341-the marquis knows , and when [Victorine]191-victorine looked horribly surprised , [he]1341-the marquis dived into [his]1341-the marquis waistcoat pocket and fished out the ring . Then [he]1341-the marquis took [her]191-victorine hand , pulled off [her]191-victorine glove backwards , and pushed it on to the first finger [he]1341-the marquis came to , which happened to be the middle one ! [He]1341-the marquis just said [he]1341-the marquis hoped [she]191-victorine would wear it for [his]1341-the marquis sake ; and when [she]191-victorine exclaimed , " Mais , [monsieur]3146-monsieur ! ce n'est pas sur ce doigt que vous devez mettre la bague ! "[191-victorine] [he]1341-the marquis hardly waited to apologise or put it right before [he]1341-the marquis dragged [her]191-victorine back to [the salon]892-the salon and deposited [her]191-victorine with [the anxious mothers]2189-the anxious mothers ! [The Baronne]197-the baronne 's Diplomacy Mme . [de Vermandoise]267-mme . de vermandoise said [she]191-victorine and [the Comte]909-the comte nearly had a fit to keep [themselves]2191-themselves from laughing out loud . Was n't it too comic , [Mamma]564-mamma ? How [I]0-i should hate to be betrothed like that ! However , [Victorine]191-victorine seems to think half a loaf is better than no bread , for [she]191-victorine kept [her]191-victorine glove off all the rest of the evening , and looked at [her]191-victorine ring with conscious pride . It is a very nice one , a ruby and a pearl heart connected by a diamond [Marquis]252-the marquis 's coronet . [They]2193-they ought to have added a money - bag representing the dot , and then the symbol would have been complete . [We]2194-we had begun to dance when [they]2193-they got back , and , as [the Marquis]1341-the marquis had not been there to claim [me]0-i , [I]0-i was valsing with [Jean]188-jean . [The Baronne]1036-the baronne kept [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte close to [her]1036-the baronne side all the rest of the evening — [she]1036-the baronne told [me]0-i , as [she]1036-the baronne kissed [me]0-i in saying good - bye , that [she]1036-the baronne had done it for peace sake , as [she]1036-the baronne knew [he]1341-the marquis and [the Marquis]1341-the marquis would have had a quarrel otherwise , [they]2193-they were both so madly in love with [me]0-i . " Petite embrouillante d'heureuses familles va ! "[1036-the baronne] [she]1036-the baronne said—"Mais je t'aime bien quand même!"—She[2199-a darling] is [a darling]2199-a darling , [the Baronne]197-the baronne ! [The Marquis]1341-the marquis stood there glowering , and never offered to dance with [Victorine]191-victorine ; [she]191-victorine must have been cross ! [We]2201-we had another farewell all round when the valse was over — [Godmamma]189-godmamma would not stay for another , and even " [Antoine]207-antoine "[1341-the marquis] seemed sorry to say " Adieu . "[909-the comte] " Dépêchez - vous de vous marier , "[1341-the marquis] [he]1341-the marquis said , " et ensuite revenez auprès de nous . J'ai envie de vous faire la cour , mais vous êtes beaucoup trop dangereuse pour le moment . "[1341-the marquis] " Ça , c'est vrai ! "[909-the comte] said [the Comte]909-the comte and [Jean]188-jean together , and [every one]428-every one laughed . Now that the betrothal ring is really on [Victorine]191-victorine 's finger , and [Héloise]190-héloise knows [she]191-victorine will be got off , [she]191-victorine does not mind a bit about [the Marquis]1341-the marquis looking at [me]0-i . [She]191-victorine kept laughing to [herself]191-victorine over it all the way [home]390-home ; [she]191-victorine really detests [Victorine]191-victorine . [Godmamma]189-godmamma and [the bride - elect]2206-the bride - elect hardly spoke a word , and [I]0-i am sure if a perfect hurricane blows to - morrow , [they]2207-they wo n't suggest [my]0-i waiting another day , so [I]0-i shall be glad to be off . Good - night , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma ; [you]1162-dear mamma will see [me]0-i almost as soon as [you]1162-dear mamma get this , as [I]0-i shall only sleep the night in [London]5-london at Aunt Mary's.—With love from [[your]1162-dear mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . Retby , September 20th . [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia 's Pets Dearest Mamma,—You might have prepared [me]0-i for what [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia looks like , because when [I]0-i arrived yesterday and was shown into [[her]281-lady theodosia boudoir]2210-her boudoir , and found [her]281-lady theodosia lying on the sofa , covered with dogs and cats , [I]0-i as nearly as possible laughed out loud , and it would have been so rude . [She]281-lady theodosia had evidently been asleep , and it looked like a mountain having an earthquake when [she]281-lady theodosia got up , and animals rolled off [her]281-lady theodosia in all directions . [A poodle]2211-a poodle , [two fox terriers]2212-two fox terriers , a toy Spitz , and a cat and kitten , had all been sleeping in the nooks [her]281-lady theodosia outline makes . [They]2213-they all barked in different keys , and between saying , " Down , [Hector]282-hector ! "[2213-they] " Quiet , Fluff ! "[2213-they] " Hush , hush , [Fanny]283-fanny ! "[2213-they] " Did [um]3166-um know it was [a stranger]3167-a stranger ? "[2213-they] etc . , etc . , [she]281-lady theodosia got in that [she]281-lady theodosia was glad to see [me]0-i , and hoped [you]2214-you were better . When [she]281-lady theodosia stands up [she]281-lady theodosia is colossal ! [Her]281-lady theodosia body dressed in the last fashion , and then the queerest face with no neck , and lemon - coloured hair parted down the middle , and not matching a bit with the chignon of thick plaits at the back . It looks as if it were strapped on with a black velvet band that comes across [her]281-lady theodosia forehead , like in the pictures on the nursery screen at [home]390-home that [the Great - aunts]2216-the great - aunts made when [they]2216-the great - aunts were [children]3105-children . [She]281-lady theodosia seems as kind as possible , and has the fattest wheezy voice . " [Clever Darlings]284-clever darlings "[281-lady theodosia] [[Her]281-lady theodosia room]767-her room is appalling ; [it]767-her room is full of Early Victorian furniture , and horrid alabaster statuette things , under glass cases , and then a few modern armchairs covered in gorgeous brocade , but it is all clawed by the cats , and soiled by the dogs ' muddy feet , and [you]2214-you are unable to make up [your]2214-you mind where it will be safe to sit . When tea came in , which it did immediately , [you]2214-you ca n't think what it was like ! [A St. Bernard]2219-a st. bernard and another poodle joined the party , and while [we]2220-we were trying to get something to eat and drink , [they]2216-the great - aunts all begged or barked or pushed [their]2216-the great - aunts noses under the muffin dish lid , or took cakes from the side table ; and [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia kept saying , " [Clever darlings]3168-clever darlings ; see , [they]3168-clever darlings know where [their]3168-clever darlings favourite bits are . "[281-lady theodosia] It is impossible to have a connected conversation with [her]281-lady theodosia , because between every few words [she]281-lady theodosia puts in ejaculations about the dogs . [I]0-i was obliged to simply bolt [my]0-i crumpet like [a Frenchman]1957-a frenchman , to keep it from being snatched from [me]0-i . Just as [we]2220-we were finishing tea , [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran and [three men]2222-three men came in . [He]285-mr. doran is [a teeny - weeny man with a big head and rather weak eyes]2223-a teeny - weeny man with a big head and rather weak eyes , and [he]285-mr. doran and [she]281-lady theodosia do look odd together . What could it have been like when [they]2224-they trotted down the aisle after getting married ! It is a mercy [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia is only [[your]2225-your second cousin]2226-your second cousin , and that [her]281-lady theodosia shape has not descended to [[our]2220-we branch of [the family]1337-the family]2227-our branch of the family . [All the " children"—as[281-lady theodosia] [she]281-lady theodosia calls the animals]2229-all the " children"—as she calls the animals — barked again when [the men]450-the men came in . There was only a miserable tea left , and , when [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran ventured to say the dogs had made things rather messy , [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia annihilated [him]285-mr. doran . It was as if [he]285-mr. doran had insulted [her]281-lady theodosia nearest and dearest ! But [one of [the men]450-the men]2231-one of the men got quietly to the bell , and when [the footmen]2233-the footmen came [they]2233-the footmen grasped the situation and brought some clean things , so tea finished better than it had begun . Just before [they]2233-the footmen went to dress [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia remembered to introduce [them]2233-the footmen . [The only young one]2234-the only young one is [Mr. Roper]286-mr. roper , [the great shot]2235-the great shot , and [the other two]1567-the other two are [Sir Augustus Grant]287-sir augustus grant and [Captain Fieldin]288-captain fieldin ; [they]1567-the other two are oldish . When [they]2233-the footmen had gone , [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia said to [me]0-i that [men]725-men were a great nuisance as a rule , but that [she]281-lady theodosia had [a pet friend]2238-a pet friend , a " dear docile creature , so useful with the dogs , "[281-lady theodosia] and [he]2238-a pet friend was coming back by [the 6.30 train]2239-the 6.30 train . [You]2240-you would have laughed , if [you]2240-you could have seen [him]2238-a pet friend when [he]2238-a pet friend did arrive ! A fair humble thing , with a squeaky voice and obsequious manners . [He]2238-a pet friend had been up to [town]2241-town to get the dogs new muzzles , as the muzzling order has just been put in force in [this county]2242-this county . It appears [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia has [him]2238-a pet friend always [here]391-here , and [he]2238-a pet friend attends to the dogs for [a home]2244-a home , but [I]0-i would rather be [a stable — boy]2245-a stable — boy , would n't [you]2240-you , [Mamma]132-mamma ? [His]2238-a pet friend name is [Frederick Harrington]289-frederick , and [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia calls [him]2238-a pet friend " [Frederick]289-frederick "[281-lady theodosia] when [she]281-lady theodosia is pleased , and " [Harrington]289-frederick "[281-lady theodosia] if anything puts [her]281-lady theodosia out .
