And as [she]281-lady theodosia says it , " [Harrington]289-frederick "[281-lady theodosia] sounds the fattest word [you]2246-you ever heard . [I]0-i was glad to get to [[my]0-i room]631-my room ! [Most of the house that [I]0-i have yet seen , which was not refurnished when [she]281-lady theodosia married in 1870]2248-most of the house that i have yet seen , which was not refurnished when she married in 1870 , is really fine , with beautiful old furniture and china ; only everything within reach is scratched and spoilt by [the " children]3169-the " children . "[3169-the " children] It must make [the family]1337-the family portraits turn in [their]1337-the family frames to see [Fluff]290-fluff eating one of [their]1337-the family tapestry footstools , or the cats clawing the Venetian velvet chairs . Feeding [the Aborigines]291-the aborigines There was a dinner party in the evening . As [we]2250-we went [upstairs]470-upstairs to dress , [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia told [me]0-i about it . [She]281-lady theodosia said [she]281-lady theodosia was obliged to entertain all [the Aborigines]2252-the aborigines twice a year , and that [most people]2253-most people gave [them]2252-the aborigines garden parties ; but [she]281-lady theodosia found that too fatiguing , so [she]281-lady theodosia had two dinners in the shooting season , and two at Easter , to which [she]281-lady theodosia asked every one . [She]281-lady theodosia just puts all [their]2252-the aborigines names in a bag , and counts out [twelve couples]2254-twelve couples for each party , and then [she]281-lady theodosia makes up the number to thirty - six with odd creatures , [daughters]2255-daughters and [old maids]2256-old maids , and [sons]2257-sons and [curates]2258-curates , & c. , and [she]281-lady theodosia finds it a capital plan . [She]281-lady theodosia said , " [I]281-lady theodosia give ['em]3170-'em plenty to eat and drink , and [they]3170-'em draw for [partners]3171-partners , and [all]501-all go [home]390-home as happy as possible feeling there has been no favouritism ! "[281-lady theodosia] [She]281-lady theodosia explained that [the lawyers]2259-the lawyers and [doctors]2260-doctors enjoyed having [their]2261-their food with [the earls and baronets]2262-the earls and baronets much more than just prancing about [lawns]2263-lawns . And when [I]0-i asked [her]281-lady theodosia how [the earls and baronets]2262-the earls and baronets liked it , [she]281-lady theodosia said there were only three or four , and [they]2262-the earls and baronets had to put up with it or stay at [home]390-home ; [she]281-lady theodosia had done it now for thirty years , and [they]2262-the earls and baronets were accustomed to it ; besides , [she]281-lady theodosia had the best chef in [England]25-england , and anyway it was a nice change for [people]411-people not knowing who [they]411-people were going to be put next to . It took [her]281-lady theodosia such a long time to tell [me]0-i all this , and to see [me]0-i to [[my]0-i room]631-my room , that [I]0-i was almost late , and [she]281-lady theodosia did not get into [the state drawing - room]2268-the state drawing - room until all [the guests]1681-the guests had arrived . [You]2270-you never saw anything so funny as it was , [Mamma]132-mamma . [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran was trying to be polite to [the odd collection]2271-the odd collection , evidently not quite knowing which was which . [Old Lord]2272-old lord and [Lady Devnant]292-lady devnant were glaring at the rest of [the company]1996-the company from the hearth - rug , with a look of " [You]2270-you invade this mat at [your]2270-you peril ! "[2272-old lord] [Sir Christopher Harford]293-sir christopher harford paying extravagant compliments to [[the parson]2274-the parson 's wife]2275-the parson 's wife ( [I]0-i knew which [they]2276-their were because [I]0-i heard [them]2276-their announced ) , and [the " Squire]3174-the " squire "[3174-the " squire] and [Mrs. de Lacy]294-mrs. de lacy — who came over with [the Conqueror]2277-the conqueror — standing apart with [[their]2276-their skinny daughters]2278-their skinny daughters , all holding [their]2276-their noses in the air . [Everybody]404-everybody seemed to be in [their]404-everybody best clothes , and [most of [the women]459-the women]2280-most of the women had flowers and tulle or little black feathers sticking up in [their]2280-most of the women hair , and bare red arms , and skirts inches off the ground in front ; [you]2282-you know the look . But everything seemed to be going beautifully after [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia rolled in ( [she]281-lady theodosia does not walk , like [ordinary people]2283-ordinary people ) ! Drawing for [Partners Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran did the handing round of the drawing - papers , and [they]2284-they were " [Marshall]295-marshall and [Snelgrove]304-snelgrove , "[2284-they] and " [Lewis]296-lewis and [Allenby]297-allenby , "[2284-they] and " [Debenham]298-debenham and [Freebody]299-freebody , "[2284-they] & c. , and if [you]2282-you drew " [Lewis]296-lewis "[2282-you] [you]2282-you went in with whoever drew [" Allenby]297-allenby , "[2282-you] and so on ; it was a capital plan , only for one incident . [I]0-i was near [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia when [Mr. Harrington]300-mr. harrington rushed from the other end of [the room]401-the room , and whispered to [her]281-lady theodosia in an agitated voice that the " Dickens "[300-mr. harrington] of [Lady Devnant]292-lady devnant 's " Jones "[301-dr. pluffield] was [Dr. Pluffield]301-dr. pluffield . [She]281-lady theodosia was not on speaking terms with [him]300-mr. harrington , having quarrelled with [him]300-mr. harrington for sending [her]281-lady theodosia teething powders by mistake , when it ought to have been something for [her]281-lady theodosia nerves . All [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia said was — " [Harrington]300-mr. harrington , [you]300-mr. harrington 're [a fool]3175-a fool . What are [their]3176-their little differences to [me]281-lady theodosia ? [I]281-lady theodosia give 'em the best dinner in [England]25-england , and [they]3176-their must settle the rest [themselves]3176-their ! "[281-lady theodosia] So poor [Mr. Harrington]300-mr. harrington had to go back and smooth down [Lady Devnant]292-lady devnant as best [he]300-mr. harrington could ; and presently [we]2286-we all started for [the banqueting - hall]2287-the banqueting - hall . There were [several really decent county people]2288-several really decent county people [there]398-there , of course , but [they]2288-several really decent county people all looked much the same as the others , except that [they]2288-several really decent county people had diamonds on . [Old Admiral Brudnell]302-old admiral brudnell , who has a crimson face , was taking in the younger [Miss de Lacy]303-miss de lacy , and just in front of [him]302-old admiral brudnell were [Dr. Pluffield]301-dr. pluffield and [Lady Devnant]292-lady devnant , whom [the Admiral]2290-the admiral hates . [I]0-i heard [him]302-old admiral brudnell say , getting purple like [a gobbler]2291-a gobbler , " Come on , come on , [I]302-old admiral brudnell do n't mean to let [that old catamaran]3177-that old catamaran get in front of [me]302-old admiral brudnell ! "[302-old admiral brudnell] And [he]302-old admiral brudnell dragged [Miss de Lacy]303-miss de lacy through the doorway , bumping [the others]487-the others to get past ; and [she]303-miss de lacy told [me]0-i afterwards [her]303-miss de lacy funny - bone had got such a knock that [she]303-miss de lacy could hardly hold [her]303-miss de lacy soup spoon ! [Marshall]295-marshall and [Snelgrove]304-snelgrove It was quainter even than the frumps ' dinner that [Godmamma]189-godmamma gave . The dishes were exquisite , and [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia enjoyed them all , in spite of " [Fanny]283-fanny "[305-the spitz] ( that is [the Spitz]305-the spitz ) constantly falling off [her]281-lady theodosia lap , and having to be fished for by [[her]281-lady theodosia own footman]2294-her own footman , who always stands behind [her]281-lady theodosia chair , ready for these emergencies . [Mr. Roper]286-mr. roper sat at [my]0-i other side , and after a while [he]286-mr. roper talked to [me]0-i ; [he]286-mr. roper said [he]286-mr. roper came every year to shoot partridges , and it was always the same . On the night [he]286-mr. roper arrived there was always this dinner party , and some years the most absurd things had happened , but [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia did not care a button . [He]286-mr. roper thought there were a good many advantages in being [[a Duke]839-a duke 's daughter]2297-a duke 's daughter ; [they]2298-they do n't dare to offend [her]281-lady theodosia , [he]286-mr. roper said , although [they]2298-they are ready to tear [one another]807-one another 's eyes out when [they]2298-they are put with [the wrong people]2300-the wrong people . [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia puffed a good deal as dinner went on , [I]0-i could hear [her]281-lady theodosia from where [I]0-i sat . [She]281-lady theodosia is in slight mourning , so below [her]281-lady theodosia diamond necklace — which is magnificent , but has not been cleaned for years — [she]281-lady theodosia had a set of five lockets , on a chain all made of bog oak , and afterwards [I]0-i found each locket had a portrait of some pet animal who is dead in it , and a piece of its hair . [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran 's Philanthropy It appears [Captain Fieldin]288-captain fieldin and [Sir Augustus Grant]287-sir augustus grant are constantly staying [here]391-here ; [they]2370-they help to ride [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran 's horses and shoot [his]285-mr. doran birds . [They]2370-they are [all old friends]2371-all old friends , and rather hard up , so [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran just keeps [them]2370-they . [He]285-mr. doran — [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran — seems different after meals ; from being as quiet as a lamb , [he]285-mr. doran gets quite coarse and blunt . [The rest of the party]2372-the rest of the party were just the kind of [neighbours that always come to shoot]2373-neighbours that always come to shoot . [Mr. Roper]286-mr. roper told [me]0-i [they]2370-they never have smart parties , with only the best shots , and heaps of [beautiful ladies]2374-beautiful ladies . [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia had a very short tweed skirt on , a black velvet jacket with bugles , and a boat - shaped hat and cocks ' feathers ; but [she]281-lady theodosia always wears the black velvet band round [her]281-lady theodosia forehead . Croquet under Difficulties When [we]2388-we got back , [Lord]2389-lord and [Lady Tyneville]309-lady tyneville had arrived with [[their]2390-their two daughters]2391-their two daughters . [They]2391-their two daughters are about [my]0-i age , and quite nice and pretty ; but [[their]2391-their two daughters mother]2392-their mother dresses [them]2391-their two daughters so queerly , [they]2391-their two daughters look [rather guys]2393-rather guys . [I]0-i am glad , [Mamma]132-mamma , that [you]132-mamma have none of those silly ideas , and that [I]0-i have not got to have [my]0-i hair in a large bun with ribbons twisted in it for dinner . [They]2391-their two daughters seem quite accustomed to stay [here]391-here , and know all the dogs and [their]2391-their two daughters ways . [They]2391-their two daughters are much nicer than [French girls]2395-french girls , but not so attractive as [Miss La Touche]129-miss la touche . [We]2396-we had an early tea in [the hall]396-the hall , and after tea [we]2396-we played croquet until it got dark , though [one]658-one could not get on very well as the dogs constantly carried off the balls in [their]2391-their two daughters mouths , and [one]658-one had to guess where to put them back , and in that way [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia , who was [[my]0-i partner]2400-my partner , managed to get through three hoops [she]281-lady theodosia would n't have otherwise . It is n't much fun playing so late in the year , as it gets so cold . [I]0-i think [the elder Miss Everleigh]310-the elder miss everleigh is in love with [Mr. Roper]286-mr. roper , because [she]310-the elder miss everleigh blushed , just as [they]2401-they do in books , when [he]286-mr. roper came in , and from being quiet and nice , got rather gigglish . Retby]113-elizabeth , Thursday . [Dearest Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i do n't think [I]0-i care about looking at [churches]1085-churches much . [They]1085-churches do n't smell here as [they]1085-churches do in [France]10-france , but on the other hand [they]1085-churches look deserted , and as if [no one]744-no one cared a pin , and there are generally repairs going on or monuments piled up at the side waiting to be put back or something that does n't look tidy — in the big ones [I]0-i mean , like [York]79-york and [Hernminster]78-hernminster that [we]2396-we saw yesterday . [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran drove [us]2396-we in on [the coach]2408-the coach , and [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia sat on the box beside [him]285-mr. doran . An Agreeable Drive [Sir Augustus]287-sir augustus grant does n't seem so old when [he]287-sir augustus grant is sitting by [you]2415-you ; [he]287-sir augustus grant said a lot of nice things to [me]0-i . [We]2414-we went straight to [the " Red Lion]80-the " red lion "[287-sir augustus grant] and had lunch , and it was a horrid meal , everything over or underdone , and messy and nasty . [I]0-i wonder why food at [country hotels in [England]25-england]2417-country hotels in england is so bad ? At [Retby Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia wo n't touch anything unless it is absolutely perfect . [She]281-lady theodosia sent a dish away yesterday just because a whiff of some flavouring [she]281-lady theodosia does not like came to [her]281-lady theodosia , but at the " Red Lion "[281-lady theodosia] [she]281-lady theodosia did not grumble at all ; it must be for the same reason that wetting [their]2418-their feet does n't give [French people]1468-french people cold if it is at a national sport , that made [her]281-lady theodosia put up with the lunch because it was English and had always been the same . [I]0-i was glad to have a nice piece of cheese . All the time [I]0-i was with [Godmamma]189-godmamma [I]0-i was not allowed to , as it is n't considered proper for [girls there]2420-girls there , and when [I]0-i asked [Victorine]191-victorine why one day , [she]191-victorine told [me]0-i it gave ideas , and was too exciting , whatever that could mean . But nothing happened , [I]0-i did not feel at all excited , so it must be because [they]2418-their are French . Must n't it ? [Country Shopping]81-country shopping First [we]2423-we went to [a curiosity shop]2424-a curiosity shop before going to [the Cathedral]2404-the cathedral , and there was such [an odd man]2426-an odd man owned [it]2424-a curiosity shop . " [My]2426-an odd man good [Griggson]311-griggson , "[2426-an odd man] [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia called [him]2426-an odd man ; [he]2426-an odd man seemed quite pleased — although [we]2423-we none of [us]2423-we bought anything — and so friendly with [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia . When [we]2423-we had finished trotting about looking at [the old streets]2427-the old streets and [the Cathedral]2404-the cathedral , [we]2423-we went to buy some mauve silk to line a cushion that [Lady Tyneville]309-lady tyneville has embroidered as a present to [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia . It is so funny in [these country shops]2429-these country shops , [they]2429-these country shops always bring [you]2430-you what [you]2430-you do n't want . [Lady Tyneville]309-lady tyneville said [she]309-lady tyneville wanted mauve , and showed [her]309-lady tyneville pattern , and after some time [the girl who served [her]309-lady tyneville]2431-the girl who served her came back and said , " Oh ! [we]2423-we are out of mauve , but green is being very much worn . "[2431-the girl who served her] [We]2423-we went back to the " Red Lion "[285-mr. doran] and [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran and [Captain Fieldin]288-captain fieldin joined [us]2423-we . [They]2432-they had been at [the Club]2433-the club all the time , and were full of local news about the cub hunting , & c. On the way back to [Retby Sir Augustus]312-retby sir augustus told [me]0-i [he]312-retby sir augustus was struck with [me]0-i the moment [he]312-retby sir augustus came into [[Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia 's boudoir]2434-lady theodosia 's boudoir , and [he]312-retby sir augustus tried to take hold of [my]0-i hand . [I]0-i call it very queer , do n't [you]312-retby sir augustus ? [I]0-i suppose it is because [they]2432-they think [I]0-i am young and want encouraging , but [I]0-i simply detest it , and [I]0-i told [him]312-retby sir augustus so . [I]0-i said , " Why should [you]312-retby sir augustus want to hold [my]0-i hand ? "[0-i] and when [he]312-retby sir augustus looked foolish and mumbled some answer , [I]0-i just said , " Because if [you]312-retby sir augustus are afraid of falling , and it is to hold on , there is the outside rail of [the coach]2408-the coach for [you]312-retby sir augustus ; [I]0-i hate being pawed . "[0-i] [He]312-retby sir augustus said [I]0-i was a disagreeable little thing , and would never get on in life . But [you]312-retby sir augustus can see , [Mamma]132-mamma , how everything has changed since [you]312-retby sir augustus were young . [Mr. Harrington]300-mr. harrington 's Fault [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia put on such a splendid purple brocade tea - gown for tea , but [Fluff]290-fluff would jump up at the tray , and succeeded at last in upsetting a whole jug of cream over [her]281-lady theodosia . [She]281-lady theodosia was sitting in a very low chair that it is difficult to get out of , and [she]281-lady theodosia looked quite piteous with billows of cream rolling off [her]281-lady theodosia ; it got into [Fanny]283-fanny 's nose and made [her]281-lady theodosia sneeze , and that annoyed the other dogs , and [they]2435-they all began to fight , and [the St. Bernard]308-the st. bernard joined in , and in [his]308-the st. bernard excitement [he]308-the st. bernard overturned the whole table and tray . [You]312-retby sir augustus never saw such a catastrophe ! The dogs got quite wild with joy , and left off fighting to gobble cakes , and when [Mr. Harrington]300-mr. harrington , who had been away writing letters , rushed in to see what the commotion was , [he]300-mr. harrington did catch it ! [We]2436-we extricated [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia from masses of broken china and dribbles of jam , in the most awful rage . [She]281-lady theodosia said it was entirely [Mr. Harrington]300-mr. harrington 's fault for not being there to look after the dogs . Considering [she]281-lady theodosia had sent [him]300-mr. harrington to write about [their]2435-they muzzles , [I]0-i do call it hard , do n't [you]312-retby sir augustus ? [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran came in , and when [he]285-mr. doran saw the best Crown Derby smashed on the floor , and the teapot all bent , [he]285-mr. doran became quite transformed , and swore dreadfully . [He]285-mr. doran said such rude words , [Mamma]132-mamma , that [I]0-i can not even write them , and it ended up with , " If [you]312-retby sir augustus keep a d----d puppy to look after [your]312-retby sir augustus other d----d puppies , why [the devil]3183-the devil do n't [you]312-retby sir augustus see [he]285-mr. doran does it ! "[285-mr. doran] [I]0-i hope [you]312-retby sir augustus are n't awfully shocked , [Mamma]132-mamma , at [me]0-i writing that ; [I]0-i was obliged to , to show [you]312-retby sir augustus what [awful creatures men]2437-awful creatures men really are underneath , even if [their]2437-awful creatures men outsides look as meek as [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran 's . [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia burst into tears , and it was altogether a fearful scene if it had not been so funny to look at . [We]2438-we none of [us]2438-we got any tea , for by the time [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia had been got to dry [her]281-lady theodosia eyes , and things were cleared up , [we]2438-we were all only too glad to disperse . [I]0-i am sure [a lot of [children]3105-children]2439-a lot of children could not be so naughty as these dogs are . A prudent Retirement Dinner began by being rather strained , but gradually got quite gay . [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran would have up three different brands of champagne for every one to try , and [the men]450-the men seemed to like [them]2442-them very much . By dessert everything was lively again , and dinner ended by [Mr. Doran]285-mr. doran singing " The hounds of [the Meynell]313-the meynell , "[285-mr. doran] with one foot on the table as gay as a lark . But was n't it tiresome , [Mamma]132-mamma ? when [we]2438-we got into [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room , [Lady Theodosia]281-lady theodosia said [we]2438-we had had a long day , and must be tired , and [she]281-lady theodosia packed [the two Everleighs]2444-the two everleighs and [me]0-i off to bed before [the men]450-the men came in , and so here [I]0-i am writing to [you]132-mamma , because it is ridiculous to suppose [I]0-i am going to sleep at this hour . Agnès and [I]0-i leave by [the early train]2446-the early train on Saturday morning , so good - bye till then , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma ; love from [[your]132-mamma affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Carriston Towers]82-carriston towers , 27th October . [Carriston Towers Dearest Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i shall never again arrive at a place at three o'clock in the afternoon ; it is perfectly ghastly ! As [we]2438-we drove up to the door — it was pouring with rain — [I]0-i felt that [I]0-i should not like anything here . It does look such a large grey pile : and how cold and draughty [that immense stone hall]2449-that immense stone hall must be in winter ! There were no nice big sofas about , or palms , or lots of papers and books ; nothing but suits of armour and great marble tables , looking like monuments . [I]0-i was taken down [endless passages]2450-endless passages to [the library]2451-the library , and there left such a long time that [I]0-i had got down an old Punch and was looking at it , and trying to warm [my]0-i feet , when [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston came in with [Adeline]315-adeline . [I]0-i remember how [I]0-i hated playing with [her]314-lady carriston years ago ; [she]314-lady carriston always patronised [me]0-i , being three years older , and [she]314-lady carriston is just the same now , only both [their]2452-they backs have got longer and [their]2452-they noses more arched , and they are the image of [each other]437-each other . [Adeline]315-adeline seems very suppressed ; [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston does not — [her]314-lady carriston face is carved out of stone . [They]2452-they look very well bred and respectable , and badly dressed ; nothing rustled nicely when [they]2452-they walked , and [they]2452-they had not [their]2452-they nails polished , or scent on , or anything like that ; but [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston had a splendid row of pearls round [her]314-lady carriston throat , on the top of [her]314-lady carriston rough tweed dress and linen collar . [They]2452-they pronounce [their]2452-they words very distinctly , in an elevated kind of way , and [you]2454-you feel as if icicles were trickling down [your]2454-you back , and [you]2454-you ca n't think of a thing to say . When [we]2455-we had got to the end of [your]2454-you neuralgia and [my]0-i journey , there was such a pause ! and [I]0-i suppose [they]2452-they thought [I]0-i was [an idiot]457-an idiot , and were only too glad to get [me]0-i off to [[my]0-i room]631-my room , where [Adeline]315-adeline took [me]0-i , and left [me]0-i , hoping [I]0-i had everything [I]0-i wanted , and saying tea was at five in [the blue drawing - room]2458-the blue drawing - room . And there [I]0-i had to stay while [Agnès]115-agnès unpacked . It was dull ! [It]631-my room is [a big room]2459-a big room , and the fire had only just been lit . The furniture is colourless and ugly , and , although it is all comfortable and correct , there are no books about , except " [Romola]316-romola "[115-agnès] and " Middlemarch "[115-agnès] and some [Carlyle]317-carlyle and [John Stuart Mill]318-john stuart mill , and [I]0-i did not feel that [I]0-i could do with any of that just then . So there [I]0-i sat twiddling [my]0-i thumbs for more than an hour , and [Agnès]115-agnès did make such a noise , opening and shutting drawers , but at last [I]0-i remembered a box of caramels in [my]0-i dressing - bag , and it was better after that . [A Dull Hour]2460-a dull hour [Agnès]115-agnès had put out [my]0-i white cashmere for tea , and at five [I]0-i started to find [my]0-i way to [the blue drawing - room]2458-the blue drawing - room . [The bannisters]2462-the bannisters are so broad and slippery — the very things for sliding on . [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i should start down them one day , just to astonish [Adeline]315-adeline , only [I]0-i promised [you]315-adeline [I]0-i would be good . Well , when [I]0-i got to [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room , [the party — about twelve]2464-the party — about twelve — had assembled . [The old Earl]319-the old earl had been wheeled in from [[his]319-the old earl rooms]2465-his rooms : [he]319-the old earl wears a black velvet skull - cap and a stock but [he]319-the old earl has a splendid and distinguished old face . If [I]0-i were [he]319-the old earl , [I]0-i would not have such [a dull daughter - in - law]2466-a dull daughter - in - law to live with [me]0-i as [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston is , even if [[my]0-i son]2467-my son was dead . [The boy]2468-the boy , [Charlie Carriston]320-charlie , was there too ; [he]2468-the boy does look a goose . [He]2468-the boy is like those pictures in the Punch that [I]0-i was looking at , where [the family]1337-the family is so old that [their]1337-the family chins and foreheads have gone . [He]2468-the boy is awfully afraid of [[his]2468-the boy mother]494-his mother . There were [two or three elderly pepper - and - salt men]2471-two or three elderly pepper - and - salt men , and [that Trench cousin]2472-that trench cousin , who is [a very High Church curate]2473-a very high church curate ( [you]2474-you know [Aunt Mary]140-aunt mary told [us]2475-us about [him]2472-that trench cousin ) , and there are [a Sir Samuel]321-a sir samuel and [Lady Garnons]322-lady garnons , with [an old maid daughter]2476-an old maid daughter , and [[Adeline]315-adeline 's German governess]2477-adeline 's german governess , who has stayed on as [companion , and helped to pour out the tea]2478-companion , and helped to pour out the tea . A Modern Grandison The conversation was subdued ; about politics and [Cabinet Ministers]2479-cabinet ministers , and pheasants and foxes , and things of that kind , and [no one]744-no one said anything that meant anything else , as [they]2481-they did at [Nazeby]8-nazeby , or were witty like [they]2481-they were at [Tournelle]195-tournelle , and [the German governess]2482-the german governess said " Ach "[2482-the german governess] to everything , and [Lady Garnons]322-lady garnons and [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons knitted all the time , which gave [their]2481-they voices the sound of " one - two - three "[2482-the german governess] when [they]2481-they spoke , although [they]2481-they did not really count . [No one]744-no one had on tea - gowns — just a Sunday sort of clothes . [I]0-i do n't know how [we]2484-we should have got through tea if the coffee - cream cakes had not been so good . [The old Earl]2485-the old earl called [me]0-i to [him]2485-the old earl when [he]2485-the old earl had finished , and talked so beautifully to [me]0-i ; [he]2485-the old earl paid [me]0-i some such grand old - fashioned compliments , and [his]2485-the old earl voice sounds as if [he]2485-the old earl had learnt elocution in [his]2485-the old earl youth . There is not a word of slang or anything modern ; [one]658-one quite understands how [he]2485-the old earl was able to wake up [the House of Lords]2487-the house of lords before [his]2485-the old earl legs gave way . It seems sad that such a ninny as [Charlie]320-charlie should succeed [him]2485-the old earl . [I]0-i feel proud of being related to [him]2485-the old earl , but [I]0-i shall never think of [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston except as [a distant cousin]2488-a distant cousin . Both [Charlie]320-charlie and [Adeline]315-adeline are so afraid of [her]314-lady carriston that [they]2489-they hardly speak . [I]0-i sha n't waste any of [my]0-i best frocks here , so [I]0-i made [Agnès]115-agnès put [me]0-i on the old blue silk for the evening . [She]115-agnès was disgusted . At dinner [I]0-i sat between [Charlie]320-charlie and [one of the pepper - and - salts]2490-one of the pepper - and - salts — [he]320-charlie is a M.P. [They]2491-they are going to shoot partridges to - morrow ; and [I]0-i do n't know what [we]2492-we shall do , as there has been no suggestion of [our]2492-we going out to lunch . After dinner [we]2492-we sat in [the yellow drawing - room]2493-the yellow drawing - room ; [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston and [Lady Garnons]322-lady garnons talked in quite an animated way together about using [their]2489-they personal influence to suppress all signs of Romanism in the services of [the Church]1005-the church . [They]2489-they seemed to think [they]2489-they would have no difficulty in stopping it . [They]2489-they are both [Low Church]83-low church , [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons told [me]0-i , but [she]323-miss garnons [herself]323-miss garnons held quite different views . Then [she]323-miss garnons asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i did not think [the Reverend Ernest Trench]324-the reverend ernest trench had a " soulful face , "[323-miss garnons] so pure and abstracted that merely looking at [him]324-the reverend ernest trench gave thoughts of a higher life . [I]0-i said No ; [he]324-the reverend ernest trench reminded [me]0-i of a white ferret [we]2495-we had once , and [I]0-i hated [curates]2258-curates . [She]323-miss garnons looked perfectly sick at [me]0-i and did not take the trouble to talk any more , but joined [Adeline]315-adeline , who had been winding silk with [Fräulein Schlarbaum]325-fräulein schlarbaum for a tie [she]323-miss garnons is knitting . So [I]0-i tried to read the Contemporary Review , but [I]0-i could not help hearing [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston telling [Lady Garnons]322-lady garnons that [she]314-lady carriston had always brought up [Adeline]315-adeline and [Charlie]320-charlie so carefully that [she]314-lady carriston knew [their]2497-their inmost thoughts . ( [She]314-lady carriston did not mention [Cyril]326-cyril , who is still at [Eton]84-eton . ) " Yes , [I]314-lady carriston assure [you]0-i , [Georgina]327-georgina , "[314-lady carriston] [she]314-lady carriston said , " [[my]314-lady carriston dear children]3184-my dear children have never had a secret from [me]314-lady carriston in [their]3184-my dear children innocent lives . "[314-lady carriston] [The Duke]2498-the duke 's Shirt When [the men]450-the men came in from [the dining - room]898-the dining - room , [one of [the old fellows]2502-the old fellows]2501-one of the old fellows came and talked to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i discovered [he]2501-one of the old fellows is [the Duke of [Lancashire]85-lancashire]2503-the duke of lancashire . [He]2501-one of the old fellows is ordinary looking , and [his]2501-one of the old fellows shirts fit so badly — that nasty sticking - out look at the sides , and not enough starch . [I]0-i would not have shirts that did not fit if [I]0-i were [a Duke]839-a duke , would [you]2505-you ? [They]2506-they are all staying [here]391-here for the Conservative meeting to - morrow evening at [Barchurch]86-barchurch . These three pepper - and - salts are shining lights in [this county]2242-this county , [I]0-i have gathered . [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston seems very well informed on every subject . It does not matter if [she]314-lady carriston is talking to [Mr. Haselton]328-mr. haselton or [Sir Andrew Merton]329-sir andrew merton , ( the two M.P. 's ) , or [the Duke]2498-the duke , who is [the M.F.H.]2510-the m.f.h. , or [the curate]2511-the curate ; [she]314-lady carriston seems to know much more about politics , and hunting , and religion than [they]2506-they do . It is no wonder [she]314-lady carriston can see [[her]314-lady carriston children]2512-her children 's thoughts ! At half - past ten [we]2513-we all said good - night . [The dear old Earl]319-the old earl does not come in from [the dining - room]898-the dining - room ; [he]319-the old earl is wheeled straight to [[his]319-the old earl rooms]2465-his rooms , so [I]0-i did not see [him]319-the old earl . [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons and [Adeline]315-adeline both looked as if [they]2506-they could hardly bear to part with [[their]2506-they curate]2516-their curate , and finally [we]2513-we got [upstairs]470-upstairs , and now [I]0-i must go to bed.—Best love , from [[your]2518-your affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [P.S.—Everything]330-p.s.—everything is kept up with great state [here]391-here ; there seems to be [a footman behind every one]2521-a footman behind every one 's chair at dinner . [Carriston Towers]82-carriston towers , 28th October . [Charlie]320-charlie 's Dissimulation Dearest [Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i was so afraid of being late for breakfast this morning that [I]0-i was down quite ten minutes too soon , and when [I]0-i got into [the breakfast - room]2522-the breakfast - room [I]0-i found [Charlie]320-charlie alone , mixing [himself]320-charlie a brandy cocktail . [He]320-charlie wanted to kiss [me]0-i , because [he]320-charlie said [we]2523-we were [cousins]711-cousins , but [I]0-i did not like the smell of the brandy , so [I]0-i would not let [him]320-charlie . [He]320-charlie made [me]0-i promise that [I]0-i would come out with [him]320-charlie after breakfast , before [they]2525-they started to shoot , to look at [his]320-charlie horses ; then [we]2523-we heard [some one]717-some one coming , and [he]320-charlie whisked the cocktail glass out of sight in the neatest way possible . At breakfast [he]320-charlie just nibbled a bit of toast , and drank a glass of milk , and [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston kept saying to [him]320-charlie , " [[My]320-charlie dear]3117-my dear , [dear boy]3186-dear boy , [you]3186-dear boy have no appetite , "[320-charlie] and [he]320-charlie said , " No , having to read so hard as [he]320-charlie did at night took it away . "[320-charlie] [The Duke]2498-the duke seemed a little annoyed that there was not a particular chutney in [his]2498-the duke curried kidneys , which [I]0-i thought very rude in [[another person]2528-another person 's house]2529-another person 's house ; and , as it was Friday , [the Reverend Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench refused every dish in a loud voice , and then helped [himself]331-mr. trench to a whole sole at the side - table . The food was lovely . [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons did not eat a thing , and [Lady Garnons]322-lady garnons was not down nor , of course , [the old Earl]2485-the old earl . After breakfast [we]2531-we meandered into [the hall]396-the hall . Smoking is not allowed anywhere except in [the billiard - room]553-the billiard - room , which is down [yards and yards of passages]2534-yards and yards of passages , so as not to let the smell get into [the house]526-the house . [We]2531-we seemed to be standing about doing nothing , so [I]0-i said [I]0-i would go up and get [my]0-i boots on , or probably there would not be time to go with [Charlie]320-charlie to see [his]320-charlie horses before [they]2536-they started . [You]2537-you should have seen [the family]1337-the family 's three faces ! [Charlie]320-charlie 's silly jaw dropped , [Adeline]315-adeline 's eyebrows ran up to [her]2539-her hair almost , while [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston said in an icy voice : " [We]1337-the family had not thought of visiting [the stables]3187-the stables so early . "[314-lady carriston] Did [you]2537-you ever hear of anything so ridiculous , [Mamma]132-mamma ? Just as though [I]0-i had said something improper ! [I]0-i was furious with [Charlie]320-charlie , [he]320-charlie had not even the pluck to say [he]320-charlie had asked [me]0-i to go ; but [I]0-i paid [him]320-charlie out . [I]0-i just said , " [I]0-i concluded [you]314-lady carriston had consulted [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston before asking [me]0-i to go with [you]314-lady carriston , or naturally [I]0-i should not have suggested going to get ready . "[0-i] [He]320-charlie did look a stupid thing , and bolted at once ; but [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston saw [I]0-i was not going to be snubbed , so [she]314-lady carriston became more polite , and presently asked [me]0-i to come and see [the aviary]2540-the aviary with [her]314-lady carriston . The Slip of Paper As [we]2541-we walked down [the armour gallery]2542-the armour gallery [she]314-lady carriston met [a servant]958-a servant with a telegram , and while [she]314-lady carriston stopped to read it [I]0-i looked out of one of the windows . The wall is so thick they are all in recesses , and [Charlie]320-charlie passed underneath , [his]320-charlie head just level with the open part . The moment [he]320-charlie saw [me]0-i [he]320-charlie fished out a scrap of paper from [his]320-charlie pocket and pressed it into [my]0-i hand , and said , " Do n't be a mug this time , "[320-charlie] and was gone before [I]0-i could do anything . [I]0-i did not know what to do with the paper , so [I]0-i had to slip it up [my]0-i sleeve , as with these skirts one has n't a pocket , and [I]0-i did feel so mad at having done a thing in that underhand way . [The aviary]2540-the aviary is such [a wonderful place]2545-a wonderful place , there seem to be birds of every kind , and [the parrakeets]2546-the parrakeets do make such a noise . There are lots of palms here and seats , but it is not just [an ideal place to stay and talk in]2547-an ideal place to stay and talk in , as every creature screams so that [you]2548-you can hardly hear [yourself]2548-you speak . However , [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons and [Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench did not seem to think so , as , while [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston stopped to say , " [Didysy , woodsie , poppsie]332-didysy , woodsie , poppsie , dicksie , "[314-lady carriston] to [some canaries]2549-some canaries , [I]0-i turned a corner to see some owls , and there found [them]2550-them holding hands and kissing ( [the White Ferret]333-the white ferret and [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons [I]0-i mean , of course , not the owls ) . The Mysteries of Religion [They]2550-them must have come in at the other door , and the parrots ' noises had prevented [them]2550-them from hearing [us]2551-us coming . [You]2548-you never saw [two people]2552-two people so taken aback . [They]2552-two people simply jumped away from [one another]807-one another . [Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench got crimson up to [his]331-mr. trench white eyelashes , and coughed in a nervous way , while poor [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons at once talked nineteen to [the dozen]2554-the dozen about [the " darling little owlies]3188-the " darling little owlies , "[323-miss garnons] and never let go [my]0-i arm until [she]323-miss garnons had got [me]0-i aside , when [she]323-miss garnons at once began explaining that [she]323-miss garnons hoped [I]0-i would not misinterpret anything [I]0-i had seen ; that of course it might look odd to one who did not understand the higher life , but there were mysteries connected with [her]323-miss garnons religion , and [she]323-miss garnons hoped [I]0-i would say nothing about it . [I]0-i said [she]323-miss garnons need not worry [herself]323-miss garnons . [She]323-miss garnons is quite twenty - eight , [you]2555-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , so [I]0-i suppose [she]323-miss garnons knows best ; but [I]0-i should hate a religion that obliged [me]0-i to kiss [White Ferret]333-the white ferret curates in [a parrot - house]2556-a parrot - house , should n't [you]2555-you ? [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston detests [Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench , but as [he]331-mr. trench is [a cousin]2557-a cousin [she]314-lady carriston has to be fairly civil to [him]331-mr. trench , and [they]2558-they always get on to [ecclesiastical subjects]2559-ecclesiastical subjects and argue when [they]2558-they speak ; it is the greatest fun to hear [them]2558-they . [They]2558-they walked on ahead and left [me]0-i with [Miss Garnons]323-miss garnons until [we]2560-we got back to [the hall]396-the hall . By this time the guns had all started , so [we]2560-we saw no more of [them]2558-they . Then [Adeline]315-adeline suggested that [she]314-lady carriston and [I]0-i should bicycle in [the Park]655-the park , which has miles of [lovely road]2563-lovely road ( [she]314-lady carriston is not allowed out of the gates by [herself]314-lady carriston ) , so at last [I]0-i got up to [[my]0-i room]631-my room , and there , as [I]0-i was ringing the bell for Agnès , [Charlie]320-charlie 's piece of paper fell out on the floor . [I]0-i had forgotten all about it . Was n't it a mercy it did not drop while [I]0-i was with [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston ? This was all it was : " Come down to tea half - an - hour earlier ; shall sham a hurt wrist to be back from shooting in time . [Charlie]320-charlie . "[0-i] [I]0-i could not help laughing , although [I]0-i was cross at [his]320-charlie impertinence — in taking for granted that [I]0-i would be quite ready to do whatever [he]320-charlie wished . [I]0-i threw it in the fire , and , of course , [I]0-i sha n't go down a moment before five . [Carriston Towers]82-carriston towers , Saturday . An Anchor in Life Dear Mamma,—Oh ! what a long day this has been ! But [I]0-i always get so muddled if [I]0-i do n't go straight on , that [I]0-i had better finish telling [you]1162-dear mamma about Friday first . Well , while [Adeline]315-adeline and [I]0-i were bicycling , [she]2567-she told [me]0-i [she]2567-she thought [I]0-i should grow quite pretty if only [my]0-i hair was arranged more like [hers]2567-she — [she]2567-she has a jug - handle chignon — and if [I]0-i had less of that French look . But [she]2567-she supposed [I]0-i could not help it , having had to spend so much time abroad . [She]2567-she said [I]0-i should find life was full of temptations , if [I]0-i had not an anchor . [I]0-i asked [her]2567-she what that was , and [she]2567-she said it was something on which to cast [one]658-one 's soul . [I]0-i do n't see how that could be an anchor — do [you]0-i , [Mamma]564-mamma ? because it is the anchor that gets cast , is n't it ? However , [she]2567-she assured [me]0-i that it was , so [I]0-i asked [her]2567-she if [she]2567-she had one [herself]2567-she , and [she]2567-she said [she]2567-she had , and it was [her]2567-she great reverence for [Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench , and [they]2570-they were secretly engaged ! and [she]2567-she hoped [I]0-i would not mention it to [anybody]408-anybody ; and presently , when [he]331-mr. trench joined [us]2572-us , would [I]0-i mind riding on , as [she]2567-she had so few chances to talk to [him]331-mr. trench ? That [she]2567-she would not for [the world]476-the world deceive [[her]2567-she mother]387-her mother , but there were mysteries connected with [her]2567-she religion which [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston could not understand , being only [Low Church]83-low church . But when [they]2570-they saw a prospect of getting married [they]2570-they would tell [her]2567-she about it ; if [they]2570-they did it now , [she]2567-she would persuade [the Duke]2498-the duke not to give [Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench the Bellestoke living , which [he]2498-the duke has half promised [him]2498-the duke , and so make it impossible for [them]2570-they to marry . And [I]0-i should rather turn [Low Church]83-low church than have to kiss [Mr. Trench]331-mr. trench , anyway . [He]331-mr. trench came from [a side path]2579-a side path and joined [us]2580-us , and as soon as [I]0-i could [I]0-i left [them]2570-they ; but [they]2570-they picked [me]0-i up again by the inner gate , just as [I]0-i was going in to lunch , after having had a beautiful ride . [The Park]655-the park is magnificent . Putting on the Clock At lunch [I]0-i sat by [the old Earl]2485-the old earl . "[322-lady garnons] Presently about [six more people]2591-six more people arrived . There seems to be nothing but these ghastly three o'clock trains [here]391-here . [All the new lot]2593-all the new lot were affected by it , just as [I]0-i was . There were endless pauses . [I]0-i am sure [she]149-aunt maria and [Godmamma]189-godmamma would be [the greatest friends]2594-the greatest friends if [they]2595-they could meet . [Cora]335-cora 's Necklace [He]320-charlie simply jumped with horror at the idea of telling [[his]320-charlie Mother]494-his mother . " [Good Lord]3189-good lord ! [Lady Carriston]314-lady carriston did make such a fuss over [Charlie]320-charlie 's wrist . Politics and Principle Have [you]2619-you ever been to a political meeting , [dear Mamma]1162-dear mamma ? It is funny ! [All these old gentlemen]2621-all these old gentlemen sit up on a platform and talk such a lot . [The Duke]2498-the duke put in " buts "[2498-the duke] and " ifs "[2498-the duke] and " that s "[2498-the duke] over and over again when [he]2498-the duke could not think of a word , and [you]2619-you were n't a bit the wiser when [he]2498-the duke had finished , except that it was awfully wrong to put up barbed wire ; but [I]0-i ca n't see what that has to do with politics , can [you]2619-you ? [One of the pepper - and - salts]2490-one of the pepper - and - salts did speak nicely , and so did [one of [the new people]2613-the new people]2624-one of the new people — quite [a youngish person]2626-a youngish person ; but [they]2627-they all had such a lot of words , when it would have done just as well if [they]2627-they had simply said that of course [our]2614-we side was the right one — because trade was good when [we]2614-we were in , and that there are much better people [Conservatives]2628-conservatives than [Radicals]2629-radicals . [A Good Protestant P.S.—Sunday]336-a good protestant p.s.—sunday . [I]0-i missed the post last night . [Chevenix Castle]91-chevenix castle , 8th November . [Chevenix Castle]91-chevenix castle Dearest Mamma,—I am sure [I]0-i shall enjoy [myself]0-i [here]391-here . [The train]393-the train was so late , and [only two other people]2671-only two other people were coming by [it]393-the train besides [me]0-i , so [we]2666-we all drove up in [the omnibus]2615-the omnibus together . [One]658-one was [a man]496-a man , and [the other]923-the other [a woman]2676-a woman , and [she]923-the other glared at [me]0-i , and fussed [[her]923-the other maid]477-her maid so about [her]923-the other dressing - bag , and it was such a gorgeous affair , and [they]2678-they had such quantities of luggage , and the only thing [they]2678-they said on the drive up was how cold it was , and [they]2678-they wondered when [we]2666-we should get [there]398-there . And when [we]2666-we did arrive , there was only just time to rush up and dress for dinner ; [all the other people]2680-all the other people had come by [an earlier train]2681-an earlier train . [I]0-i left [them]2678-they both in the care of [the groom of [the chambers]2683-the chambers]2682-the groom of the chambers , as even [Cousin Octavia]150-octavia had gone [upstairs]470-upstairs , and there was [not a soul about]2685-not a soul about , but [she]150-octavia had left a message for [me]0-i ; and while [Agnès]115-agnès was clawing the things out of the trunks , [I]0-i went to [[her]150-octavia room]767-her room . [She]150-octavia was just having [her]150-octavia hair done , but [she]150-octavia did not mind a bit , and was awfully glad to see [me]0-i . [She]150-octavia is [a dear]1391-a dear . [Her]150-octavia hair is as dark as anything underneath , but all the outside is a bright red . [She]150-octavia says it is much more attractive like that , but it does look odd before the front thing is on , and that is a fuzzy bit in a net , like what [Royalties]337-royalties have . And then [she]150-octavia has lots of twist - things round at the back , and although it does n't look at all bad when the diamond stick - ups are in and [she]150-octavia is all arranged . [She]150-octavia went on talking all the time while [[her]150-octavia maid]477-her maid was fixing it , just as if [we]2689-we were alone in [the room]401-the room . [She]150-octavia told [me]0-i [I]0-i had grown six inches since [she]150-octavia was with [us]2689-we at [Arcachon]92-arcachon three years ago , and that [I]0-i was quite good - looking . [She]150-octavia said [they]2691-they had a huge party for the balls , [some rather nice people]2692-some rather nice people , and [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [one or two others]2693-one or two others [she]150-octavia hated . [I]0-i said why did [she]150-octavia have [people]411-people [she]150-octavia hated — that [I]0-i would not if [I]0-i were [a Countess like [her]150-octavia]2695-a countess like her ; so [she]150-octavia said those were often the very ones [one]658-one was obliged to have , because [the nice men]488-the nice men would n't come without [them]2698-them . The Test of [a Gentleman]1755-a gentleman [She]150-octavia hoped [I]0-i had some decent clothes , as [she]150-octavia had got a tame millionaire for [me]0-i . So [I]0-i said if it was [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz [she]150-octavia need not bother because [I]0-i knew [him]125-mr. wertz ; and , besides , [I]0-i only intended to marry [a gentleman]1755-a gentleman , unless , of course , [I]0-i should get past twenty and passé , and then , goodness knows what [I]0-i might take . [She]150-octavia laughed , and said it was ridiculous to be so particular , but that anyway that would be no difficulty , as [every one]428-every one was [a gentleman now who paid for things]2702-a gentleman now who paid for things . Then [she]150-octavia sent [me]0-i off to dress , just as [she]150-octavia began to put some red stuff on [her]150-octavia lips . It is wonderful how nice [she]150-octavia looks when everything is done , even though [she]150-octavia has quite a different coloured chest to the top bit that shows above [her]150-octavia pearl collar , which is brickish - red from hunting . So is [her]150-octavia face , but [she]150-octavia is such [a dear]1391-a dear that [one]658-one admires even [her]150-octavia great big nose and little black eyes , which one would think hideous in [other people]1282-other people . [I]0-i met [Tom]338-tom just going into [[her]150-octavia room]767-her room as [I]0-i came out ; [he]338-tom said [he]338-tom had come to borrow some scent from [her]150-octavia . [He]338-tom looks younger than [she]150-octavia does , but [they]2707-they were the same age when [they]2707-they got married , were n't [they]2707-they ? [He]338-tom kissed [me]0-i and said [I]0-i was [a dear little cousin]2708-a dear little cousin , and had [I]0-i been boxing [any one]536-any one 's ears lately . Before [I]0-i could box [his]338-tom for talking so , [Octavia]150-octavia called out to [him]338-tom to let [me]0-i go , or [I]0-i should be late , and had [I]0-i not to scurry just ? [Agnès]115-agnès fortunately had everything ready , but [I]0-i fussed so that [my]0-i face was crimson when [I]0-i got [downstairs]764-downstairs , and [every one]428-every one was already there . [I]0-i went in with [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson , who is contesting [this Division]2718-this division ; [he]339-mr. hodgkinson is quite young and wears an eyeglass , which [he]339-mr. hodgkinson keeps dropping . [He]339-mr. hodgkinson really looks silly , but [they]2719-they say [he]339-mr. hodgkinson says some clever things if [you]2713-you give [him]339-mr. hodgkinson time , and that [he]339-mr. hodgkinson will be a great acquisition to the party [he]339-mr. hodgkinson has joined now , as it is much easier to get made [a peer]2720-a peer by [the Radicals]2721-the radicals ; and that is what [he]339-mr. hodgkinson wants , as [[his]339-mr. hodgkinson father]2722-his father made a huge fortune in bones and glue . [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine is here too ; [his]340-lord doraine eyes are so close together ! [He]339-mr. hodgkinson plays a game called " Bridge "[339-mr. hodgkinson] with [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz and [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson and [Tom]338-tom all the time — [I]0-i mean in the afternoon before dinner — so [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson told [me]0-i when [we]2723-we got to dessert . [An Englishman]1463-an englishman 's Views After dinner [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond came up to [me]0-i at once . [Chevenix Castle]91-chevenix castle , 9th November . [The Peers]2739-the peers ' Sad Case [Dearest Mamma,—Such]114-mamma,—i a lot to tell [you]2740-you , and no time , as [I]0-i must go down to tea . [We]2741-we passed rather a boring morning after [the men]450-the men had started for [their]450-the men shoot . [Only a few people]2743-only a few people were down for breakfast , and none of [the men who were n't guns]2744-the men who were n't guns . [I]0-i suppose [they]2736-them were asleep . But [Lady Grace Fenton]184-lady grace fenton was as cross as a bear because [she]184-lady grace fenton wanted to go and shoot too . [She]184-lady grace fenton is just like [a man]496-a man , and does look so odd and almost improper in the evening in female dress . And [Tom]338-tom wo n't have [women]726-women out shooting , except for lunch . [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold talked by the fire while [they]2747-they smoked , and [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold said [she]342-lady greswold really did not know where [the peers]2739-the peers were to turn to now to make an honest penny , [their]2739-the peers names being no more good in [the City]2749-the city , and that it was abominably hard that now , [she]342-lady greswold had heard , [they]2739-the peers would have to understand business and work just like [ordinary Stock Exchange people]2750-ordinary stock exchange people if [they]2739-the peers wanted to get on , and [she]342-lady greswold did not know what things were coming to . At lunch , in the châlet in the wood , it was rather fun . [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson and [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine sat on either side of [me]0-i . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond came up with the last guns , rather late , and [he]126-lord valmond looked round the table and frowned . [He]126-lord valmond seems quite grumpy now , not half so good - tempered as [he]126-lord valmond used to be . [I]0-i expect it is because [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith is n't [here]391-here . [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz was so beautifully turned out in the newest clothes and the loveliest stockings , and [he]125-mr. wertz had two loaders and three guns , and [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine told [me]0-i that [he]125-mr. wertz had killed three pheasants , but the ground was knee - deep in cartridges round [him]125-mr. wertz , and [Tom]338-tom was furious , as [he]338-tom likes an enormous bag . So [I]0-i asked why , if [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz was not [a sportsman]2752-a sportsman , had [he]125-mr. wertz taken the huge Quickham shoot in [Norfolk]94-norfolk ? [P.S.—I]187-p.s.—i asked [Jane Roose]127-jane roose what " running [them]2785-them "[187-p.s.—i] means , and it 's being put on to things in [the City]2749-the city , and having all [your]2784-you bills paid if [you]2784-you introduce [them]2785-them to [people]411-people ; only [you]2784-you sometimes have to write [their]411-people letters for [them]411-people to prevent [them]411-people putting the whole grand address , & c. , that is in [the Peerage]96-the peerage ; and [she]127-jane roose says it is quite a profession now , and done by [the best people]2787-the best people , which of course must be true , as [Carry]134-carry is [[Tom]338-tom 's sister]2788-tom 's sister . [E. Chevenix Castle]97-e. chevenix castle , 10th November . [A Modern Industry Dearest Mamma,—Oh]2789-a modern industry dearest mamma,—oh ! it was too , too lovely , last night . [I]0-i am having [my]0-i breakfast in bed to - day , just like [the other grown - up people]2790-the other grown - up people , and it really feels so grand to be writing to [you]2784-you between sips of tea and nibbles of toast and strawberry jam ! Well , to tell [you]2784-you about the ball . First [my]0-i white tulle was a dream . [Octavia]150-octavia said it was by far the prettiest débutante frock [she]150-octavia had ever seen ; and when [I]0-i was dressed [she]150-octavia sent for [me]0-i to [[her]150-octavia room]767-her room , and [Tom]338-tom was there too , and [she]150-octavia took out of a duck of a white satin case a lovely string of pearls and put it round [my]0-i throat , and said it was [their]2792-them present to [me]0-i for [my]0-i first ball ! Was n't it angelic of [them]2792-them ? [I]0-i hugged and kissed [them]2792-them both , and almost squashed [Tom]338-tom 's buttonhole into [his]338-tom pink coat , [I]0-i was so pleased , but [he]338-tom said [he]338-tom did n't mind ; and then [we]2793-we all went down together , and [no one else]1407-no one else was ready , so [we]2793-we looked through [the rooms]534-the rooms . The dancing , of course , was to be in [the picture gallery]2796-the picture gallery , and the flowers were so splendid everywhere , and [Octavia]150-octavia was quite satisfied . It is a mercy [it]2797-it is such [a big house]2798-a big house , for [we]2793-we were n't put out a bit beforehand by the preparations . [I]0-i do n't know if [you]2799-you were ever like that , [Mamma]132-mamma , but [I]0-i felt as if [I]0-i must jump about and sing , and [my]0-i cheeks were burning . [Octavia]150-octavia sat down and played a valse , and [Tom]338-tom and [I]0-i opened the ball by [ourselves]2793-we in [the empty room]2800-the empty room , and it was fun , and then [we]2793-we saw [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond peeping in at the door , and [he]126-lord valmond came up and said [Tom]338-tom was not to be greedy , and so [I]0-i danced the two last rounds with [him]126-lord valmond , and [he]126-lord valmond had such a strange look in [his]126-lord valmond eyes , a little bit like [Jean]188-jean when [he]126-lord valmond had the fit , and [he]126-lord valmond never said one word until [we]2793-we stopped . [Forgiveness]351-forgiveness Then [Octavia]150-octavia went out of the other door , and [I]0-i do n't know where [Tom]338-tom went , but [we]2793-we were alone , and so [he]126-lord valmond said , would [I]0-i forgive [him]126-lord valmond for everything and be [friends]835-friends , that [he]126-lord valmond had never been so sorry for anything in [his]126-lord valmond life as having offended [me]0-i . [He]126-lord valmond really seemed so penitent , and [he]126-lord valmond does dance so beautifully , and [he]126-lord valmond is so tall and nice in [his]126-lord valmond pink coat ; and , besides , [I]0-i remembered [his]126-lord valmond dinner with [Aunt Maria]149-aunt maria , and how nasty [I]0-i had been to [him]126-lord valmond at [Hazeldene]18-hazeldene ! So [I]0-i said , all right [I]0-i would try , if [he]126-lord valmond would promise never to be horrid again ; and [he]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond would n't ; and then [we]2802-we shook hands , and [he]126-lord valmond said [I]0-i looked lovely , and that [my]0-i frock was perfect ; and then [Tom]338-tom came back and [we]2802-we went into [the hall]396-the hall , and [everybody]404-everybody was down , and [they]404-everybody had drawn for [partners]3171-partners to go in to dinner while [we]2802-we were in [the ballroom]2806-the ballroom . [Tom]338-tom had made [Octavia]150-octavia arrange that [we]2802-we should draw , as [he]338-tom said [he]338-tom could not stand [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold two nights running . [Octavia]150-octavia said [she]150-octavia had drawn for [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond because [he]126-lord valmond was n't [there]398-there , and that [his]126-lord valmond slip of paper was [me]0-i , and [he]338-tom said on [our]2802-we way into [the dining - room]898-the dining - room that [Octavia]150-octavia was a brick . [We]2802-we had such fun at dinner . Now that [I]0-i have forgiven [him]338-tom , and have not to be thinking all the time of how nasty [I]0-i can be , [we]2802-we get on splendidly . The Ball [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz was at the other side of [me]0-i with [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike ; but as [he]125-mr. wertz is n't " running "[125-mr. wertz] [them]2809-them [he]125-mr. wertz had not to bother to talk to [her]343-mrs. pike , and [he]125-mr. wertz is really very intelligent , and [we]2802-we three had such an amusing time . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond was in a lovely temper . [Jane Roose]127-jane roose said afterwards in [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room that it was because [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith was coming with [the Courceys]2811-the courceys to the ball . [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine had drawn [Mr. Pike]347-mr. pike , who is melancholy - looking , with a long Jew nose ; but [she]133-lady doraine woke [him]347-mr. pike up and got [him]347-mr. pike quite animated by dessert , and [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike did not like it one bit . [I]0-i overheard [her]133-lady doraine speaking to [him]347-mr. pike about it afterwards , and [he]347-mr. pike said so roughly , " [You]0-i mind [your]0-i own climbing , [Mary]140-aunt mary ; [you]0-i ought to be glad as it 's [a titled lady]3198-a titled lady ! "[347-mr. pike] Well , then , by the time [we]2812-we were all assembled in [the hall]396-the hall , [every one]428-every one began to arrive . Oh , it was so , so lovely ! [Every one]428-every one looked at [me]0-i as [I]0-i stood beside [Octavia]150-octavia at first , because [they]428-every one all knew the ball was given for [me]0-i , and then for the first dance [I]0-i danced with [Tom]338-tom , and after that [I]0-i had heaps of [partners]3171-partners , and [I]0-i ca n't tell [you]2817-you about each dance , but it was all heavenly . [I]0-i tried to remember what [you]2817-you said and not dance more than three times with [the same person]2818-the same person , but , somehow , [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond got four , and another — but that was an extra . [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith did come with [the Courceys]352-the courceys , and [she]119-mrs. smith was looking so smart with a beautiful gown on , and [Jane Roose]127-jane roose said it was a mercy [Valmond]126-lord valmond was so rich ; but [I]0-i do n't see what that had to do with it . [I]0-i saw [him]126-lord valmond dancing with [her]119-mrs. smith once , but [he]126-lord valmond looked as cross as two sticks , perhaps because [she]119-mrs. smith was rather late . Do [you]2817-you know , [Mamma]132-mamma , a lot of the beauties [we]2819-we are always reading about in the papers as having walked in [the Park]655-the park looking perfectly lovely were there , and some of them are quite , quite old — much older than [you]2817-you — and all trimmed up ! Are n't [you]2817-you astonished ? [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine was rather a bother , [he]340-lord doraine wanted to dance with [me]0-i so often ; so at last [I]0-i said to [Octavia]150-octavia [I]0-i really was not at [my]0-i first ball to dance with [old men]2827-old men ( [he]353-sir charles helmsford is quite forty ) , and what was [I]0-i to do ? "[353-sir charles helmsford] At Supper [I]0-i went in to supper first with [the Duke of [Meath]99-meath]2829-the duke of meath — [he]353-sir charles helmsford had just finished taking in [Octavia]150-octavia — [he]353-sir charles helmsford is such [a nice boy]2830-a nice boy ; and then , as [we]2831-we were coming out , [we]2831-we went down [a corridor]2832-a corridor , and there in a window - seat were [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith , and [he]353-sir charles helmsford was still gloomy , and [she]150-octavia had the same green - rhubarb - juice look [she]150-octavia had the last night at [Nazeby]8-nazeby . [He]353-sir charles helmsford jumped up at once , and said to [me]0-i [he]353-sir charles helmsford hoped [I]0-i had not forgotten [I]0-i had promised to go in to supper with [him]353-sir charles helmsford , so [I]0-i said [I]0-i had just come from supper ; and while [we]2831-we were speaking [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith had got [the Duke]2498-the duke to sit down beside [her]119-mrs. smith , and so [I]0-i had to go off with [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , and [he]353-sir charles helmsford seemed so odd and nervous , and as if [he]353-sir charles helmsford were apologising about something ; but [I]0-i do n't know what it could have been , as [he]353-sir charles helmsford had not asked [me]0-i before to go in to supper with [him]353-sir charles helmsford . [He]353-sir charles helmsford seemed to cheer up presently , and persuaded [me]0-i to go back into [the supper - room]2834-the supper - room , as [he]353-sir charles helmsford said [he]353-sir charles helmsford was so hungry , and [we]2831-we found a dear little table , with big flower things on it , in a corner ; but when [we]2831-we got [there]398-there [he]353-sir charles helmsford only played with an ortolan and drank some champagne , but [he]353-sir charles helmsford did take such a while about it ; and each time [I]0-i said [I]0-i was sure the next dance was beginning [he]353-sir charles helmsford said [he]353-sir charles helmsford was still hungry . [I]0-i have never seen [any one]536-any one have so much on [his]353-sir charles helmsford plate and eat so little . At last [I]0-i insisted on going back , and when [we]2831-we got to [the ballroom]2806-the ballroom [an extra]2838-an extra was on , and [he]353-sir charles helmsford said [I]0-i had promised [him]353-sir charles helmsford that , but [I]0-i had n't . However , [we]2831-we danced , and after that , having been so long away at supper , and one thing and another , [my]0-i engagements seemed to get mixed , and [I]0-i danced with all sorts of [people]411-people [I]0-i had n't promised to in the beginning . At last it came to an end , and when [the last carriage]2840-the last carriage had driven away , [we]2831-we all went and had another hot supper . End of the Ball [Mr. Pike]347-mr. pike would sit next to [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine , and [he]347-mr. pike was as gay as a blackbird , and [I]0-i heard [Octavia]150-octavia saying to [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold that [Carry]134-carry had better hurry up and get [that house in [Park Street]100-park street]2841-that house in park street , or [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine would have it instead . Then [we]2831-we all went to bed , and [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond squeezed [my]0-i hand and looked as silly as anything , and [Jane Roose]127-jane roose , who saw , said [I]0-i had better be careful , as [he]126-lord valmond was playing [me]0-i off against [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith . [[Your]2842-your affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Chevenix Castle]91-chevenix castle , 13th November . Tableaux Dearest [Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i enjoyed [my]0-i self last night quite as much as at the ball here ; but first , [I]0-i must tell [you]2844-you about Thursday and yesterday . The morning after the ball [here]391-here [no one]744-no one came down till lunch , and in the afternoon [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine suggested [we]2847-we should have some tableaux in the evening , and so [we]2847-we were busy all the time arranging them . [They]2848-they were all bosh ; but it was so amusing . [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike lent every one [her]343-mrs. pike tea - gowns — [she]343-mrs. pike has dozens — and [they]2848-they did splendidly for [the Queen of [Sheba]101-sheba]2849-the queen of sheba ; and [Mr. Pike]347-mr. pike played [Charles]353-sir charles helmsford [I.]353-sir charles helmsford having [his]353-sir charles helmsford head cut off , as [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine told [him]353-sir charles helmsford [he]353-sir charles helmsford had just the type of lofty melancholy face for that . [I]0-i was [the Old Woman in the Shoe , with all the biggest people for [children]3105-children]2850-the old woman in the shoe , with all the biggest people for children ; but the best of all was [Dolly Tenterdown]349-dolly tenterdown as " [Bubbles]354-bubbles . "[349-dolly tenterdown] [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine and [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz and [Tom]338-tom and [some others]2852-some others played " Bridge "[349-dolly tenterdown] all the time while [we]2853-we were arranging them ; but [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond was most useful , and in such a decent temper . After [they]2854-they were over [we]2853-we danced a little , and it was all delightful . A Game of Patience Yesterday , the day of the county ball in [Chevenix]102-chevenix , [they]2854-they shot again ; and it rained just as [we]2853-we all came down ready to start for the lunch ; so [we]2853-we could n't go , and had to lunch indoors without [most of [the men]450-the men]2855-most of the men . [Mr. Pike]347-mr. pike had n't gone shooting , because [I]0-i heard [Tom]338-tom saying the night before to [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine that [he]338-tom would n't chance [the party]893-the party being murdered again , and that [she]133-lady doraine must keep [him]338-tom at [home]390-home somehow . So [she]133-lady doraine did , and taught [him]338-tom Patience in [the hall]396-the hall after lunch ; and [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike went and wanted to learn it too , but [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine — who was lovely to [her]133-lady doraine — somehow did not make much room on the sofa , so [she]133-lady doraine had to go and sit somewhere else . [A Broad Hint Half the people]2860-a broad hint half the people were playing " Bridge , "[2860-a broad hint half the people] and [the rest]469-the rest were very comfortable , and smoking cigarettes , of course ; so [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike did too . [Her]343-mrs. pike case is gold , with a splendid monogram in big rubies on it ; but [I]0-i am sure it makes [her]343-mrs. pike feel sick , because [she]343-mrs. pike puffs it out and makes it burn up as soon as [she]343-mrs. pike can without its being in [her]343-mrs. pike mouth . [She]343-mrs. pike had to go and lie down after that , as [she]343-mrs. pike said [she]343-mrs. pike would be too tired for the ball ; but [nobody]1428-nobody paid much attention . It was more lively at tea - time , when the guns came in . And [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine would sit by [me]0-i ; [he]340-lord doraine talked about poetry , and said dozens of nice things about [me]0-i , and all sorts of amusing ones about every one else ; and [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , who had gone to write some letters at a table near , seemed so put out with every one talking , that [he]126-lord valmond could not keep [his]126-lord valmond attention , and at last tore them up , and came and sat close to [us]2863-we , and told [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine that [he]126-lord valmond could see [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz was longing for " [Bridge]93-bridge . "[126-lord valmond] And so [he]126-lord valmond got up , and laughed in such a way , and said , " All right , [Harry]117-harry , [old boy]3199-old boy , "[126-lord valmond] and [Valmond]126-lord valmond got crimson — [I]0-i do n't know what at — and looked as cross as a bear for a few minutes . [The Ride Home]2879-the ride home [I]0-i had such lots of [partners]3171-partners [I]0-i do n't know what [any one else]2881-any one else did ; [I]0-i was enjoying [myself]0-i so , and [I]0-i hope [you]2882-you wo n't be annoyed with [me]0-i , as [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i danced oftener than three times with [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond . But [Englishmen]1133-englishmen are so much better - looking , and [everybody]404-everybody does n't get so hot , and it is nice having places to sit out and talk without feeling [you]2882-you are doing something wrong . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond was at the other side of [me]0-i , and [somebody]2887-somebody must have been pushing [him]126-lord valmond , because [he]126-lord valmond sat even nearer [me]0-i than [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine , and between [them]2888-them [I]0-i could hardly breathe ; it was fortunate it was a cold night . Before [we]2889-we got to [the Park]655-the park gates somehow the light went out , and all the way up [the avenue]2891-the avenue [people]411-people held each of [my]0-i hands . [I]0-i could not see who [they]411-people were , and [I]0-i tried to get [them]411-people away , but [I]0-i could n't , and [I]0-i was afraid to kick like [I]0-i did to [Charlie Carriston]320-charlie , as it might have been [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson who was sitting opposite , and so there would have been no good in kicking [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine , or [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond ; but [I]0-i just made [my]0-i fingers as stiff as iron and left them alone . It is a surprise to [me]0-i , [Mamma]132-mamma , to find that [[gentlemen]2893-gentlemen in [England]25-england]2894-gentlemen in england behave like this , [I]0-i call it awfully disappointing , and [I]0-i am sure [they]2893-gentlemen could not have done so when [you]2895-you were young , it seems [they]2893-gentlemen are just as bad as [the French]355-the french .
