E. Foljambe Place , 15th November . The Coat of Arms Dearest [Mamma,—We]357-mamma,—we arrived [here]391-here this afternoon in time for tea . It is [a splendid place]2906-a splendid place , and everything has been done up for [them]2907-them by [that man who chooses things for [people]411-people when [they]411-people do n't know how [themselves]411-people]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves . [He]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves is [here]391-here now , and [he]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves is quite [a gentleman]1755-a gentleman , and has [his]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves food with [us]2912-us ; [I]0-i ca n't remember [his]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves name , but [I]0-i daresay [you]2900-you know about [him]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves . Everything is [Louis XV]192-louis xv . and [Louis XVI]202-louis xvi . , but it does n't go so well in [the saloon]2913-the saloon as it might , because the panelling is old oak , with the Foljambe coats of arms still all round the frieze , and over the mantelpiece , which is Elizabethan . And [I]0-i heard this—(Mr . [Jones]358-jones [I]0-i shall have to call [him)—say]2914-him)—say that it jarred upon [his]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves nervous system like an intense pain , but that [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley would keep [them]2915-they up , because there was a " [Murray]359-mrs. murray - hartley "[359-mrs. murray - hartley] coat of arms in one of the shields of [the people [they]2915-they married]2916-the people they married , and [she]359-mrs. murray - hartley says it is an ancestor of [hers]359-mrs. murray - hartley , and that is why [they]2915-they bought [the place]984-the place ; but as [Octavia]150-octavia told [me]0-i that [their]2915-they real name was [Hart]360-hart , and that [they]2915-they hyphened [the " Murray]359-mrs. murray - hartley , "[2915-they] which is [his]2908-that man who chooses things for people when they do n't know how themselves Christian name ( if [Jews]361-jews can have Christian names ) and put on the " ley "[150-octavia] by royal licence , [I]0-i ca n't see how it could have been [an ancestor]2918-an ancestor , can [you]2919-you ? [They]2915-they are quite established in Society , [Octavia]150-octavia says ; [they]2915-they have been [there]398-there for two seasons now , and [every one]428-every one knows [them]2915-they . [They]2915-they got [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold to give [their]2915-they first concert , and enclosed programmes with the invitations , so hardly [any of [the Duchesses]2923-the duchesses]2922-any of the duchesses felt [they]2915-they could refuse , [Octavia]150-octavia said , when [they]2915-they were certain of hearing [the best singers]2924-the best singers for nothing ; and it was a splendid plan , as many concerts have been spoilt by a rumour getting about that [Melba]362-melba was not really going to sing . [Everybody smart]2925-everybody smart is here . [I]0-i am [one of [the few untitled people]2927-the few untitled people]2926-one of the few untitled people . [A Friendly Little Party]2928-a friendly little party [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley does n't look a bit Jewish , or fat and uneasy , like [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike , but then this is only [Mrs. Pike]343-mrs. pike 's first year . [She]359-mrs. murray - hartley — [Mrs. M.-H.—is]363-mrs. m.-h.—is beautifully dressed , and awfully genial ; [she]359-mrs. murray - hartley said it was " just more than delightful "[359-mrs. murray - hartley] of [Octavia]150-octavia to bring [me]0-i , and that it was so sweet of [her]359-mrs. murray - hartley to come to [this friendly little party]2929-this friendly little party . " It is so much nicer to have just [one 's own friends]3203-one 's own friends , "[359-mrs. murray - hartley] [she]359-mrs. murray - hartley said , " instead of those huge collections of [people one]3204-people one hardly knows . "[359-mrs. murray - hartley] There are quite twenty of [us]2930-us here , [Mamma]132-mamma , so [I]0-i do n't call it such a very weeny party , do [you]132-mamma ? [[My]0-i bedroom]861-my bedroom is magnificent , but it has n't all the new books as [they]2932-they have at [Chevenix]102-chevenix , and although the writing - table things are tortoise - shell and gold , there are n't any pens in the holders , that is why [I]0-i am writing this in pencil . The towels have such beautifully embroidered double crests on them , and on the [Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley bit , the motto is " La fin vaut l'eschelle . "[150-octavia] [Octavia]150-octavia , who is in [the room]401-the room now looking at everything , said [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold chose it for [them]2932-they when [they]2932-they wanted a crest to have on [their]2932-they Sèvres plates and things for [their]2932-they concert . [Octavia]150-octavia keeps laughing to [herself]150-octavia all the time , as [she]150-octavia looks at the things , and it puts [me]0-i out writing , so [I]0-i will finish this when [I]0-i come to bed . [A Question of Taste]2934-a question of taste 12.30.—We had a regular banquet , [I]0-i sat next to [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine — [I]0-i did not catch the name of [the man who took [me]0-i in]2935-the man who took me in — [I]0-i forgot to tell [you]2936-you [the Doraines]364-the doraines and [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia and [lots of others [I]0-i know]2937-lots of others i know are here . [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley does hostess [herself]359-mrs. murray - hartley , which [Octavia]150-octavia says is very plucky of [her]359-mrs. murray - hartley , as both [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold , who gave [her]342-lady greswold concert , and [Lady Bobby Pomeroy]178-lady bobby , who brought [all the young men]2938-all the young men , are staying in [the house]526-the house ; and [Octavia]150-octavia says it shows [she]150-octavia is really clever to have emancipated [herself]150-octavia so soon . [We]2940-we had gold plate with the game , and china up to that , and afterwards [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold talked to [Octavia]150-octavia , and asked [her]150-octavia if [she]150-octavia thought it would look better perhaps to begin gold with the soup , and have the hors d'oeuvres on specimen Sèvres just to make a point . [I]0-i hate gold plate [myself]0-i , [one]658-one 's knife does make such slate - pencilish noises on it . [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond 's Arrival [The man who took [me]0-i in]2935-the man who took me in kept putting [my]0-i teeth so on edge that [I]0-i was obliged to speak to [him]2935-the man who took me in about it at last . [We]2940-we had sturgeon from [the Volga]106-the volga , or wherever [the Roman emperors]2943-the roman emperors got [theirs]2943-the roman emperors , but the plates were cold . Violins played softly all the time , behind a kind of [Niagara Falls]107-niagara falls at the end of [the room]401-the room , which is magnificent ; it is hung with aubusson , almost as good as what [they]2945-they had at [Croixmare]22-croixmare , which has been there always . After dinner , while [we]2940-we were in [the drawing - room]441-the drawing - room alone , a note came for [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley . [She]359-mrs. murray - hartley was talking to [Octavia]150-octavia and [me]0-i , so [she]359-mrs. murray - hartley read it aloud ; it was from [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , and sent from [the inn]1161-the inn in [the little town]2948-the little town . [He]2935-the man who took me in said [he]2935-the man who took me in had intended staying [there]398-there by [himself]2935-the man who took me in for the Hunt Ball , but that on arrival [he]2935-the man who took me in found no fire in [[his]2935-the man who took me in room]2950-his room , so [he]2935-the man who took me in was writing to ask if [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley would put [him]2935-the man who took me in up . [She]359-mrs. murray - hartley was enchanted , and at once asked [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold if it would not be better to turn [Lord Oldfield]365-lord oldfield out of [[his]365-lord oldfield room]2950-his room — which is the best in [[the bachelors]2952-the bachelors ' suite]2953-the bachelors ' suite — as [he]365-lord oldfield is only [a baron]2954-a baron ; but [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold said [she]342-lady greswold did not think it would matter . [I]0-i do call it odd , do n't [you]359-mrs. murray - hartley , [Mamma]132-mamma ? because [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond told [me]0-i , when [he]2935-the man who took me in left [Chevenix]102-chevenix on Saturday , that [he]2935-the man who took me in had to go to another party in [Yorkshire]108-yorkshire , and was as cross as a bear because [he]2935-the man who took me in would not be able to be at the Grassfield ball . [He]2935-the man who took me in turned up beautifully dressed as usual , as quickly as it was possible for the brougham which was sent for [him]2935-the man who took me in to get back . [He]2935-the man who took me in could not have kept it waiting a moment ; so [I]0-i do n't believe the story about there being no fire in [[his]2935-the man who took me in room]2950-his room , do [you]359-mrs. murray - hartley ? [Friendly Offers Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley did gush at [him]2935-the man who took me in . [Octavia]150-octavia says it is the first time [she]150-octavia has been able to get [him]2935-the man who took me in to [[her]150-octavia house]2956-her house , as [he]2935-the man who took me in is ridiculously old - fashioned and particular , and actually in [London]5-london wo n't go to [places]2957-places unless [he]2935-the man who took me in knows [the host]2958-the host and [hostess]2959-hostess personally . [He]2935-the man who took me in stood with a vacant frown on [his]2935-the man who took me in face all the time [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley was speaking , and [a child]403-a child could have seen [he]2935-the man who took me in wanted to get away . It is in these kind of ways [Frenchmen]235-frenchmen are more polite , because [the Marquis]1341-the marquis always wore an interested grin when [Godmamma]189-godmamma kept [him]1341-the marquis by [her]189-godmamma . [He]1341-the marquis got away at last , and came across [the room]401-the room , but by that time [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor and [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson were talking to [me]0-i , and there was no room for [him]1341-the marquis on [our]2963-our sofa , and [he]1341-the marquis had to speak to [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia , who was near . [She]116-lady cecilia was as absent as usual , and [he]1341-the marquis was talking at random , so [their]2964-their conversation was rather funny ; [I]0-i heard scraps of it . A Sense of [Honour Mr. Murray - Hartley]366-honour mr. murray - hartley must be very nice , although [he]1341-the marquis looks so unimportant , for all [the men]450-the men call [him]1341-the marquis " [Jim]367-jim , "[450-the men] and are awfully friendly . [Lord Oldfield]365-lord oldfield and [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine seem ready to do anything for [him]1341-the marquis . [Lord Oldfield]365-lord oldfield offered to hunt about and get [him]1341-the marquis just [the right stables for [[his]365-lord oldfield house in [Belgrave Square]109-belgrave square]2967-his house in belgrave square]2966-the right stables for his house in belgrave square ; [he]365-lord oldfield knew of some splendid ones , [he]365-lord oldfield said , that were going a great bargain , on a freehold that belongs to [[his]365-lord oldfield sister 's husband]2968-his sister 's husband . " [You]3205-you leave it all to [me]365-lord oldfield , [dear boy]3186-dear boy , "[365-lord oldfield] [he]365-lord oldfield said ; and at that [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor , who was listening ( [they]2970-they were all standing close to [our]2971-our sofa ) went into a guffaw of laughter . " [Hunters]3207-hunters , "[365-lord oldfield] [he]365-lord oldfield whispered , quite loud , " beastly little [Jew]368-jew , [he]365-lord oldfield 'd have to have a rocking - horse , and hold on by its mane . "[365-lord oldfield] And when [I]0-i said [I]0-i did not think [one]658-one ought to speak so of [people]411-people when [one]658-one was eating [their]411-people salt , [he]365-lord oldfield seemed to think that quite a new view of the case , and said , " [By Jove]369-by jove ! "[365-lord oldfield] [Presently Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia called [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson to [her]2975-her , and in one moment [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond had slipped into [his]126-lord valmond place . [I]0-i asked [him]365-lord oldfield why [he]365-lord oldfield was not in [Yorkshire]108-yorkshire , and [he]365-lord oldfield said that [he]365-lord oldfield thought , after all , it was too far to go , and it was [his]365-lord oldfield duty to be at the Grassfield ball , as [he]365-lord oldfield has hunted with this pack sometimes . [He]365-lord oldfield looked and looked at [me]0-i , and [I]0-i do n't know why , [Mamma]132-mamma , but [I]0-i felt so queer — [I]0-i almost wish [he]365-lord oldfield had not come . [I]0-i suppose [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith is somewhere in [this neighbourhood]2976-this neighbourhood , and that is why [he]365-lord oldfield did not go to [Yorkshire]108-yorkshire . [Sir Trevor]118-sir trevor monopolised most of the conversation , until [we]2977-we all got up to play baccarat . [I]0-i did not want to play as [I]0-i do n't know it , and [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond said it would be much nicer to sit and talk , but [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]359-mrs. murray - hartley would not hear of [our]2977-we not joining in ; and [Octavia]150-octavia handed [me]0-i a five - pound note and said [I]0-i was not to lose more than that , so [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had better not go on refusing , and [we]2977-we went with the rest into [the saloon]2913-the saloon , where there was a long table laid out with cards and counters . Playing [Baccarat Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond would teach [me]0-i the game , and that [we]2977-we would bank together ; however , [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine sat down in the chair [he]126-lord valmond was holding for [me]0-i , and [she]133-lady doraine put [her]133-lady doraine hand on [his]126-lord valmond coat sleeve and said in such a lovely voice , " [Harry]117-harry , it is ages since [I]133-lady doraine have had a chat with [you]126-lord valmond , sit down here by [me]133-lady doraine . "[133-lady doraine] But [he]126-lord valmond answered No , [he]126-lord valmond had promised to show [me]0-i how to play , and [his]126-lord valmond mouth was set quite square . [She]133-lady doraine looked so alluring [I]0-i do n't know how [he]126-lord valmond could have done it , it was almost as flattering to [me]0-i as [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte 's riding all night from [Versailles]29-versailles . [She]133-lady doraine laughed — but it was not a very nice laugh — and [she]133-lady doraine said , " [Poor boy]3209-poor boy , is it as bad as that ? "[133-lady doraine] and [he]126-lord valmond looked back at [her]133-lady doraine in an insolent way , as if [they]2980-they were crossing swords , but [he]126-lord valmond said nothing more , only [we]2981-we moved to the other side of the table , to where there were two empty chairs together . When [we]2981-we sat down [he]126-lord valmond said [women]726-women were devils , which [I]0-i thought very rude of [him]126-lord valmond . [I]0-i told [him]126-lord valmond so , and [he]126-lord valmond said [I]0-i was n't [a woman]2676-a woman ; but [I]0-i remember now , [Mamma]132-mamma , [he]126-lord valmond called [me]0-i [a " little devil]3100-a " little devil "[126-lord valmond] that time when [he]126-lord valmond was so rude at [Nazeby]8-nazeby , so it shows how [inconsistent men]2984-inconsistent men are , does n't it ? [I]0-i sometimes think [he]126-lord valmond would like to say all the nice things [the Vicomte]965-the vicomte used to , only with [Englishmen]1133-englishmen [I]0-i suppose [you]2987-you have to be alone in [the room]401-the room for [them]1133-englishmen to do that ; [they]1133-englishmen have not the least idea , like [the French]2989-the french , of managing while [they]1133-englishmen are speaking out loud about something else . [Every one]428-every one looks very anxious here when [they]428-every one play ; it is not at all a joke as [the roulette]2991-the roulette used to be at [Nazeby]8-nazeby ; and [they]1133-englishmen do put a lot on , although counters do n't seem to be much to look at . It is not at all a difficult game , [Mamma]132-mamma , and [some of [the people]1439-the people]2992-some of the people were so lucky turning up " naturels , "[132-mamma] but [we]2994-we lost in spite of [them]2992-some of the people at [our]2994-we side of the table , and [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine said at last , that it was because [we]2994-we — [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and [I]0-i — were sitting together . [Valmond]126-lord valmond looked angry , but [he]126-lord valmond chaffed back . [I]0-i do n't know what it was all about , and [I]0-i was getting so sleepy , that when a fresh deal was going to begin [I]0-i asked [Octavia]150-octavia , who was near , if [I]0-i might not go to bed . [She]150-octavia nodded , so [I]0-i slipped away . "[126-lord valmond] A Good - night And [I]0-i also will say good - night to [you]0-i , [Mamma]132-mamma , or [I]0-i shall look ugly to - morrow for the ball.—Love from [[your]0-i affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Foljambe Place]104-foljambe place , 16th November . Bad Weather Dearest [Mamma,—I]114-mamma,—i have just come up to dress for tea , but [I]0-i find it is earlier than [I]0-i thought , so [I]0-i shall have time to tell [you]0-i about to - day . It has absolutely poured with rain and sleet and snow and blown a gale from the moment [we]2994-we woke this morning until now — quite the most horrid weather [I]0-i ever remember . [All the men]1076-all the men were in such tempers , as it was impossible to shoot . [Mr. Murray - Hartley]366-honour mr. murray - hartley had prepared thousands of tame pheasants for [them]1076-all the men , [Tom]338-tom said , although this was n't to be a big shoot , only to amuse [them]1076-all the men by the way ; and [they]1076-all the men were all looking forward to a regular slaughter . [Octavia]150-octavia , and [I]0-i , and [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby , were among [the few women down to breakfast besides [[our]2994-we hostess]3001-our hostess , who is so bright and cheery in the morning]3000-the few women down to breakfast besides our hostess , who is so bright and cheery in the morning ; and when [you]0-i think how morose [English people]1009-english people are until lunch time it is a great quality . [Some of [the men]450-the men]3003-some of the men came down ready to start , and these were [the ones in the worst humour]3005-the ones in the worst humour . After breakfast [half of [them]3003-some of the men]3006-half of them disappeared to [the stables]3187-the stables , and [the rest]469-the rest played " Bridge , "[469-the rest] except [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond and [Mr. Hodgkinson]339-mr. hodgkinson , who wanted to stay with [us]2994-we , only [we]2994-we would not have [them]3009-them , so [we]2994-we were left to [ourselves]2994-we more or less . An Amusing [Mistake Mrs. Murray - Hartley]370-mrs. murray - hartley took [us]2994-we to see the pictures and the collections of china and miniatures ; and [she]3010-she talks about them all just like a book , and calls [them]3011-them simple little things , and [you]0-i would never have guessed they cost thousands , and that [she]3010-she had not been used to them always , until [she]3010-she showed [us]2994-we a beautiful enamel of [Madame de Pompadour]371-madame de pompadour , and called it [the Princesse de Lamballe]372-the princesse de lamballe , and said so sympathetically that it was quite too melancholy to think [she]3010-she had been hacked to pieces in the Revolution ; only perhaps it served [her]3010-she right for saying " Après moi le déluge ! "[3010-she] . [Octavia]150-octavia was in fits , and [I]0-i wonder [no one]744-no one noticed it . Then [she]150-octavia said [she]150-octavia must leave [us]2994-we for a little in [the music - room]3013-the music - room , as [she]150-octavia always went to see [[her]150-octavia children]2512-her children at this hour — [they]2512-her children live in [another wing]3015-another wing . [Gossip]373-gossip By that time [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold , and [most of [the others]487-the others]3016-most of the others were down , and some of [them]487-the others looked as if [they]3016-most of the others had been up awfully late . It seems [they]487-the others did not finish the baccarat until half - past three , and that [Lord Oldfield]365-lord oldfield won more than a thousand pounds . [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]370-mrs. murray - hartley had hardly got out of the door , when [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine said what [a beautiful woman]3018-a beautiful woman [she]133-lady doraine was , and [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold began " yes and such tact , "[342-lady greswold] and [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby said , " and so charming , "[178-lady bobby] and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia — who was doing ribbon work on a small frame that sounds like a drum every time [you]3019-you put the needle through — looked up and drawled in [her]116-lady cecilia voice right up at the top , " Yes , [I]116-lady cecilia have noticed [very rich people]3211-very rich people always are . "[116-lady cecilia] Then [they]487-the others all talked at once , and by listening carefully [one]658-one made out that [they]487-the others were saying a nice thing about [every one]428-every one , only with a different ending to it , like : " [she]133-lady doraine is perfectly devey but what a pity [she]133-lady doraine makes [herself]133-lady doraine so remarkable , "[487-the others] and " [Darling Florrie]374-darling florrie , of course [she]133-lady doraine is as straight as a die , but wearing those gowns so much too young for [her]133-lady doraine , and with that very French figure , it does give [people]411-people a wrong impression , "[487-the others] and " It is extraordinary luck for [dear Rosie]375-dear rosie , [[her]375-dear rosie husband]475-her husband 's dying before [he]475-her husband knew anything . "[487-the others] [I]0-i suppose it is all right , [Mamma]132-mamma , but it sounds to [me]0-i like giving back - handers . [The French women]3022-the french women never talked like this ; [they]3022-the french women were witty and amusing and polite , just the same as if [the men]450-the men were in [the room]401-the room . [The Gossips]376-the gossips Rebuked [Octavia]150-octavia did not join in it , but read the papers , and when [they]376-the gossips got round to [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]370-mrs. murray - hartley again , and this time simply clawed [her]370-mrs. murray - hartley to pieces , [Octavia]150-octavia looked up and said in a downright way , " Oh ! come , [we]376-the gossips need none of [us]376-the gossips have known [this woman]3214-this woman unless [we]376-the gossips liked , and [we]376-the gossips are all getting the quid pro quo out of [her]3214-this woman , so for goodness ' sake let [us]376-the gossips leave [her]3214-this woman alone . "[150-octavia] That raised a perfect storm , [they]376-the gossips denied having said a word and were quite indignant at the idea of getting anything out of [her]150-octavia ; but " It 's all bosh , "[150-octavia] [Octavia]150-octavia said , " [I]150-octavia am [here]391-here because it is [the nearest house to the Grassfield ball]3216-the nearest house to the grassfield ball , and the whole thing amuses [me]150-octavia , and [I]150-octavia suppose [you]376-the gossips all have [your]376-the gossips reasons . "[150-octavia] [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine looked at [her]150-octavia out of the corner of [her]133-lady doraine eyes , and said in [her]133-lady doraine purry voice , " [Darling Octavia]377-octavia — [you]377-octavia are so original , "[133-lady doraine] and then [she]133-lady doraine turned the conversation in the neatest way . [Octavia]377-octavia 's Philosophy [Octavia]377-octavia said to [me]0-i , as [we]3025-we went [upstairs]470-upstairs before lunch , that [they]3027-they were a set of cats and harpies , and [she]377-octavia hated them all , only unfortunately the others — [the nice good ones — taken en bloc]3028-the nice good ones — taken en bloc made things so dull , it was better to put up with this set . Then [she]377-octavia kissed [me]0-i as [I]0-i went into [[my]0-i room]631-my room and said ; " At this time of [the world]476-the world 's day , [[my]377-octavia little [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth]3218-my little elizabeth , there is no use in fighting windmills . "[377-octavia] At luncheon [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond sat next to [me]0-i ; [he]126-lord valmond said [we]3025-we had been horrid not to have wanted [him]126-lord valmond to spend the morning with [us]3025-we , and would [I]0-i let [him]126-lord valmond teach [me]0-i " Bridge "[126-lord valmond] afterwards ? [I]0-i said [I]0-i really was not a bit interested in cards , but [he]126-lord valmond said it was a delightful game , so [I]0-i said All right . After lunch in [the saloon]2913-the saloon [I]0-i overheard [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]370-mrs. murray - hartley say to [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold that [she]342-lady greswold feared this awful weather would make [her]342-lady greswold party a failure , and what was [she]342-lady greswold to do to amuse [them]3031-their this afternoon ? So [Lady Greswold]342-lady greswold said : " Leave ['em]3219-'em alone with plenty of opportunities to talk to [[their]3031-their friends]3220-their friends , and it will be all right . "[342-lady greswold] And so [she]342-lady greswold did . An Afternoon at Cards [[Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond]3032-lord valmond and [I]0-i found a nice little table in a corner by the fire , and [we]3033-we began to turn over the cards , and presently every one disappeared , except [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine and [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz , who played Patience or something , beyond one of the Spanish leather screens ; and [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby and [Lord Oldfield]365-lord oldfield , who were smoking cigarettes together on the big sofa . [We]3033-we could just hear [their]3031-their voices murmuring . [You]3034-you ca n't play " Bridge "[3034-you] with [only two people]3035-only two people , [I]0-i find , and when [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond had explained the principles to [me]0-i , [I]0-i was none the wiser . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i was thinking of something else , and [he]126-lord valmond said [I]0-i was a stupid little thing , but in such a nice voice , and then [we]3033-we talked and did not worry about the cards . But after a while [he]126-lord valmond said [he]126-lord valmond thought it was draughty for [me]0-i in [the saloon]2913-the saloon , and it would be cosier in [one of [the sitting - rooms]3038-the sitting - rooms]3037-one of the sitting - rooms , but [I]0-i would not go , [Mamma]132-mamma , as [I]0-i did not find it at all cold . [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine intrudes Then [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine came in , and went over and disturbed [everybody]404-everybody in turn , and finally sat down by [us]3033-we , and [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby laughed out loud , and [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine peeped round the screen with [her]133-lady doraine mischievous tortoise - shell cat expression , so [I]0-i just said [I]0-i would go and dress for tea , and came [upstairs]470-upstairs . [I]0-i am sure [they]3041-they were all trying to make [me]0-i feel uncomfortable , but [I]0-i did n't a bit . [Octavia]377-octavia wants [me]0-i to wear [my]0-i only other new ball dress to - night , the white gauze , so [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must , and [I]0-i do hope the rain will stop before [we]3042-we start.—With love from [[your]3043-you affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Foljambe Place]104-foljambe place , Wednesday . [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh d'Eynecourt [Dearest Mamma,—Octavia]380-dearest mamma,—octavia is writing to [you]3043-you , and [we]3042-we have such a piece of news for [you]3043-you ! [I]0-i will tell [you]3043-you presently . Part of the ball last night was quite delightful , and fortunately the rain had stopped before [we]3042-we started , in fact , [I]0-i saw the stars shining when [I]0-i looked out on [my]0-i way down to tea . [A new man]3048-a new man had arrived , [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh d'Eynecourt , [I]0-i remember [you]3043-you have often spoken of [him]3048-a new man . [He]3048-a new man is nice - looking though quite old , over forty , [I]0-i should think . It appears [he]3048-a new man has been away from [the world]476-the world for more than two years ; [he]3048-a new man has only come to this party now because [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby made [him]3048-a new man ; [he]3048-a new man met [her]178-lady bobby lately , and is [a great friend of [hers]178-lady bobby]3050-a great friend of hers . [The other men]3051-the other men , [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine , & c. , were chaffing [him]3048-a new man by the fireplace — [no one else]1407-no one else was down — and [they]3051-the other men did say such odd things . [Tom]338-tom asked [him]3048-a new man why [he]3048-a new man had disappeared for so long , and [he]3048-a new man said , Time was , when — if [one]658-one stuck to [[one]658-one 's own class]3055-one 's own class — to live and love was within the reach of [any gentleman]3056-any gentleman , but since the fashion of the long strings of pearls came in , it had become more expensive than the other class , and [he]3048-a new man could not compete with [Jews]3057-jews and [financiers]3058-financiers , so [he]3048-a new man had gone to live quietly in [Paris]19-paris . [I]0-i do n't know what it meant , but it seemed to amuse [them]3051-the other men all awfully . [The Perfect Height]3059-the perfect height When [they]3051-the other men saw [me]0-i sitting on the sofa [they]3051-the other men stopped talking at once , and then began about how horrid the day had been ; and [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh was introduced and asked about [you]0-i . [He]379-sir hugh said [I]0-i was not nearly so pretty as [you]0-i had been at [my]0-i age , but [I]0-i should do , [he]379-sir hugh dared say . Then when [I]0-i stood up , and [he]379-sir hugh saw [my]0-i height , [he]379-sir hugh said that [he]379-sir hugh had always thought five foot seven a perfect measure for [women]726-women , so [I]0-i said [I]0-i did feel disappointed , as [I]0-i was only five foot six and three - quarters ; [he]379-sir hugh laughed and whispered , " Oh yes , [I]379-sir hugh am sure [you]0-i will do — very well indeed . "[379-sir hugh] [He]379-sir hugh is charming , and [he]379-sir hugh says [he]379-sir hugh will be [an uncle to [me]0-i]3061-an uncle to me . At tea [Octavia]377-octavia and [he]379-sir hugh and [I]0-i sat on the big sofa , and [Lady Bobby]178-lady bobby did not like it a bit . [She]178-lady bobby tried to talk to [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond , who was fidgeting about , looking as cross as a bear ; but [he]379-sir hugh would not stay still long enough to have any conversation . [The Quarrel]381-the quarrel As [we]3062-we were going [upstairs]470-upstairs afterwards , [he]379-sir hugh ran after [me]0-i and said [he]379-sir hugh must tell [me]0-i that [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh was not at all the kind of man [I]0-i ought to talk so much to , and would [I]0-i promise [him]379-sir hugh the first dance to - night ? [I]0-i said No , that [I]0-i was going to give it to [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh , and that [he]379-sir hugh had better mind [his]379-sir hugh own business or [I]0-i would not dance with [him]379-sir hugh at all . [I]0-i was not really angry , [Mamma]132-mamma — because [he]379-sir hugh is so nice - looking — but [one]658-one is obliged to be firm with [men]725-men , as [I]0-i am sure [you]132-mamma know . [He]379-sir hugh turned round and stamped down [the stairs]3066-the stairs again , without a word , in a passion . At dinner , which [I]0-i went in to with [Mr. Wertz]125-mr. wertz , [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh was at the other side , and [you]132-mamma ca n't think how friendly [we]3067-we got . [He]379-sir hugh says [I]0-i am [the sweetest little darling [he]379-sir hugh has seen in a month of Sundays]3068-the sweetest little darling he has seen in a month of sundays . [I]0-i kept catching sight of [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond 's face between the flowers — [he]379-sir hugh had taken in [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]370-mrs. murray - hartley — and it was alternately so cross and unhappy looking , that [he]379-sir hugh must have had violent indigestion . [We]3067-we went to the ball in omnibuses and broughams , the usual thing ; but [Octavia]377-octavia took care that [I]0-i sat between [her]377-octavia and [Lady Cecilia]116-lady cecilia . [Mrs. Murray - Hartley]370-mrs. murray - hartley was so beautifully dressed , and [her]370-mrs. murray - hartley jewels were superb , and everything in very good taste . [She]370-mrs. murray - hartley is really [a very agreeable woman]3069-a very agreeable woman to talk to , [Mamma]132-mamma , and one ca n't blame [her]370-mrs. murray - hartley for wanting to be in [Society]3070-society . It must be so much nicer than [Bayswater]111-bayswater , where [they]3071-they came from , and [Octavia]377-octavia says it proves [her]377-octavia intelligence ; it is easier to rise from the gutter than from [the suburbs]3072-the suburbs . [Everybody]404-everybody had arrived when [[our]3067-we party]1313-our party got to the ball . [The Rooses]3075-the rooses are staying at [Pennythorn]112-pennythorn , and [Jane]127-jane roose came and said to [me]0-i at once how sorry [she]127-jane roose was to see [me]0-i looking pale , and [she]127-jane roose hoped [I]0-i would be able to enjoy [myself]0-i — [I]0-i was n't pale , [Mamma]132-mamma , [I]0-i am sure , but [I]0-i did feel just a teeny bit sorry [I]0-i had quarrelled again with [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond . [He]126-lord valmond never came near [me]0-i , and everything seemed to be at sixes and sevens ; [people]411-people got cross because [I]0-i mixed up [their]411-people dances quite unintentionally , and , [I]0-i do n't know why , [I]0-i did not enjoy [myself]0-i a bit , in spite of [Sir Hugh]379-sir hugh saying every sort of lovely thing to [me]0-i . [I]0-i had supper with [him]126-lord valmond , and [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond was near with [Lady Doraine]133-lady doraine , and [she]133-lady doraine was being so nice to [him]126-lord valmond , [Mamma]132-mamma , leaning over and looking into [his]126-lord valmond eyes , and [I]0-i do n't think it good form , do [you]132-mamma ? Two or three dances afterwards , when [we]3077-we went back to [the ballroom]2806-the ballroom , there was a polka ; [I]0-i danced it with [some idiot who almost at once let yards and yards of [my]0-i gauze frills]3079-some idiot who almost at once let yards and yards of my gauze frills get torn , so [I]0-i was obliged to go to [the cloak - room]3080-the cloak - room to have it pinned up . An Unpleasant Incident It was a long way off , and when [I]0-i came out [[my]0-i partner]2400-my partner had disappeared , and there was [no one]744-no one about but [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine , and the moment [I]0-i saw [him]2400-my partner [I]0-i hated the look in [his]2400-my partner eyes , they seemed all swimming ; and [he]2400-my partner said in such a nasty fat voice : " [Little darling]3222-little darling , [I]2400-my partner have sent [[your]3222-little darling partner]3223-your partner away , and [I]2400-my partner am waiting for [you]3222-little darling , come and sit out with [me]2400-my partner among the palms , "[2400-my partner] and [I]0-i do n't know why , but [I]0-i felt frightened , and so [I]0-i said , " No ! "[0-i] that [I]0-i was going back to [the ballroom]2806-the ballroom . And [he]2400-my partner got nearer and nearer , and caught hold of [my]0-i arm , and said , " No , no , [you]3222-little darling shall not unless [you]3222-little darling give [me]2400-my partner a kiss first . "[2400-my partner] And [he]2400-my partner would not let [me]0-i pass . [I]0-i ca n't imagine why , [Mamma]132-mamma , but [I]0-i never felt so frightened in [my]0-i life ; and just then , walking aimlessly down [the passage]3084-the passage , came [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond . [He]126-lord valmond saw [us]3085-we and came up quickly , and [I]0-i was so glad to see [some one]717-some one , that [I]0-i ran to [him]126-lord valmond , as [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine let [me]0-i pass directly [he]2400-my partner caught sight of [Harry]117-harry — [I]0-i mean [Lord Valmond]126-lord valmond — and [he]2400-my partner was in such a rage when [he]2400-my partner saw how [I]0-i was trembling , and said , " What has [that brute]3224-that brute been saying to [you]0-i ? "[2400-my partner] and looked as if [he]2400-my partner wanted to go back and fight [him]2400-my partner ; but [I]0-i was so terrified that [I]0-i could only say , " Do come away ! "[0-i] The Engagement [We]3085-we went and sat in [the palm place]3087-the palm place , and there was [not a soul there]3088-not a soul there , as [every one]428-every one was dancing ; and [I]0-i really do n't know how it happened , [I]0-i was so upset about that horrid [Lord Doraine]340-lord doraine , that [Harry]117-harry tried to comfort [me]0-i , and [we]3085-we made up [our]3085-we quarrel , and — [he]117-harry kissed [me]0-i again — and [I]0-i hope [you]0-i wo n't be very cross , [Mamma]132-mamma ; but somehow [I]0-i did not feel at all angry this time . And [I]0-i thought [he]117-harry was fond of [Mrs. Smith]119-mrs. smith ; but it is n't , it 's [Me]0-i ! And [we]3085-we are engaged . And [Octavia]377-octavia is writing to [you]0-i . And [I]0-i hope [you]0-i wo n't mind . And the post is off , so no more.—From [[your]0-i affectionate daughter]516-your affectionate daughter , [Elizabeth]113-elizabeth . [Victorine]191-victorine is outdone P.S.—I shall get married before [the Drawing Room]3091-the drawing room in February , because then [I]0-i can wear a tiara .
